NuttX Configuration Variables

Last Updated: July 31, 2013

Table of Contents
  • 1 Menu: Main
  • 1.1 Menu: Build Setup
    • Expand
    • 1.1.1 CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL: Prompt for development and/or incomplete code/drivers
    • 1.1.2 Choice: Build Host Platform
    • 1.1.3 Choice: Windows Build Environment
    • 1.1.4 CONFIG_WINDOWS_MKLINK: Use mklink
    • 1.1.5 Menu: Build Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.1.5.1 CONFIG_APPS_DIR: Application directory
      • 1.1.5.2 CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS: Two pass build
      • 1.1.5.3 CONFIG_PASS1_TARGET: Pass one target
      • 1.1.5.4 CONFIG_PASS1_BUILDIR: Pass one build directory
      • 1.1.5.5 CONFIG_PASS1_OBJECT: Pass one object
      • 1.1.5.6 CONFIG_NUTTX_KERNEL: NuttX kernel build
      • 1.1.5.7 CONFIG_NUTTX_USERSPACE: Beginning of user-space blob
    • 1.1.6 Menu: Binary Output Formats
      • Expand
      • 1.1.6.1 CONFIG_RRLOAD_BINARY: rrload binary format
      • 1.1.6.2 CONFIG_INTELHEX_BINARY: Intel HEX binary format
      • 1.1.6.3 CONFIG_MOTOROLA_SREC: Motorola S-Record binary format
      • 1.1.6.4 CONFIG_RAW_BINARY: Raw binary format
    • 1.1.7 Menu: Customize Header Files
      • Expand
      • 1.1.7.1 CONFIG_ARCH_STDBOOL_H: stdbool.h
      • 1.1.7.2 CONFIG_ARCH_MATH_H: math.h
      • 1.1.7.3 CONFIG_ARCH_FLOAT_H: float.h
      • 1.1.7.4 CONFIG_ARCH_STDARG_H: stdarg.h
    • 1.1.8 Menu: Debug Options
      • Expand

      • 1.1.8.2 CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE: Enable Debug Verbose Output
      • 1.1.8.3 CONFIG_DEBUG_MM: Enable Memory Manager Debug Output

      • 1.1.8.9 CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB: Enable C Library Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_BINFMT: Enable Binary Loader Debug Output

      • 1.1.8.12 CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSCALL: Enable SYSCALL Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.13 CONFIG_DEBUG_LCD: Enable Low-level LCD Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.14 CONFIG_DEBUG_LEDS: Enable Low-level LED Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.15 CONFIG_DEBUG_INPUT: Enable Input Device Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.16 CONFIG_DEBUG_ANALOG: Enable Analog Device Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.17 CONFIG_DEBUG_I2C: Enable I2C Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.18 CONFIG_DEBUG_SPI: Enable SPI Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.19 CONFIG_DEBUG_CAN: Enable CAN Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.20 CONFIG_DEBUG_SDIO: Enable SDIO Debug Output

      • 1.1.8.22 CONFIG_DEBUG_DMA: Enable DMA Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.23 CONFIG_DEBUG_WATCHDOG: Enable Watchdog Timer Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.24 CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO: Enable Audio Device Debug Output
      • 1.1.8.25 CONFIG_DEBUG_SYMBOLS: Enable Debug Symbols

    • 1.2.72 Menu: Ethernet driver options
      • Expand
      • 1.2.72.1 CONFIG_PHY_AUTONEG: Autonegiation
      • 1.2.72.2 CONFIG_PHY_SPEED100: 100Mbit/Sec
      • 1.2.72.3 CONFIG_PHY_FDUPLEX: Full duplex
      • 1.2.72.4 CONFIG_NET_EMACRAM_SIZE: EMAC RAM Size
      • 1.2.72.5 CONFIG_NET_NTXDESC: Number of Tx descriptors
      • 1.2.72.6 CONFIG_NET_NRXDESC: Number of Rx descriptors
      • 1.2.72.7 CONFIG_NET_PRIORITY: Ethernet interrupt priority
      • 1.2.72.8 CONFIG_NET_WOL: Wake-up on LAN
      • 1.2.72.9 CONFIG_NET_REGDEBUG: Ethernet register-level debug
      • 1.2.72.10 CONFIG_NET_DUMPPACKET: Enable packet dumping
      • 1.2.72.11 CONFIG_NET_HASH: Hashing
      • 1.2.72.12 CONFIG_NET_MULTICAST: Multicast
    • 1.2.73 Menu: LCD device driver options
      • Expand
      • 1.2.73.1 CONFIG_LPC17_LCD_VRAMBASE: Video RAM base address
      • 1.2.73.2 CONFIG_LPC17_LCD_REFRESH_FREQ: LCD refesh rate (Hz)
      • 1.2.73.3 CONFIG_LPC17_LCD_BACKLIGHT: Enable backlight
      • 1.2.73.4 CONFIG_LPC17_LCD_TFTPANEL: TFT Panel
      • 1.2.73.5 CONFIG_LPC17_LCD_MONOCHROME: Monochrome LCD
      • 1.2.73.6 Choice: Bits per pixel
      • 1.2.73.7 CONFIG_LPC17_LCD_BACKCOLOR: Initial background color

  • 1.4 Menu: RTOS Features
    • Expand
    • 1.4.1 CONFIG_BOARD_INITIALIZE: Custom board/driver initialization
    • 1.4.2 CONFIG_MSEC_PER_TICK: Milliseconds per system timer tick
    • 1.4.3 CONFIG_RR_INTERVAL: Round robin timeslice (MSEC)
    • 1.4.4 CONFIG_SCHED_INSTRUMENTATION: Monitor system performance
    • 1.4.5 CONFIG_TASK_NAME_SIZE: Maximum task name size
    • 1.4.6 CONFIG_SCHED_HAVE_PARENT: Support parent/child task relationships
    • 1.4.7 CONFIG_SCHED_CHILD_STATUS: Retain child exit status
    • 1.4.8 CONFIG_PREALLOC_CHILDSTATUS: Number of pre-allocated child status
    • 1.4.9 CONFIG_DEBUG_CHILDSTATUS: Enable Child Status Debug Output
    • 1.4.10 CONFIG_JULIAN_TIME: Enables Julian time conversions
    • 1.4.11 CONFIG_START_YEAR: Start year
    • 1.4.12 CONFIG_START_MONTH: Start month
    • 1.4.13 CONFIG_START_DAY: Start day
    • 1.4.14 CONFIG_DEV_CONSOLE: Enable /dev/console
    • 1.4.15 CONFIG_MUTEX_TYPES:: Enable mutex types
    • 1.4.16 CONFIG_PRIORITY_INHERITANCE: Enable priority inheritance
    • 1.4.17 CONFIG_SEM_PREALLOCHOLDERS: Number of pre-allocated holders
    • 1.4.18 CONFIG_SEM_NNESTPRIO: Maximum number of higher priority threads
    • 1.4.19 CONFIG_FDCLONE_DISABLE: Disable cloning of file descriptors
    • 1.4.20 CONFIG_FDCLONE_STDIO: Disable clone file descriptors without stdio
    • 1.4.21 CONFIG_SDCLONE_DISABLE: Disable cloning of socket descriptors
    • 1.4.22 CONFIG_SCHED_WAITPID: Enable waitpid() API
    • 1.4.23 CONFIG_SCHED_STARTHOOK: Enable startup hook
    • 1.4.24 CONFIG_SCHED_ATEXIT: Enable atexit() API
    • 1.4.25 CONFIG_SCHED_ATEXIT_MAX: Max number of atexit() functions
    • 1.4.26 CONFIG_SCHED_ONEXIT: Enable on_exit() API
    • 1.4.27 CONFIG_SCHED_ONEXIT_MAX: Max number of on_exit() functions
    • 1.4.28 CONFIG_USER_ENTRYPOINT: Application entry point
    • 1.4.29 CONFIG_DISABLE_OS_API: Disable NuttX interfaces
    • 1.4.30 CONFIG_DISABLE_CLOCK: Disable clock interfaces
    • 1.4.31 CONFIG_DISABLE_POSIX_TIMERS: Disable POSIX timers
    • 1.4.32 CONFIG_DISABLE_PTHREAD: Disable pthread support
    • 1.4.33 CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS: Disable signal support
    • 1.4.34 CONFIG_DISABLE_MQUEUE: Disable POSIX message queue support
    • 1.4.35 CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON: Disable environment variable support
    • 1.4.36 CONFIG_SIG_SIGUSR1: SIGUSR1
    • 1.4.37 CONFIG_SIG_SIGUSR2: SIGUSR2
    • 1.4.38 CONFIG_SIG_SIGALARM: SIGALRM
    • 1.4.39 CONFIG_SIG_SIGCHLD: SIGCHLD
    • 1.4.40 CONFIG_SIG_SIGCONDTIMEDOUT: SIGCONDTIMEDOUT
    • 1.4.41 CONFIG_SIG_SIGWORK: SIGWORK
    • 1.4.42 CONFIG_MAX_TASKS: Max number of tasks
    • 1.4.43 CONFIG_MAX_TASK_ARGS: Maximum number of task arguments
    • 1.4.44 CONFIG_NPTHREAD_KEYS: Maximum number of pthread keys
    • 1.4.45 CONFIG_NFILE_DESCRIPTORS: Maximum number of file descriptors per task
    • 1.4.46 CONFIG_NFILE_STREAMS: Maximum number of FILE streams
    • 1.4.47 CONFIG_NAME_MAX: Maximum size of a file name
    • 1.4.48 CONFIG_PREALLOC_MQ_MSGS: Number of pre-allocated messages
    • 1.4.49 CONFIG_MQ_MAXMSGSIZE: Maximum message size
    • 1.4.50 CONFIG_MAX_WDOGPARMS: Maximum number of watchdog parameters
    • 1.4.51 CONFIG_PREALLOC_WDOGS: Number of pre-allocated watchdog timers
    • 1.4.52 CONFIG_PREALLOC_TIMERS: Number of pre-allocated POSIX timers
    • 1.4.53 CONFIG_IDLETHREAD_STACKSIZE: Idle thread stack size
    • 1.4.54 CONFIG_USERMAIN_STACKSIZE: Main thread stack size
    • 1.4.55 CONFIG_PTHREAD_STACK_MIN: Minimum pthread stack size
    • 1.4.56 CONFIG_PTHREAD_STACK_DEFAULT: Default pthread stack size
    • 1.4.57 CONFIG_SYS_RESERVED: Number of reserved system calls
    • 1.4.58 CONFIG_SYS_NNEST: Number of nested system calls
  • 1.5 Menu: Device Drivers
    • Expand
    • 1.5.1 CONFIG_DISABLE_POLL: Disable driver poll interfaces
    • 1.5.2 CONFIG_DEV_NULL: Enable /dev/null
    • 1.5.3 CONFIG_DEV_ZERO: Enable /dev/zero
    • 1.5.4 CONFIG_DEV_RANDOM: Enable /dev/random
    • 1.5.5 CONFIG_LOOP: Enable loop device

      • 1.5.276.3 CONFIG_UART3_BAUD: BAUD rate
      • 1.5.276.4 CONFIG_UART3_BITS: Character size
      • 1.5.276.5 CONFIG_UART3_PARITY: Parity setting
      • 1.5.276.6 CONFIG_UART3_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits
      • 1.5.276.7 CONFIG_UART3_IFLOWCONTROL: UART3 RTS flow control
      • 1.5.276.8 CONFIG_UART3_OFLOWCONTROL: UART3 CTS flow control

    • 1.5.314 CONFIG_PL2303_NRDREQS: Number of write requests that can be in flight

    • 1.5.316 CONFIG_PL2303_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size
    • 1.5.317 CONFIG_PL2303_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

    • 1.8.21 CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER: Multi-user NX Server
    • 1.8.22 CONFIG_NX_BLOCKING: Blocking
    • 1.8.23 CONFIG_NX_MXSERVERMSGS: Max Server Messages
    • 1.8.24 CONFIG_NX_MXCLIENTMSGS: Max Client Messages
  • 1.9 Menu: Memory Management
    • Expand
    • 1.9.1 CONFIG_MM_MULTIHEAP: Build support for multiple heaps
    • 1.9.2 CONFIG_MM_KERNEL_HEAP: Support a protected, kernel heap
    • 1.9.3 CONFIG_MM_KERNEL_HEAPSIZE: Kernal heap size
    • 1.9.4 CONFIG_MM_SMALL: Small memory model
    • 1.9.5 CONFIG_MM_REGIONS: Number of memory regions
    • 1.9.6 CONFIG_HEAP2_BASE: Start address of second user heap region
    • 1.9.7 CONFIG_HEAP2_SIZE: Size of the second user heap region
    • 1.9.8 CONFIG_GRAN: Enable Granule Allocator
    • 1.9.9 CONFIG_GRAN_SINGLE: Single Granule Allocator
    • 1.9.10 CONFIG_GRAN_INTR: Interrupt level support
    • 1.9.11 CONFIG_DEBUG_GRAN: Granule Allocator Debug
  • 1.10 Menu: Audio Support
    • Expand
    • 1.10.1 CONFIG_AUDIO: Audio Support
    • 1.10.2 CONFIG_AUDIO_NCHANNELS: Number of Audio Channels
    • 1.10.3 CONFIG_AUDIO_LARGE_BUFFERS: Support Audio Buffers with greater than 65K samples
    • 1.10.4 CONFIG_AUDIO_CUSTOM_DEV_PATH: Use custom device path
    • 1.10.5 CONFIG_AUDIO_DEV_ROOT: Place audio devices in /dev
    • 1.10.6 CONFIG_AUDIO_DEV_PATH: Base path for Audio devices
    • 1.10.7 Menu: Supported Audio Formats
      • Expand
      • 1.10.7.1 CONFIG_AUDIO_FORMAT_PCM: PCM Audio
      • 1.10.7.2 CONFIG_AUDIO_FORMAT_MP3: MPEG 3 Layer 1
      • 1.10.7.3 CONFIG_AUDIO_FORMAT_WMA: WMA Format (see copyright notice)
      • 1.10.7.4 CONFIG_AUDIO_FORMAT_OGG_VORBIS: Ogg Vorbis format
    • 1.10.8 CONFIG_AUDIO_MIXER: Planned - Enable support for the software based Audio Mixer
    • 1.10.9 CONFIG_AUDIO_MIDI_SYNTH: Planned - Enable support for the software-based MIDI synthisizer
    • 1.10.10 CONFIG_AUDIO_OUTPUT_JACK_CONTROL: Planned - Enable support for output jack control
    • 1.10.11 CONFIG_AUDIO_FONT: Planned - Enable support for the Audio Font
  • 1.11 Menu: Binary Formats
    • Expand
    • 1.11.1 CONFIG_BINFMT_DISABLE: Disble BINFMT support
    • 1.11.2 CONFIG_BINFMT_EXEPATH: Support PATH variable
    • 1.11.3 CONFIG_PATH_INITIAL: Initial PATH Value

    • 1.11.11 CONFIG_ELF_DUMPBUFFER: Dump ELF buffers
    • 1.11.12 CONFIG_BUILTIN: Support Builtin Applications
    • 1.11.13 CONFIG_BINFMT_CONSTRUCTORS: C++ Static Constructor Support
    • 1.11.14 CONFIG_SYMTAB_ORDEREDBYNAME: Symbol Tables Ordered by Name
  • 1.12 Menu: Library Routines
    • Expand
    • 1.12.1 CONFIG_STDIO_BUFFER_SIZE: C STDIO buffer size
    • 1.12.2 CONFIG_STDIO_LINEBUFFER: STDIO line buffering
    • 1.12.3 CONFIG_NUNGET_CHARS: Number unget() characters
    • 1.12.4 CONFIG_LIB_HOMEDIR: Home directory
    • 1.12.5 CONFIG_LIBM: Standard Math library
    • 1.12.6 CONFIG_NOPRINTF_FIELDWIDTH: Disable sprintf support fieldwidth
    • 1.12.7 CONFIG_LIBC_FLOATINGPOINT: Enable floating point in printf
    • 1.12.8 CONFIG_LIB_RAND_ORDER: Order of the random number generate
    • 1.12.9 Choice: Newline Options
    • 1.12.10 CONFIG_LIBC_EXECFUNCS: Enable exec[l|v] / posix_spawn() Support
    • 1.12.11 CONFIG_EXECFUNCS_SYMTAB: Symbol table used by exec[l|v]
    • 1.12.12 CONFIG_EXECFUNCS_NSYMBOLS: Number of Symbols in the Table
    • 1.12.13 CONFIG_POSIX_SPAWN_PROXY_STACKSIZE: Spawn Stack Size
    • 1.12.14 CONFIG_TASK_SPAWN_DEFAULT_STACKSIZE: Default task_spawn Stack Size
    • 1.12.15 CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR: Enable strerror
    • 1.12.16 CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR_SHORT: Use short error descriptions in strerror()
    • 1.12.17 CONFIG_LIBC_PERROR_STDOUT: perror() to stdout
    • 1.12.18 CONFIG_ARCH_LOWPUTC: Low-level console output
    • 1.12.19 CONFIG_LIB_SENDFILE_BUFSIZE: sendfile() buffer size
    • 1.12.20 CONFIG_ARCH_ROMGETC: Support for ROM string access
    • 1.12.21 CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS: Enable arch optimized functions
    • 1.12.22 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMCPY: memcpy()
    • 1.12.23 CONFIG_MEMCPY_VIK: Vik memcpy()
    • 1.12.24 CONFIG_MEMCPY_PRE_INC_PTRS: Pre-increment pointers
    • 1.12.25 CONFIG_MEMCPY_INDEXED_COPY: Array indexing
    • 1.12.26 CONFIG_MEMCPY_64BIT: 64-bit memcpy()
    • 1.12.27 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMCMP: memcmp()
    • 1.12.28 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMMOVE: memmove()
    • 1.12.29 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMSET: memset()
    • 1.12.30 CONFIG_MEMSET_OPTSPEED: Optimize memset() for speed
    • 1.12.31 CONFIG_MEMSET_64BIT: 64-bit memset()
    • 1.12.32 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCHR: strchr()
    • 1.12.33 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCMP: strcmp()
    • 1.12.34 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCPY: strcpy()
    • 1.12.35 CONFIG_ARCH_STRNCPY: strncpy()
    • 1.12.36 CONFIG_ARCH_STRLEN: strlen
    • 1.12.37 CONFIG_ARCH_STRNLEN: strlen()
    • 1.12.38 CONFIG_ARCH_BZERO: bzero()
    • 1.12.39 CONFIG_SCHED_WORKQUEUE: Enable worker thread
    • 1.12.40 CONFIG_SCHED_HPWORK: High priority (kernel) worker thread
    • 1.12.41 CONFIG_SCHED_WORKPRIORITY: High priority worker thread priority
    • 1.12.42 CONFIG_SCHED_WORKPERIOD: High priority worker thread period
    • 1.12.43 CONFIG_SCHED_WORKSTACKSIZE: High priority worker thread stack size
    • 1.12.44 CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORK: Low priority (kernel) worker thread
    • 1.12.45 CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORKPRIORITY: Low priority worker thread priority
    • 1.12.46 CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORKPERIOD: Low priority worker thread period
    • 1.12.47 CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORKSTACKSIZE: Low priority worker thread stack size
    • 1.12.48 CONFIG_SCHED_USRWORK: User mode worker thread
    • 1.12.49 CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORKPRIORITY: User mode priority worker thread priority
    • 1.12.50 CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORKPERIOD: User mode worker thread period
    • 1.12.51 CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORKSTACKSIZE: User mode worker thread stack size
    • 1.12.52 CONFIG_LIB_KBDCODEC: Keyboard CODEC
    • 1.12.53 CONFIG_LIB_SLCDCODEC: Segment LCD CODEC
    • 1.12.54 CONFIG_C99_BOOL8: sizeof(_Bool) is 8-bits
    • 1.12.55 CONFIG_HAVE_CXX: Have C++ compiler
    • 1.12.56 CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE: Have C++ initialization
    • 1.12.57 CONFIG_CXX_NEWLONG: size_t is type long
    • 1.12.58 CONFIG_UCLIBCXX: Build uClibc++ (must be installed)
    • 1.12.59 CONFIG_UCLIBCXX_EXCEPTION: Enable Exception Suppport
    • 1.12.60 CONFIG_UCLIBCXX_IOSTREAM_BUFSIZE: IO Stream Buffer Size
    • 1.12.61 CONFIG_UCLIBCXX_HAVE_LIBSUPCXX: Have libsupc++ (required)

      • 1.13.8.25 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS: Custom Default Text colors

      • 1.13.8.27 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_ENABLEDTEXTCOLOR: Default Enabled Text Color
      • 1.13.8.28 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_SELECTEDTEXTCOLOR: Default Selected Text Color
      • 1.13.8.29 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_FONTCOLOR: Default Default Font Color
      • 1.13.8.30 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_TRANSPARENT_COLOR: Transparent Color
      • 1.13.8.31 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_FIRST_REPEAT_TIME: First Repeat Time
      • 1.13.8.32 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CONTINUE_REPEAT_TIME: Continue Repeat Time
      • 1.13.8.33 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DOUBLECLICK_TIME: Double Click Time
      • 1.13.8.34 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_KBDBUFFER_SIZE: Keybard Buffer Size
      • 1.13.8.35 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CURSORCONTROL_SIZE: Cursor Control Buffer Size
      • 1.13.8.36 CONFIG_NXWIDGET_MEMMONITOR: Memory Usage Monitor
      • 1.13.8.37 CONFIG_NXWM: Enable NxWM
      • 1.13.8.38 CONFIG_NXWM_SYSTEM_CUSTOM_FONTID: Use Custom Default Font
      • 1.13.8.39 CONFIG_NXWM_DEFAULT_FONTID: Font ID

      • 1.13.8.41 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS: Custom Default Fill Colors

      • 1.13.8.52 Choice: Taskbar Location

  • Appendix A: Hidden Configuration Variables

1 Menu: Main

Overview. The NuttX RTOS is highly configurable. The NuttX configuration files are maintained using the kconfig-frontends tool. That configuration tool uses Kconfig files that can be found through the NuttX source tree. Each Kconfig files contains declarations of configuration variables. Each configuration variable provides one configuration option for the NuttX RTOS. This configurable options are descrived in this document.

Main Menu. The normal way to start the NuttX configuration is to enter this command line from the NuttX build directory: make menuconfig. Note that NuttX must first be configured before this command so that the configuration file (.config) is present in the top-level build directory. The main menu is the name give to the opening menu display after this command is executed.

Mainenance Note. This documenation was auto-generated using the kconfig2html tool That tool analyzes the NuttX Kconfig files and generates this HTML document. This HTML document file should not be editted manually. In order to make changes to this document, you should instead modify the Kconfig file(s) that were used to generated this document and then execute the kconfig2html again to regenerate the HTML document file.

1.1 Menu: Build Setup

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.1 CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL: Prompt for development and/or incomplete code/drivers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.2 Choice: Build Host Platform

  • Default: HOST_LINUX
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_HOST_LINUX: Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_HOST_OSX: OSX

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS: Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_HOST_OTHER: Other

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.3 Choice: Windows Build Environment

  • Default: WINDOWS_CYGWIN
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE: Windows Native

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in a CMD.exe environment with Windows style paths (like C:\cgywin\home)

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_CYGWIN: Cygwin

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in a Cygwin environment with POSIX style paths (like /cygdrive/c/cgywin/home)

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_MSYS: MSYS

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in a Cygwin environment with POSIX style paths (like /cygdrive/c/cgywin/home)

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_OTHER: Windows POSIX-like environment

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in another POSIX-like environment. Additional support may be necessary

1.1.4 CONFIG_WINDOWS_MKLINK: Use mklink

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Use the mklink command to set up symbolic links when NuttX is configured. Otherwise, configuration directories will be copied to establish the configuration.

    If directories are copied, then some confusion can result ("Which version of the file did I modify?"). In that case, it is recommended that you re-build using 'make clean_context all'. That will cause the configured directories to be recopied on each build.

    NOTE: This option also (1) that you have administrator privileges, (2) that you are using Windows 2000 or better, and (3) that you are using the NTFS file system. Select 'n' is that is not the case.

1.1.5 Menu: Build Configuration

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.5.1 CONFIG_APPS_DIR: Application directory

  • Type: String
  • Default Values:
    • Default: "../apps"

      Dependency: !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

    • Default: "..\apps"

      Dependency: CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Identifies the directory that builds the application to link with NuttX. Default: ../apps This symbol must be assigned to the path to the application build directory *relative* to the NuttX top build direcory. If you had an application directory and the NuttX directory each in separate directory trees like this:

      build
|-nuttx
|  |
|  `- Makefile
`-application
|
`- Makefile

    Then you would set APPS_DIR=../application.

    The application direction must contain Makefile and this make file must support the following targets:

    1)libapps$(LIBEXT) (usually libapps.a). libapps.a is a static library ( an archive) that contains all of application object files.

    2)clean. Do whatever is appropriate to clean the application directories for a fresh build.

    3)distclean. Clean everthing -- auto-generated files, symbolic links etc. -- so that the directory contents are the same as the contents in your configuration management system. This is only done when you change the NuttX configuration.

    4)depend. Make or update the application build dependencies.

    When this application is invoked it will receive the setting TOPDIR like:

    $(MAKE) -C $(CONFIG_APPS_DIR) TOPDIR="$(TOPDIR)" <target>

    TOPDIR is the full path to the NuttX directory. It can be used, for example, to include makefile fragments (e.g., .config or Make.defs) or to set up include file paths.

1.1.5.2 CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS: Two pass build

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enables the two pass build options.

    Two-pass build options. If the 2 pass build option is selected, then these options configure the make system build a extra link object. This link object is assumed to be an incremental (relative) link object, but could be a static library (archive) (some modification to this Makefile would be required if PASS1_TARGET generates an archive). Pass 1 1ncremental (relative) link objects should be put into the processor-specific source directory (where other link objects will be created). If the pass1 obect is an archive, it could go anywhere.

1.1.5.3 CONFIG_PASS1_TARGET: Pass one target

  • Type: String
  • Default: "all"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The name of the first pass build target. This can be specific build target, a special build target (all, default, etc.) or may just be left undefined.

1.1.5.4 CONFIG_PASS1_BUILDIR: Pass one build directory

  • Type: String
  • Default: "build"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The path, relative to the top NuttX build directory to directory that contains the Makefile to build the first pass object. The Makefile must support the following targets: The special target PASS1_TARGET (if defined) and the usual depend, clean, and distclean targets.

1.1.5.5 CONFIG_PASS1_OBJECT: Pass one object

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    May be used to include an extra, pass1 object into the final link. This would probably be the object generated from the PASS1_TARGET. It may be available at link time in the arch/<architecture>/src directory.

1.1.5.6 CONFIG_NUTTX_KERNEL: NuttX kernel build

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Builds NuttX as a separately compiled kernel.

1.1.5.7 CONFIG_NUTTX_USERSPACE: Beginning of user-space blob

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS, CONFIG_NUTTX_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    In the kernel build, the NuttX kernel and the user-space blob are built separately linked objects. NUTTX_USERSPACE provides the address where the user-space blob is loaded into memory. NuttX will expect to find and instance of struct userspace_s at this location.

1.1.6 Menu: Binary Output Formats

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.6.1 CONFIG_RRLOAD_BINARY: rrload binary format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create nuttx.rr in the rrload binary format used with BSPs from www.ridgerun.com using the tools/mkimage.sh script.

1.1.6.2 CONFIG_INTELHEX_BINARY: Intel HEX binary format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create the nuttx.hex in the Intel HEX binary format that is used with many different loaders. This option will use the GNU objcopy program and should not be selected if you are not using the GNU toolchain.

1.1.6.3 CONFIG_MOTOROLA_SREC: Motorola S-Record binary format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create the nuttx.srec in the Motorola S-Record binary format that is used with many different loaders. This option will use the GNU objcopy program and should not be selected if you are not using the GNU toolchain.

1.1.6.4 CONFIG_RAW_BINARY: Raw binary format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create the nuttx.bin in the raw binary format that is used with many different loaders using the GNU objcopy program. This option should not be selected if you are not using the GNU toolchain.

1.1.7 Menu: Customize Header Files

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.7.1 CONFIG_ARCH_STDBOOL_H: stdbool.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The stdbool.h header file can be found at nuttx/include/stdbool.h. However, that header includes logic to redirect the inclusion of an architecture specific header file like:

      #ifdef CONFIG_ARCH_STDBOOL_H
#  include <arch/stdbool.h>
#else
...
#endif

    Recall that that include path, include/arch, is a symbolic link and will refer to a version of stdbool.h at nuttx/arch/<architecture>/include/stdbool.h.

1.1.7.2 CONFIG_ARCH_MATH_H: math.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    There is also a re-directing version of math.h in the source tree. However, it resides out-of-the-way at include/nuttx/math.h because it conflicts too often with the system math.h. If ARCH_MATH_H=y is defined, however, the top-level makefile will copy the redirecting math.h header file from include/nuttx/math.h to include/math.h. math.h will then include the architecture-specific version of math.h that you must provide at nuttx/arch/>architecture</include/math.h.

      #ifdef CONFIG_ARCH_MATH_H
#  include <arch/math.h>
#endif

    So for the architectures that define ARCH_MATH_H=y, include/math.h will be the redirecting math.h header file; for the architectures that don't select ARCH_MATH_H, the redirecting math.h header file will stay out-of-the-way in include/nuttx/.

1.1.7.3 CONFIG_ARCH_FLOAT_H: float.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The float.h header file defines the properties of your floating point implementation. It would always be best to use your toolchain's float.h header file but if none is avaiable, a default float.h header file will provided if this option is selected. However there is no assurance that the settings in this float.h are actually correct for your platform!

1.1.7.4 CONFIG_ARCH_STDARG_H: stdarg.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    There is also a redirecting version of stdarg.h in the source tree as well. It also resides out-of-the-way at include/nuttx/stdarg.h. This is because you should normally use your toolchain's stdarg.h file. But sometimes, your toolchain's stdarg.h file may have other header file dependencies and so may not be usable in the NuttX build environment. In those cases, you may have to create a architecture- specific stdarg.h header file at nuttx/arch/<architecture>/include/stdarg.h

    If ARCH_STDARG_H=y is defined, the top-level makefile will copy the re-directing stdarg.h header file from include/nuttx/stdarg.h to include/stdarg.h. So for the architectures that cannot use their toolchain's stdarg.h file, they can use this alternative by defining ARCH_STDARG_H=y and providing. If ARCH_STDARG_H, is not defined, then the stdarg.h header file will stay out-of-the-way in include/nuttx/.

1.1.8 Menu: Debug Options

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.8.1 CONFIG_DEBUG: Enable Debug Features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enables built-in debug features. Selecting this option will (1) Enable debug assertions in the code, (2) enable extended parameter testing in many functions, and (3) enable support for debug output to the SYSLOG. Note that enabling this option by itself does not produce debug output. Debug output must also be selected on a subsystem-by-subsystem basis.

1.1.8.2 CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE: Enable Debug Verbose Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enables verbose debug output (assuming debug featurses are enabled). As a general rule, when DEBUG is enabled only errors will be reported in the debug SYSLOG output. But if you also enable DEBUG_VERBOSE, then very chatty (and often annoying) output will be generated. This means there are two levels of debug output: errors-only and everything.

1.1.8.3 CONFIG_DEBUG_MM: Enable Memory Manager Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable memory management debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.4 CONFIG_DEBUG_SCHED: Enable Scheduler Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable OS debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.5 CONFIG_DEBUG_PAGING: Enable Demand Paging Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable demand paging debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.6 CONFIG_DEBUG_NET: Enable Network Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable network debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.7 CONFIG_DEBUG_USB: Enable USB Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_USBDEV || CONFIG_USBHOST
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable usb debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.8 CONFIG_DEBUG_FS: Enable File System Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable file system debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.9 CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB: Enable C Library Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable C library debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_BINFMT: Enable Binary Loader Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable binary loader debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.11 CONFIG_DEBUG_GRAPHICS: Enable Graphics Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable NX graphics debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.1.8.12 CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSCALL: Enable SYSCALL Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_NUTTX_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable very low level output related to system calls. This gives you basically a poor man's version of strace.

1.1.8.13 CONFIG_DEBUG_LCD: Enable Low-level LCD Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable low level debug SYSLOG output from the LCD driver (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is board-specific and may not be available for some boards.

1.1.8.14 CONFIG_DEBUG_LEDS: Enable Low-level LED Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable low level debug from board-specific LED logic. Support for this debug option is board-specific and may not be available for some boards.

1.1.8.15 CONFIG_DEBUG_INPUT: Enable Input Device Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_INPUT
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable low level debug SYSLOG output from the input device drivers such as mice and touchscreens (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is board-specific and may not be available for some boards.

1.1.8.16 CONFIG_DEBUG_ANALOG: Enable Analog Device Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable low level debug SYSLOG output from the analog device drivers such as A/D and D/A converters (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.17 CONFIG_DEBUG_I2C: Enable I2C Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable I2C driver debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.18 CONFIG_DEBUG_SPI: Enable SPI Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_SPI
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable I2C driver debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.19 CONFIG_DEBUG_CAN: Enable CAN Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_CAN
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable CAN driver debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.20 CONFIG_DEBUG_SDIO: Enable SDIO Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_MMCSD_SDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable SDIO driver debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.21 CONFIG_DEBUG_GPIO: Enable GPIO Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable GPIO-releated debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.22 CONFIG_DEBUG_DMA: Enable DMA Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_ARCH_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable DMA-releated debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.23 CONFIG_DEBUG_WATCHDOG: Enable Watchdog Timer Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_WATCHDOG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable watchdog timer debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.24 CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO: Enable Audio Device Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enable low level debug SYSLOG output from the audio subsystem and device drivers. (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecgture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.1.8.25 CONFIG_DEBUG_SYMBOLS: Enable Debug Symbols

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Build without optimization and with debug symbols (needed for use with a debugger).

1.2 Menu: System Type

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.2.1 Choice: CPU Architecture

  • Default: ARCH_ARM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_8051: 8051

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_CUSTOM_STACK
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Intel 8051 architectures and derivaties

    CONFIG_ARCH_ARM: ARM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_VFORK
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      The ARM architectures

    CONFIG_ARCH_AVR: AVR

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Atmel 8-bit bit AVR and 32-bit AVR32 architectures

    CONFIG_ARCH_HC: Freescale HC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Freescale HC architectures (M9S12)

    CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS: MIPS

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      MIPS architectures (PIC32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_RGMP: RGMP

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      RTOS and GPOS on Multi-Processor (RGMP) architecture. See http://rgmp.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Main_Page.

    CONFIG_ARCH_SH: Renesas

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Renesas architectures (SH and M16C).

    CONFIG_ARCH_SIM: Simulation

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Linux/Cywgin user-mode simulation.

    CONFIG_ARCH_X86: x86

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Intel x86 architectures.

    CONFIG_ARCH_Z16: ZNEO

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HEAP2
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      ZiLOG ZNEO 16-bit architectures (z16f).

    CONFIG_ARCH_Z80: z80

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HEAP2
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      ZiLOG 8-bit architectures (z80, ez80, z8).

1.2.2 Choice: ARM chip selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_C5471: TMS320 C5471

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      TI TMS320 C5471, A180, or DA180 (ARM7TDMI)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO: Calypso

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HEAP2, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      TI Calypso-based cell phones (ARM7TDMI)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_DM320: TMS320 DM320

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM926EJS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      TI DMS320 DM320 (ARM926EJS)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX: Freescale iMX

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM920T, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HEAP2, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Freescale iMX architectures (ARM920T)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS: Freescale Kinetis

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMFUNCS, CONFIG_ARCH_RAMFUNCS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Freescale Kinetis Architectures (ARM Cortex-M4)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL: Freescale Kinetis L

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Freescale Kinetis L Architectures (ARM Cortex-M0+)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM: TI Stellaris

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      TI Stellaris LMS3 and LM4F architecutres (ARM Cortex-M3/4)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC17XX: NXP LPC17xx

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      NXP LPC17xx architectures (ARM Cortex-M3)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC214X: NXP LPC214x

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      NXP LPC2145x architectures (ARM7TDMI)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC2378: NXP LPC2378

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      NXP LPC2145x architectures (ARM7TDMI)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC31XX: NXP LPC31XX

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM926EJS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      NPX LPC31XX architectures (ARM926EJS).

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC43XX: NXP LPC43XX

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR, CONFIG_ARMV7M_CMNVECTOR, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      NPX LPC43XX architectures (ARM Cortex-M4).

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_NUC1XX: Nuvoton NUC100/120

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      NPX LPC43XX architectures (ARM Cortex-M4).

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_SAMA5: Atmel AT91SAMA5

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Atmel AT91SAMA5 (ARM Cortex-A5)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_SAM34: Atmel AT91SAM3/SAM4

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMFUNCS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Atmel AT91SAM3 (ARM Cortex-M3) and SAM4 (ARM Cortex-M4) architectures

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32: STMicro STM32

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_I2CRESET
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      STMicro STM32 architectures (ARM Cortex-M3/4).

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STR71X: STMicro STR71x

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      STMicro STR71x architectures (ARM7TDMI).

1.2.3 CONFIG_ARMV7M_USEBASEPRI: Use BASEPRI Register

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Use the BASEPRI register to enable and disable able interrupts. By default, the PRIMASK register is used for this purpose. This usually results in hardfaults that are properly handling by the RTOS. Using the BASEPRI register will avoid these hardfault. That is needed primarily for integration with some toolchains.

1.2.4 CONFIG_ARMV7M_CMNVECTOR: Use common ARMv7-M vectors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Some architectures use their own, built-in vector logic. Some use only the common vector logic. Some can use either their own built-in vector logic or the common vector logic. This applies only to ARMv7-M architectures.

1.2.5 CONFIG_ARCH_FPU: FPU support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Build in support for the ARM Cortex-M4 Floating Point Unit (FPU). Check your chip specifications first; not all Cortex-M4 chips support the FPU.

1.2.6 CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU: MPU support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Build in support for the ARM Cortex-M3/4 Memory Protection Unit (MPU). Check your chip specifications first; not all Cortex-M3/4 chips support the MPU.

1.2.7 CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU_NREGIONS: Number of MPU regions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    This is the number of protection regions supported by the MPU.

1.2.8 CONFIG_ARCH_LOWVECTORS: Vectors in low memory

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Support ARM vectors in low memory.

1.2.9 CONFIG_PGTABLE_VADDR: Page table virtual address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Page table virtual address (might be defined in the board.h file). Not applicable to all architectures.

1.2.10 CONFIG_ARCH_ROMPGTABLE: ROM page table

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Support a fixed memory mapping use a (read-only) page table in ROM/FLASH.

1.2.11 CONFIG_PAGING: On-demand paging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU && !CONFIG_ARCH_ROMPGTABLE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    If set =y in your configation file, this setting will enable the on-demand paging feature as described in http://www.nuttx.org/NuttXDemandPaging.html.

1.2.12 CONFIG_DEBUG_HARDFAULT: Verbose Hard-Fault Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_DEBUG && (CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4)
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Enables verbose debug output when a hard fault is occurs. This verbose output is sometimes helpful when debugging difficult hard fault problems, but may be more than you typcially want to see.

1.2.13 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_ATOLLIC: Atollic Lite/Pro for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT: Buildroot (Cygwin or Linux)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_CODEREDL: CodeRed for Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_CODEREDW: CodeRed for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYL: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYW: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_DEVKITARM: devkitARM GNU toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Linux (or other POSIX environment)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi.

    CONFIG_ARMV6M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv6-m/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi.

1.2.14 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT: Buildroot (Cygwin or Linux)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYL: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

      For use with the GNU toolchain built with the NuttX buildroot package. This tools may be arm-nuttx-eabi- or, if ARMV7A_OABI_TOOLCHAIN is set, arm-nuttx-elf-.

    CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYW: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_DEVKITARM: devkitARM GNU toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Linux (or other POSIX environment)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi-.

    CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi-.

    CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_OABI: Generic GNU OABI toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

      This option should work for any GNU toolchain configured for arm-elf-.

1.2.15 CONFIG_ARMV7A_OABI_TOOLCHAIN: OABI (vs EABI)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5 , CONFIG_ARMV7A_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-a/Kconfig

    Most of the older buildroot toolchains are OABI and are named arm-nuttx-elf- vs. arm-nuttx-eabi-

1.2.16 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_ATOLLIC: Atollic Lite/Pro for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT: Buildroot (Cygwin or Linux)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODEREDL: CodeRed for Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODEREDW: CodeRed for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYL: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYW: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_DEVKITARM: devkitARM GNU toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Linux (or other POSIX environment)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi.

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi.

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_RAISONANCE: STMicro Raisonance for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.17 CONFIG_ARMV7M_OABI_TOOLCHAIN: OABI (vs EABI)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    Most of the older buildroot toolchains are OABI and are named arm-nuttx-elf- vs. arm-nuttx-eabi-

1.2.18 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: ARM_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: ARM_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT: Buildroot (Cygwin or Linux)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYL: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

      For use with the GNU toolchain built with the NuttX buildroot package. This tools may be arm-nuttx-eabi- or, if ARM_OABI_TOOLCHAIN is set, arm-nuttx-elf-.

    CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYW: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_DEVKITARM: devkitARM GNU toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Linux (or other POSIX environment)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi-.

    CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi-.

    CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_OABI: Generic GNU OABI toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

      This option should work for any GNU toolchain configured for arm-elf-.

1.2.19 CONFIG_ARM_OABI_TOOLCHAIN: OABI (vs EABI)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI , CONFIG_ARM_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/arm/Kconfig

    Most of the older buildroot toolchains are OABI and are named arm-nuttx-elf- vs. arm-nuttx-eabi-

1.2.20 Menu: Modem UART Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

1.2.20.1 CONFIG_UART_MODEM_BAUD: Modem UART BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

1.2.20.2 CONFIG_UART_MODEM_PARITY: Modem UART parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    Modem UART parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

1.2.20.3 CONFIG_UART_MODEM_BITS: Modem UART number of bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    Modem UART number of bits. Default: 8

1.2.20.4 CONFIG_UART_MODEM_2STOP: Modem UART two stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

1.2.20.5 CONFIG_UART_MODEM_RXBUFSIZE: Modem UART Rx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    Modem UART Rx buffer size. Default: 256

1.2.20.6 CONFIG_UART_MODEM_TXBUFSIZE: Modem UART Tx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    Modem UART Tx buffer size. Default: 256

1.2.20.7 CONFIG_UART_MODEM_HWFLOWCONTROL: Hardware flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    Enabled Modem UART hardware flow control. Default: n

1.2.21 Menu: IrDA UART Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

1.2.21.1 CONFIG_UART_IRDA_BAUD: IrDA UART BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

1.2.21.2 CONFIG_UART_IRDA_PARITY: IrDA UART parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    IrDA UART parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

1.2.21.3 CONFIG_UART_IRDA_BITS: IrDA UART number of bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    IrDA UART number of bits. Default: 8

1.2.21.4 CONFIG_UART_IRDA_2STOP: IrDA UART two stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

1.2.21.5 CONFIG_UART_IRDA_RXBUFSIZE: IrDA UART Rx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    IrDA UART Rx buffer size. Default: 256

1.2.21.6 CONFIG_UART_IRDA_TXBUFSIZE: IrDA UART Tx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    IrDA UART Tx buffer size. Default: 256

1.2.21.7 CONFIG_UART_IRDA_HWFLOWCONTROL: Hardware flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    Enabled IrDA UART hardware flow control. Default: n

1.2.22 Choice: Serial Console Selection

  • Default: SERIAL_CONSOLE_NONE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_SERCOMM_CONSOLE: SERCOMM console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SERIAL_MODEM_CONSOLE: Serial console on modem UART

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SERIAL_IRDA_CONSOLE: Serial console on IrDA UART

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE_NONE: No serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/calypso/Kconfig

1.2.23 CONFIG_IMX_UART0: UART0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imx/Kconfig

1.2.24 CONFIG_IMX_UART1: UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imx/Kconfig

1.2.25 CONFIG_IMX_UART2: UART2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imx/Kconfig

1.2.26 Choice: Kinetis Chip Selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_MK60N512VMD100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK40N512VLQ100: MK40N512VLQ100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K40
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK40N512VMD100: MK40N512VMD100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K40
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK40X128VLQ100: MK40X128VLQ100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K40
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK40X128VMD100: MK40X128VMD100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K40
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK40X256VLQ100: MK40X256VLQ100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K40
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK40X256VMD100: MK40X256VMD100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K40
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK60N256VLQ100: MK60N256VLQ100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK60N256VMD100: MK60N256VMD100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK60N512VLQ100: MK60N512VLQ100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK60N512VMD100: MK60N512VMD100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK60X256VLQ100: MK60X256VLQ100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MK60X256VMD100: MK60X256VMD100

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

1.2.27 Menu: Kinetis Peripheral Support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

1.2.27.1 CONFIG_KINETIS_TRACE: Trace

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable trace clocking on power up.

1.2.27.2 CONFIG_KINETIS_FLEXBUS: FlexBus

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable flexbus clocking on power up.

1.2.27.3 CONFIG_KINETIS_UART0: UART0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support UART0

1.2.27.4 CONFIG_KINETIS_UART1: UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support UART1

1.2.27.5 CONFIG_KINETIS_UART2: UART2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support UART2

1.2.27.6 CONFIG_KINETIS_UART3: UART3

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support UART3

1.2.27.7 CONFIG_KINETIS_UART4: UART4

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support UART4

1.2.27.8 CONFIG_KINETIS_UART5: UART5

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support UART5

1.2.27.9 CONFIG_KINETIS_ENET: Ethernet

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NET
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support Ethernet (K60 only)

1.2.27.10 CONFIG_KINETIS_RNGB: Random number generator

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K60
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the random number generator(K60 only)

1.2.27.11 CONFIG_KINETIS_FLEXCAN0: FlexCAN0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support FlexCAN0

1.2.27.12 CONFIG_KINETIS_FLEXCAN1: FlexCAN1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support FlexCAN1

  • Type: Boolean

  • Type: Boolean

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support I2S

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support DAC0

1.2.27.20 CONFIG_KINETIS_DAC1: DAC1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support DAC1

1.2.27.21 CONFIG_KINETIS_ADC0: ADC0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support ADC0

1.2.27.22 CONFIG_KINETIS_ADC1: ADC1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support ADC1

1.2.27.23 CONFIG_KINETIS_CMP: CMP

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support CMP

1.2.27.24 CONFIG_KINETIS_VREF: VREF

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support VREF

1.2.27.25 CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC: SDHC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MMCSD_SDIO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support SD host controller

1.2.27.26 CONFIG_KINETIS_FTM0: FTM0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support FlexTimer 0

1.2.27.27 CONFIG_KINETIS_FTM1: FTM1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support FlexTimer 1

1.2.27.28 CONFIG_KINETIS_FTM2: FTM2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support FlexTimer 2

1.2.27.29 CONFIG_KINETIS_LPTIMER: Low power timer (LPTIMER)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the low power timer

1.2.27.30 CONFIG_KINETIS_RTC: RTC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support RTC

1.2.27.31 CONFIG_KINETIS_SLCD: Segment LCD (SLCD)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_K40
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the segment LCD (K40 only)

1.2.27.32 CONFIG_KINETIS_EWM: External watchdog (WVM)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the external watchdog

1.2.27.33 CONFIG_KINETIS_CMT: Carrier modulator transmitter (CMT)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support Carrier Modulator Transmitter

1.2.27.34 CONFIG_KINETIS_USBOTG: USB OTG

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support USB OTG (see also USBHOST and USBDEV)

1.2.27.35 CONFIG_KINETIS_USBDCD: USB device controller

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the USB Device Charger Detection module

1.2.27.36 CONFIG_KINETIS_LLWU: Low leakage wake-up unit (LLWU)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the Low Leakage Wake-Up Unit

1.2.27.37 CONFIG_KINETIS_TSI: Touchscreen interface (TSI)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the touch screeen interface

1.2.27.38 CONFIG_KINETIS_FTFL: FLASH (FTFL)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support DMA

1.2.27.40 CONFIG_KINETIS_CRC: CRC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support CRC

1.2.27.41 CONFIG_KINETIS_PDB: Programmable delay block (PDB)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support the Programmable Delay Block

1.2.27.42 CONFIG_KINETIS_PIT: Programmable interval timer (PIT)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Support Programmable Interval Timers

1.2.28 CONFIG_GPIO_IRQ: GPIO pin interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable support for interrupting GPIO pins

1.2.29 CONFIG_KINETIS_PORTAINTS: GPIOA interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_GPIO_IRQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable support for 32 interrupts from GPIO port A pins

1.2.30 CONFIG_KINETIS_PORTBINTS: GPIOB interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_GPIO_IRQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable support for 32 interrupts from GPIO port B pins

1.2.31 CONFIG_KINETIS_PORTCINTS: GPIOC interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_GPIO_IRQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable support for 32 interrupts from GPIO port C pins

1.2.32 CONFIG_KINETIS_PORTDINTS: GPIOD interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_GPIO_IRQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable support for 32 interrupts from GPIO port D pins

1.2.33 CONFIG_KINETIS_PORTEINTS: GPIOE interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_GPIO_IRQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Enable support for 32 interrupts from GPIO port E pins

1.2.34 CONFIG_ENET_ENHANCEDBD: Use enhanced buffer descriptors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_ENET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Use enhanced, 32-byte buffer descriptors

1.2.35 CONFIG_ENET_NETHIFS: Number of Ethernet interfaces

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_ENET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Number of Ethernet interfaces supported by the hardware. Must be one for now.

1.2.36 CONFIG_ENET_NRXBUFFERS: Number of Ethernet Rx buffers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_ENET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Number of Ethernet Rx buffers to use. The size of one buffer is determined by NET_BUFSIZE

1.2.37 CONFIG_ENET_NTXBUFFERS: Number of Ethernet Tx buffers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_ENET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Number of Ethernet Tx buffers to use. The size of one buffer is determined by NET_BUFSIZE

1.2.38 CONFIG_ENET_PHYADDR: PHY address

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_ENET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    MII/RMII address of the PHY

1.2.39 CONFIG_ENET_USEMII: Use MII interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_ENET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    The the MII PHY interface. Default: Use RMII interface

1.2.40 CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC_ABSFREQ: Custom transfer frequencies

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Select SDCLK frequencies corresponding to various modes of operation. These values may be provided in either the NuttX configuration file or in the board.h file

    NOTE: These settings are not currently used. Since there are only four frequencies, it makes more sense to just "can" the fixed frequency prescaler and divider values.

1.2.41 CONFIG_KINETIS_IDMODE_FREQ: ID mode frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 400000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC_ABSFREQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Initial, ID mode SD frequency

1.2.42 CONFIG_KINETIS_MMCXFR_FREQ: MMC transfer frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC_ABSFREQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Frequency to use for transferring data to/from an MMC card

1.2.43 CONFIG_KINETIS_SD1BIT_FREQ: SD 1-bit transfer frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC_ABSFREQ , CONFIG_SDIO_WIDTH_D1_ONLY
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Frequency to use for transferring data to/from an SD card using on a single data liune.

1.2.44 CONFIG_KINETIS_SD4BIT_FREQ: SD 4-bit transfer frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC_ABSFREQ , !CONFIG_SDIO_WIDTH_D1_ONLY
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    Frequency to use for transferring data to/from an SD card using all four data lines.

1.2.45 CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC_DMAPRIO: SDHC DMA priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_SDHC , CONFIG_SDIO_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

    SDHC DMA priority

1.2.46 CONFIG_KINETIS_UARTFIFOS: Enable UART0 FIFO

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KINETIS , CONFIG_KINETIS_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kinetis/Kconfig

1.2.47 Choice: Kinetis Chip Selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_MKL25Z128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kl/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MKL25Z128: MKL25Z128

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_KL2X
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kl/Kconfig

1.2.48 Menu: Kinetis Peripheral Support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kl/Kconfig

1.2.48.1 CONFIG_KL_TRACE: Trace

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kl/Kconfig

    Enable trace clocking on power up.

1.2.48.2 CONFIG_KL_FLEXBUS: FlexBus

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kl/Kconfig

    Enable flexbus clocking on power up.

1.2.48.3 CONFIG_KL_UART0: UART0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_KL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/kl/Kconfig

    Support UART0
