  • Default: STM32_TIM11_DAC1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_TIM11_DAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM11_DAC1: TIM11 DAC channel 1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM11 to trigger DAC1

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM11_DAC2: TIM11 DAC channel 2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM11 to trigger DAC2

1.2.213 CONFIG_STM32_TIM12_DAC: TIM12 DAC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_TIM12 && CONFIG_STM32_DAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Reserve timer 12 for use by DAC

    Timer devices may be used for different purposes. If STM32_TIM12 is defined then the following may also be defined to indicate that the timer is intended to be used for DAC conversion. Note that DAC usage requires two definition: Not only do you have to assign the timer for used by the DAC, but then you also have to configure which DAC channel it is assigned to.

1.2.214 Choice: Select TIM12 DAC channel

  • Default: STM32_TIM12_DAC1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_TIM12_DAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM12_DAC1: TIM12 DAC channel 1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM12 to trigger DAC1

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM12_DAC2: TIM12 DAC channel 2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM12 to trigger DAC2

1.2.215 CONFIG_STM32_TIM13_DAC: TIM13 DAC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_TIM13 && CONFIG_STM32_DAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Reserve timer 13 for use by DAC

    Timer devices may be used for different purposes. If STM32_TIM13 is defined then the following may also be defined to indicate that the timer is intended to be used for DAC conversion. Note that DAC usage requires two definition: Not only do you have to assign the timer for used by the DAC, but then you also have to configure which DAC channel it is assigned to.

1.2.216 Choice: Select TIM13 DAC channel

  • Default: STM32_TIM13_DAC1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_TIM13_DAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM13_DAC1: TIM13 DAC channel 1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM13 to trigger DAC1

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM13_DAC2: TIM13 DAC channel 2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM13 to trigger DAC2

1.2.217 CONFIG_STM32_TIM14_DAC: TIM14 DAC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_TIM14 && CONFIG_STM32_DAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Reserve timer 14 for use by DAC

    Timer devices may be used for different purposes. If STM32_TIM14 is defined then the following may also be defined to indicate that the timer is intended to be used for DAC conversion. Note that DAC usage requires two definition: Not only do you have to assign the timer for used by the DAC, but then you also have to configure which DAC channel it is assigned to.

1.2.218 Choice: Select TIM14 DAC channel

  • Default: STM32_TIM14_DAC1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_TIM14_DAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM14_DAC1: TIM14 DAC channel 1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM14 to trigger DAC1

    CONFIG_STM32_TIM14_DAC2: TIM14 DAC channel 2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Reserve TIM14 to trigger DAC2

1.2.219 Menu: DAC Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DAC1 || CONFIG_STM32_DAC2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.219.1 CONFIG_STM32_DAC1_DMA: DAC1 DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DAC1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    If DMA is selected, then a timer and output frequency must also be provided to support the DMA transfer. The DMA transfer could be supported by and EXTI trigger, but this feature is not currently supported by the driver.

1.2.219.2 CONFIG_STM32_DAC1_TIMER: DAC1 timer

  • Type: Integer
  • Range: 2 - 7
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DAC1_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.219.3 CONFIG_STM32_DAC1_TIMER_FREQUENCY: DAC1 timer frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 14
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DAC1_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.219.4 CONFIG_STM32_DAC2_DMA: DAC2 DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DAC2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    If DMA is selected, then a timer and output frequency must also be provided to support the DMA transfer. The DMA transfer could be supported by and EXTI trigger, but this feature is not currently supported by the driver.

1.2.219.5 CONFIG_STM32_DAC2_TIMER: DAC2 timer

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 2 - 7
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DAC2_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.219.6 CONFIG_STM32_DAC2_TIMER_FREQUENCY: DAC2 timer frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DAC2_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.219.7 CONFIG_STM32_DAC_DMA_BUFFER_SIZE: DAC DMA buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.220 Menu: U[S]ART Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.220.1 CONFIG_USART1_RS485: RS-485 on USART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on USART1. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_USART1_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with USART1_RXDMA.

1.2.220.2 CONFIG_USART1_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: USART1 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USART1_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on USART1. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.3 CONFIG_USART1_RXDMA: USART1 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.4 CONFIG_USART2_RS485: RS-485 on USART2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on USART2. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_USART2_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with USART2_RXDMA.

1.2.220.5 CONFIG_USART2_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: USART2 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USART2_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on USART2. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.6 CONFIG_USART2_RXDMA: USART2 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.7 CONFIG_USART3_RS485: RS-485 on USART3

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART3
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on USART3. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_USART3_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with USART3_RXDMA.

1.2.220.8 CONFIG_USART3_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: USART3 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USART3_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on USART3. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.9 CONFIG_USART3_RXDMA: USART3 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.10 CONFIG_UART4_RS485: RS-485 on UART4

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_UART4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on UART4. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_UART4_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with UART4_RXDMA.

1.2.220.11 CONFIG_UART4_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: UART4 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_UART4_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on UART4. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.12 CONFIG_UART4_RXDMA: UART4 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.13 CONFIG_UART5_RS485: RS-485 on UART5

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_UART5
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on UART5. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_UART5_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with UART5_RXDMA.

1.2.220.14 CONFIG_UART5_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: UART5 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_UART5_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on UART5. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.15 CONFIG_UART5_RXDMA: UART5 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.16 CONFIG_USART6_RS485: RS-485 on USART6

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART6
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on USART6. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_USART6_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with USART6_RXDMA.

1.2.220.17 CONFIG_USART6_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: USART6 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USART6_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on USART6. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.18 CONFIG_USART6_RXDMA: USART6 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.19 CONFIG_USART7_RS485: RS-485 on USART7

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART7
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on USART7. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_USART7_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with USART7_RXDMA.

1.2.220.20 CONFIG_USART7_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: USART7 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USART7_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on USART7. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.21 CONFIG_USART7_RXDMA: USART7 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.22 CONFIG_USART8_RS485: RS-485 on USART8

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART8
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable RS-485 interface on USART8. Your board config will have to provide GPIO_USART8_RS485_DIR pin definition. Currently it cannot be used with USART8_RXDMA.

1.2.220.23 CONFIG_USART8_RS485_DIR_POLARITY: USART8 RS-485 DIR pin polarity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USART8_RS485
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Polarity of DIR pin for RS-485 on USART8. Set to state on DIR pin which enables TX (0 - low / nTXEN, 1 - high / TXEN).

1.2.220.24 CONFIG_USART8_RXDMA: USART8 Rx DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX && CONFIG_STM32_DMA2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    In high data rate usage, Rx DMA may eliminate Rx overrun errors

1.2.220.25 CONFIG_SERIAL_TERMIOS: Serial driver TERMIOS supported

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART1 || CONFIG_STM32_USART2 || CONFIG_STM32_USART3 || CONFIG_STM32_UART4 || CONFIG_STM32_UART5 || CONFIG_STM32_USART6 || CONFIG_STM32_USART7 || CONFIG_STM32_USART8
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Serial driver supports termios.h interfaces (tcsetattr, tcflush, etc.). If this is not defined, then the terminal settings (baud, parity, etc). are not configurable at runtime; serial streams cannot be flushed, etc..

1.2.221 CONFIG_STM32_USART_SINGLEWIRE: Single Wire Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USART
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable single wire UART support. The option enables support for the TIOCSSINGLEWIRE ioctl in the STM32 serial driver.

1.2.222 Menu: SPI Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_SPI
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.222.1 CONFIG_STM32_SPI_INTERRUPTS: Interrupt driver SPI

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Select to enable interrupt driven SPI support. Non-interrupt-driven, poll-waiting is recommended if the interrupt rate would be to high in the interrupt driven case.

1.2.222.2 CONFIG_STM32_SPI_DMA: SPI DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Use DMA to improve SPI transfer performance. Cannot be used with STM32_SPI_INTERRUPT.

1.2.223 Menu: I2C Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.223.1 CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DYNTIMEO: Use dynamic timeouts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.223.2 CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DYNTIMEO_USECPERBYTE: Timeout Microseconds per Byte

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.223.3 CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DYNTIMEO_STARTSTOP: Timeout for Start/Stop (Milliseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.223.4 CONFIG_STM32_I2CTIMEOSEC: Timeout seconds

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.223.5 CONFIG_STM32_I2CTIMEOMS: Timeout Milliseconds

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C && !CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.223.6 CONFIG_STM32_I2CTIMEOTICKS: Timeout for Done and Stop (ticks)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C && !CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.223.7 CONFIG_STM32_I2C_DUTY16_9: Frequency with Tlow/Thigh = 16/9

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.224 Menu: SDIO Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_SDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.224.1 CONFIG_SDIO_DMA: Support DMA data transfers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y

    Dependency: CONFIG_STM32_DMA2

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_DMA2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Support DMA data transfers. Requires STM32_SDIO and config STM32_DMA2.

1.2.224.2 CONFIG_SDIO_PRI: SDIO interrupt priority

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Select SDIO interrupt prority. Default: 128.

1.2.224.3 CONFIG_SDIO_DMAPRIO: SDIO DMA priority

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x00001000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Select SDIO DMA prority. Options: 0x00000000 low, 0x00001000 medium, 0x00002000 high, 0x00003000 very high. Default: medium.

1.2.224.4 CONFIG_SDIO_WIDTH_D1_ONLY: Use D1 only

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Select 1-bit transfer mode. Default: 4-bit transfer mode.

1.2.225 Menu: Ethernet MAC configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.225.1 CONFIG_STM32_PHYADDR: PHY address

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    The 5-bit address of the PHY on the board. Default: 1

1.2.225.2 CONFIG_STM32_PHYINIT: Board-specific PHY Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Some boards require specialized initialization of the PHY before it can be used. This may include such things as configuring GPIOs, resetting the PHY, etc. If STM32_PHYINIT is defined in the configuration then the board specific logic must provide stm32_phyinitialize(); The STM32 Ethernet driver will call this function one time before it first uses the PHY.

1.2.225.3 CONFIG_STM32_MII: Use MII interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Support Ethernet MII interface.

1.2.225.4 Choice: MII clock configuration

  • Default Values:
    • Default: STM32_MII_MCO

      Dependency: CONFIG_STM32_STM32F10XX

    • Default: STM32_MII_MCO1

      Dependency: CONFIG_STM32_STM32F20XX || CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_MII
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_STM32_MII_MCO: Use MC0 as MII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F10XX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Use MCO to clock the MII interface. Default: Use MC0

    CONFIG_STM32_MII_MCO1: Use MC01 as MII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , (CONFIG_STM32_STM32F20XX || CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX)
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Use MCO1 to clock the MII interface. Default: Use MC01

    CONFIG_STM32_MII_MCO2: Use MC02 as MII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , (CONFIG_STM32_STM32F20XX || CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX)
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Use MCO2 to clock the MII interface. Default: Use MC01

    CONFIG_STM32_MII_EXTCLK: External MII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Clocking is provided by external logic. Don't use MCO for MII clock. Default: Use MC0[1]

1.2.225.5 CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG: Use autonegotiation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Use PHY autonegotiation to determine speed and mode

1.2.225.6 CONFIG_STM32_ETHFD: Full duplex

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , !CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    If STM32_AUTONEG is not defined, then this may be defined to select full duplex mode. Default: half-duplex

1.2.225.7 CONFIG_STM32_ETH100MBPS: 100 Mbps

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , !CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    If STM32_AUTONEG is not defined, then this may be defined to select 100 MBps speed. Default: 10 Mbps

1.2.225.8 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR: PHY Status Register Address (decimal)

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. The PHY status register address may diff from PHY to PHY. This configuration sets the address of the PHY status register.

1.2.225.9 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG: PHY Status Alternate Bit Layout

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Different PHYs present speed and mode information in different ways. Some will present separate information for speed and mode (this is the default). Those PHYs, for example, may provide a 10/100 Mbps indication and a separate full/half duplex indication. This options selects an alternative representation where speed and mode information are combined. This might mean, for example, separate bits for 10HD, 100HD, 10FD and 100FD.

1.2.225.10 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_SPEED: PHY Speed Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && !CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This provides bit mask for isolating the 10 or 100MBps speed indication.

1.2.225.11 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_100MBPS: PHY 100Mbps Speed Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && !CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This provides the value of the speed bit(s) indicating 100MBps speed.

1.2.225.12 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_MODE: PHY Mode Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && !CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This provide bit mask for isolating the full or half duplex mode bits.

1.2.225.13 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_FULLDUPLEX: PHY Full Duplex Mode Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && !CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This provides the value of the mode bits indicating full duplex mode.

1.2.225.14 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTMODE: PHY Mode Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This provide bit mask for isolating the speed and full/half duplex mode bits.

1.2.225.15 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_10HD: 10MHz/Half Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 10Mbps, half duplex setting.

1.2.225.16 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_100HD: 100MHz/Half Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 100Mbps, half duplex setting.

1.2.225.17 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_10FD: 10MHz/Full Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 10Mbps, full duplex setting.

1.2.225.18 CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_100FD: 100MHz/Full Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_AUTONEG && CONFIG_STM32_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    This must be provided if STM32_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 100Mbps, full duplex setting.

1.2.225.19 CONFIG_STM32_ETH_PTP: Precision Time Protocol (PTP)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Precision Time Protocol (PTP). Not supported but some hooks are indicated with this condition.

1.2.225.20 Choice: RMII clock configuration

  • Default Values:
    • Default: STM32_RMII_MCO

      Dependency: CONFIG_STM32_STM32F10XX

    • Default: STM32_RMII_MCO1

      Dependency: CONFIG_STM32_STM32F20XX || CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_RMII
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_STM32_RMII_MCO: Use MC0 as RMII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_STM32_STM32F10XX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Use MCO to clock the RMII interface. Default: Use MC0

    CONFIG_STM32_RMII_MCO1: Use MC01 as RMII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , (CONFIG_STM32_STM32F20XX || CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX)
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Use MCO1 to clock the RMII interface. Default: Use MC01

    CONFIG_STM32_RMII_MCO2: Use MC02 as RMII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , (CONFIG_STM32_STM32F20XX || CONFIG_STM32_STM32F40XX)
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Use MCO2 to clock the RMII interface. Default: Use MC01

    CONFIG_STM32_RMII_EXTCLK: External RMII clock

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      Clocking is provided by external logic. Don't use MCO for RMII clock. Default: Use MC0[1]

1.2.225.21 CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC_REGDEBUG: Register-Level Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_ETHMAC , CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable very low-level register access debug. Depends on DEBUG.

1.2.226 Menu: USB Host Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

1.2.226.1 CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS_RXFIFO_SIZE: Rx Packet Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USBHOST && CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Size of the RX FIFO in 32-bit words. Default 128 (512 bytes)

1.2.226.2 CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS_NPTXFIFO_SIZE: Non-periodic Tx FIFO Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 96
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USBHOST && CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Size of the non-periodic Tx FIFO in 32-bit words. Default 96 (384 bytes)

1.2.226.3 CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS_PTXFIFO_SIZE: Periodic Tx FIFO size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USBHOST && CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Size of the periodic Tx FIFO in 32-bit words. Default 96 (384 bytes)

1.2.226.4 CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS_DESCSIZE: Descriptor Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USBHOST && CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Maximum size to allocate for descriptor memory descriptor. Default: 128

1.2.226.5 CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS_SOFINTR: Enable SOF interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USBHOST && CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable SOF interrupts. Why would you ever want to do that?

1.2.226.6 CONFIG_STM32_USBHOST_REGDEBUG: Register-Level Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USBHOST && CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Enable very low-level register access debug. Depends on DEBUG.

1.2.226.7 CONFIG_STM32_USBHOST_PKTDUMP: Packet Dump Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_USBHOST && CONFIG_STM32_OTGFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    Dump all incoming and outgoing USB packets. Depends on DEBUG.

1.2.227 CONFIG_STM32_USB_ITRMP: Re-map USB interrupt

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_STM32_CAN1

    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_STM32_CAN1

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_STM32_USB && CONFIG_STM32_STM32F30XX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

    The legacy USB in the F1 series shared interrupt lines with USB device and CAN1. In the F3 series, a hardware options was added to either retain the legacy F1 behavior or to map the USB interupts to there own dedicated vectors. The option is available only for the F3 family and selects the use of the dedicated USB interrupts.

1.2.228 Choice: Atmel AVR chip selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_AT32UC3B0256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ATMEGA128: ATMega128

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

      Atmel ATMega128 8-bit AVR.

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_AT90USB646: AT90USB646

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

      Atmel AT90USB646 8-bit AVR.

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_AT90USB647: AT90USB647

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

      Atmel AT90USB647 8-bit AVR.

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_AT90USB1286: AT90USB1286

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

      Atmel AT90USB1286 8-bit AVR.

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_AT90USB1287: AT90USB1287

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

      Atmel AT90USB1287 8-bit AVR.

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_AT32UC3B0256: AT32UC3B0256

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

      Atmel AT32UC3B0256 32-bit AVR32.

1.2.229 Choice: Toolchain

  • Default Values:
    • Default: AVR_WINAVR

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: AVR_BUILDROOT

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_LINUX

    • Default: AVR_CROSSPACK

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_OSX

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR, CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/src/avr/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_AVR_WINAVR: WinAVR

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR, CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/src/avr/Kconfig

      For Cygwin development environment on Windows machines, you can use WinAVR: http://sourceforge.net/projects/winavr/files/

      It is assumed in some places that WinAVR is installed at C:/WinAVR. Edit the setenv.sh file if this is not the case.

      WARNING: There is an incompatible version of cygwin.dll in the WinAVR/bin directory! Make sure that the path to the correct cygwin.dll file precedes the path to the WinAVR binaries!

    CONFIG_AVR_LINUXGCC: Linux GCC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR, CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/src/avr/Kconfig

      For Linux, there are widely available avr-gcc packages. On Ubuntu, use: sudo apt-get install gcc-avr gdb-avr avr-libc

    CONFIG_AVR_CROSSPACK: CrossPack-AVR

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR, CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_HOST_OSX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/src/avr/Kconfig

      For OS X, the AVR CrossPack toolchain is supported: http://www.obdev.at/products/crosspack/index.html

      It is assumed that /usr/local/CrossPack-AVR/bin is on the user's path. Edit the setenv.sh file if this is not the case.

    CONFIG_AVR_BUILDROOT: Buildroot

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR, CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_AVR , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX || CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/src/avr/Kconfig

      There is a DIY buildroot version for the AVR boards here: http://sourceforge.net/projects/nuttx/files/buildroot/. See the following section for details on building this toolchain.

      It is assumed in some places that buildroot toolchain is available at ../misc/buildroot/build_avr. Edit the setenv.sh file if this is not the case.

1.2.230 CONFIG_AVR_USART0: USART0 specific serial device driver settings

  • Type: Boolean
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

1.2.231 CONFIG_AVR_USART1: USART1 specific serial device driver settings

  • Type: Boolean
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/avr/Kconfig

1.2.232 Choice: HC chip selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_MCS92S12NEC64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/hc/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MCS92S12NEC64: MCS92S12NEC64

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HC
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/hc/Kconfig

      Motorola/Freescale MCS92S12NEC64 (M9S12)

1.2.233 Choice: MIPS chip selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX: PIC32MX

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32, CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO, CONFIG_ARCH_VECNOTIRQ, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMFUNCS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX320F032H (MIPS32)

1.2.234 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_MICROCHIPW_LITE

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_ELF

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_ELF: Generic GNU ELF toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for mips32-elf.

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_MICROCHIPL: Microchip C32 toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_MICROCHIPL_LITE: Microchip C32 toolchain under Linux (Lite edition)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_MICROCHIPW: Microchip C32 toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_MICROCHIPW_LITE: Microchip C32 toolchain under Windows (Lite edition)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_MICROCHIPOPENL: microchipOpen toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_PINGUINOW: Pinguino mips-elf toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

    CONFIG_MIPS32_TOOLCHAIN_PINGUINOL: Pinguino mips-elf toolchain under OS X or Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX || CONFIG_HOST_OSX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

1.2.235 CONFIG_MIPS32_FRAMEPOINTER: ABI Uses Frame Pointer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS32 , CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_VFORK
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/mips32/Kconfig

    Register r30 may be a frame pointer in some ABIs. Or may just be saved register s8. It makes a difference for vfork handling.

1.2.236 Choice: PIC32MX chip selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX460F512L
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX110F016B: PIC32MX110F016B

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX110F016C: PIC32MX110F016C

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX110F016C (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX110F016D: PIC32MX110F016D

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX110F016D (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX120F032B: PIC32MX120F032B

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX120F032B (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX120F032C: PIC32MX120F032C

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX120F032C (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX120F032D: PIC32MX120F032D

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX120F032D (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX130F064B: PIC32MX130F064B

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX130F064B (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX130F064C: PIC32MX130F064C

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX130F064C (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX130F064D: PIC32MX130F064D

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Microchip PIC32MX130F064D (MIPS32)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX150F128B: PIC32MX150F128B

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237 Menu: PIC32MX Peripheral Support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.1 CONFIG_PIC32MX_WDT: Watchdog timer (WDT)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.2 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T2: Timer 2 (T2)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.3 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T3: Timer 3 (T3)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.4 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T4: Timer 4 (T4)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.5 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T5: Timer 5 (T5)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.6 CONFIG_PIC32MX_IC1: Input Capture 1 (IC1)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.7 CONFIG_PIC32MX_IC2: Input Capture 2 (IC2)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.8 CONFIG_PIC32MX_IC3: Input Capture 3 (IC3)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.9 CONFIG_PIC32MX_IC4: Input Capture 4 (IC4)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.10 CONFIG_PIC32MX_IC5: Input Capture 5 (IC5)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.11 CONFIG_PIC32MX_OC1: Output Compare 1 (OC1)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.12 CONFIG_PIC32MX_OC2: Output Compare 2 (OC2)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.13 CONFIG_PIC32MX_OC3: Output Compare 3 (OC3)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.14 CONFIG_PIC32MX_OC4: Output Compare 4 (OC4)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.15 CONFIG_PIC32MX_OC5: Output Compare 5 (OC5)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.16 CONFIG_PIC32MX_I2C1: I2C1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.17 CONFIG_PIC32MX_I2C2: I2C2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.18 CONFIG_PIC32MX_I2C3: I2C3

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.19 CONFIG_PIC32MX_I2C4: I2C4

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.20 CONFIG_PIC32MX_I2C5: I2C5

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.21 CONFIG_PIC32MX_SPI1: SPI1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.22 CONFIG_PIC32MX_SPI2: SPI2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.23 CONFIG_PIC32MX_SPI3: SPI3

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.24 CONFIG_PIC32MX_SPI4: SPI4

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.25 CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART1: UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.26 CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART2: UART2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.237.27 CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART3: UART3

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

1.2.238 Menu: PIC32MX Peripheral Interrupt Priorities

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.238.1 CONFIG_PIC32MX_CTPRIO: Core Timer Interrupt (CT)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Core Timer Interrupt. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.2 CONFIG_PIC32MX_CS0PRIO: Core Software Interrupt 0 (CS0)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Core Software Interrupt 0. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.3 CONFIG_PIC32MX_CS1PRIO: Core Software Interrupt 1 (CS1)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Core Software Interrupt 1. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.4 CONFIG_PIC32MX_INT0PRIO: External Interrupt 0 (INT0)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    External Interrupt 0. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.5 CONFIG_PIC32MX_INT1PRIO: External Interrupt 1 (INT1)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    External Interrupt 1. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.6 CONFIG_PIC32MX_INT2PRIO: External Interrupt 2 (INT2)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    External Interrupt 2. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.7 CONFIG_PIC32MX_INT3PRIO: External Interrupt 3 (INT3)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    External Interrupt 3. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.8 CONFIG_PIC32MX_INT4PRIO: External Interrupt 4 (INT4)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    External Interrupt 4. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.9 CONFIG_PIC32MX_FSCMPRIO: Fail-Safe Clock Monitor (FSCM)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Fail-Safe Clock Monitor. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.10 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T1PRIO: Timer 1 (T1)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Timer 1 (System timer) priority. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.11 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T2PRIO: Timer 2 (T2)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_T2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Timer 2 priority. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.12 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T3PRIO: Timer 3 (T3)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_T3
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Timer 3 priority. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.13 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T4PRIO: Timer 4 (T4)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_T4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Timer 4 priority. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.14 CONFIG_PIC32MX_T5PRIO: Timer 5 (T5)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Timer 5 priority. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.15 CONFIG_PIC32MX_IC1PRIO: Input Capture 1 (IC1)

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_DMA

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    DMA Channel 6. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.47 CONFIG_PIC32MX_DMA7PRIO: DMA7

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    DMA Channel 7. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.48 CONFIG_PIC32MX_FCEPRIO: FCE

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_FLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Flash Control Event. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.238.49 CONFIG_PIC32MX_USBPRIO: USB

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_USBDEV || CONFIG_PIC32MX_USBHOST
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    USB. Range 4-31, Default 16.

1.2.239 CONFIG_SERIAL_TERMIOS: Serial driver TERMIOS supported

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART1 || CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART2 || CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART3 || CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART4 || CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART5 || CONFIG_PIC32MX_UART6
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Serial driver supports termios.h interfaces (tcsetattr, tcflush, etc.). If this is not defined, then the terminal settings (baud, parity, etc). are not configurable at runtime; serial streams cannot be flushed, etc..

1.2.240 Menu: PIC32MX PHY/Ethernet device driver settings

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.240.1 CONFIG_PHY_AUTONEG: Auto-negotion

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Enable auto-negotion

1.2.240.2 CONFIG_PHY_SPEED100: 100Mbps spped

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET && !CONFIG_PHY_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Select 100Mbit vs. 10Mbit speed.

1.2.240.3 CONFIG_PHY_FDUPLEX: Full duplex

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET && !CONFIG_PHY_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Select full (vs. half) duplex

1.2.240.4 CONFIG_NET_NTXDESC: Number Tx descriptors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Configured number of Tx descriptors. Default: 2

1.2.240.5 CONFIG_NET_NRXDESC: Number Rx descriptors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Configured number of Rx descriptors. Default: 4

1.2.240.6 CONFIG_NET_WOL: Wake-up on LAN

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Enable Wake-up on LAN (not fully implemented).

1.2.240.7 CONFIG_NET_DUMPPACKET: Dump packets

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET && CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Dump all received and transmitted packets. Also needs DEBUG.

1.2.240.8 CONFIG_NET_REGDEBUG: Register level debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET && CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Enabled low level register debug. Also needs DEBUG.

1.2.240.9 CONFIG_NET_HASH: Hash

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Enable receipt of near-perfect match frames.

1.2.240.10 CONFIG_NET_MULTICAST: Multicast

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y

    Dependency: CONFIG_NET_IGMP

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Enable receipt of multicast (and unicast) frames. Automatically set if NET_IGMP is selected.

1.2.241 Menu: Device Configuration 0 (DEVCFG0)

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.241.1 CONFIG_PIC32MX_DEBUGGER: Debugger

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Background Debugger Enable. Default 3 (disabled). The value 2 enables.

1.2.241.2 CONFIG_PIC32MX_ICESEL: ICE channel

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    In-Circuit Emulator/Debugger Communication Channel Select. Default 1 (PG2)

1.2.241.3 CONFIG_PIC32MX_PROGFLASHWP: Program FLASH write protect

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Program FLASH write protect. Default 0xff (disabled)

1.2.241.4 CONFIG_PIC32MX_BOOTFLASHWP: Boot FLASH write protect

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Default 1 (disabled)

1.2.241.5 CONFIG_PIC32MX_CODEWP: Code write protect

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Default 1 (disabled)

1.2.242 Menu: Device Configuration 3 (DEVCFG3)

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

1.2.242.1 CONFIG_PIC32MX_USBIDO: USB ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 1

      Dependency: CONFIG_PIC32MX_USB

    • Default: 0

      Dependency: !CONFIG_PIC32MX_USB

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    USB USBID Selection. Default 1 if USB enabled (USBID pin is controlled by the USB module), but 0 (GPIO) otherwise.

1.2.242.2 CONFIG_PIC32MX_VBUSIO: USB VBUSON

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 1

      Dependency: CONFIG_PIC32MX_USB

    • Default: 0

      Dependency: !CONFIG_PIC32MX_USB

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    USB VBUSON Selection (Default 1 if USB enabled (VBUSON pin is controlled by the USB module, but 0 (GPIO) otherwise.

1.2.242.3 CONFIG_PIC32MX_WDENABLE: Watchdog enable

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Enabled watchdog on power up. Default 0 (watchdog can be enabled later by software).

1.2.242.4 CONFIG_PIC32MX_FETHIO: Ethernet I/O pins

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Ethernet I/O Pin Selection bit:

    1 = Default Ethernet I/O Pins 0 = Alternate Ethernet I/O Pins

1.2.242.5 CONFIG_PIC32MX_FMIIEN: Ethernet MII

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

    Ethernet MII Enable bit

    1 = MII enabled 0 = RMII enabled

1.2.243 Choice: RGMP Architecture

  • Default: RGMP_SUBARCH_X86
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_RGMP
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/rgmp/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_RGMP_SUBARCH_ARM: ARM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_RGMP
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/rgmp/Kconfig

      RGMP ARM architecture"

    CONFIG_RGMP_SUBARCH_X86: x86

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_RGMP
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/rgmp/Kconfig

      RGMP x86 architecture"

1.2.244 Choice: SH chip selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_SH7032
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sh/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_SH7032: SH7032

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SH
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/sh/Kconfig

      Hitachi/Renesas SH7032 (SH1)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_M30262F8: M30262F8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SH
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/sh/Kconfig

      Renesas M30262F8 (M16C)

1.2.245 CONFIG_M16C_UART0: UART0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SH, CONFIG_ARCH_M16C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sh/src/m16c/Kconfig

1.2.246 CONFIG_M16C_UART1: UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SH, CONFIG_ARCH_M16C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sh/src/m16c/Kconfig

1.2.247 CONFIG_M16C_UART2: UART2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SH, CONFIG_ARCH_M16C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sh/src/m16c/Kconfig

1.2.248 CONFIG_SIM_M32: Build 32-bit simulation on 64-bit machine

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Simulation context switching is based on logic like setjmp and longjmp. This context switching is only available for 32-bit targets. On 64-bit machines, this context switching will fail.

    The workaround on 64-bit machines for now is to build for a 32-bit target on the 64-bit machine. The workaround for this issue has been included in NuttX 6.15 and beyond. For thoses versions, you must add SIM_M32=y to the .config file in order to enable building a 32-bit image on a 64-bit platform.

1.2.249 CONFIG_SIM_WALLTIME: Execution simulation in near real-time

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    NOTE: In order to facility fast testing, the sim target's IDLE loop, by default, calls the system timer "interrupt handler" as fast as possible. As a result, there really are no noticeable delays when a task sleeps. However, the task really does sleep -- but the time scale is wrong. If you want behavior that is closer to normal timing, then you can define SIM_WALLTIME=y in your configuration file. This configuration setting will cause the sim target's IDLE loop to delay on each call so that the system "timer interrupt" is called at a rate approximately correct for the system timer tick rate. With this definition in the configuration, sleep() behavior is more or less normal.

1.2.250 CONFIG_SIM_LCDDRIVER: Build a simulated LCD driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_NX && CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Build a simulated LCD driver"

1.2.251 CONFIG_SIM_FRAMEBUFFER: Build a simulated frame buffer driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_NX && !CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Build a simulated frame buffer driver"

1.2.252 CONFIG_SIM_X11FB: Use X11 window

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Use an X11 graphics window to simulate the graphics device"

1.2.253 CONFIG_SIM_X11NOSHM: Don't use shared memory with X11

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_SIM_X11FB
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Don't use shared memory with the X11 graphics device emulation."

1.2.254 CONFIG_SIM_FBHEIGHT: Display height

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 240
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Simulated display height. Default: 240

1.2.255 CONFIG_SIM_FBWIDTH: Display width

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 320

      Dependency: CONFIG_SIM_LCDDRIVER

    • Default: 480

      Dependency: CONFIG_SIM_FRAMEBUFFER

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Simulated width of the display. Default: 320 or 480

1.2.256 CONFIG_SIM_FBBPP: Pixel depth in bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Pixel depth in bits. Valid choices are 4, 8, 16, 24, or 32. If you use the X11 display emulation, the selected BPP must match the BPP of your graphics hardware (probably 32 bits). Default: 8

1.2.257 CONFIG_SIM_TOUCHSCREEN: Support an X11 mouse-based touchscreen emulation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, CONFIG_SIM_X11FB && CONFIG_INPUT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    Support an X11 mouse-based touchscreen emulation. Also needs INPUT=y

1.2.258 CONFIG_SIM_TCNWAITERS: Maximum number poll() waiters

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM, !CONFIG_POLL_DISABLE && CONFIG_SIM_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/sim/Kconfig

    The maximum number of threads that can be waiting on poll() for a touchscreen event. Default: 4

  • Default: ARCH_I486
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_X86
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/x86/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L18220FSG: Z8L18220FSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      100-pin QFP 20MHz 3.3V Z8L182

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L18220AEG: Z8L18220AEG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18020VSG: Z8S18020VSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 68-pin PLCC Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18020VSG1960: Z8S18020VSG1960

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 68-pin PLCC Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18033VSG: Z8S18033VSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 68-pin PLCC Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18010FSG: Z8S18010FSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      80-pin QFP Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18010VEG: Z8S18010VEG

    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 68-pin PLCC Z8S180

      Z180: 68-pin PLCC Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18010VSG: Z8S18010VSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 68-pin PLCC Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18020PSG: Z8S18020PSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80

      64-pin DIP 10Mhz 5V Z8S180

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 80-pin QFP 33MHz 5V Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18033FEG: Z8S18033FEG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 80-pin QFP 33MHz 5V Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18020FSG: Z8S18020FSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80

      Z180: 80-pin QFP 20MHz 5V Z8S180

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      Z180: 68-pin PLCC 33MHz 5V Z8S180

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18010PSG: Z8S18010PSG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80

      Z180: 64-pin DIP 10MHz 5V Z8S180

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S18010FEG: Z8S18010FEG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8S180, CONFIG_ARCH_NOINTC, CONFIG_ADDRENV, CONFIG_HAVE_LOWSERIALINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80

      ZiLOG EZ80F92 (ez80 Acclaim)
