    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/Kconfig

      ZiLOG EZ80F93 (ez80 Acclaim)

1.2.263 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: Z80_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: Z80_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_Z80_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCL: SDCC for Linux, MAC OSX, or Cygwin

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

    CONFIG_Z80_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCW: SDCC for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

1.2.264 CONFIG_LINKER_HOME_AREA: Start of _HOME area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

    Start of the linker HOME area. Default: 0x0000

1.2.265 CONFIG_LINKER_CODE_AREA: Start of _CODE area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

    Start of the linker _CODE area. Default: 0x0200

1.2.266 CONFIG_LINKER_DATA_AREA: Start of _DATA area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x8000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

    Start of the linker _DATA area. Default: 0x8000

1.2.267 CONFIG_LINKER_ROM_AT_0000: ROM at 0x0000

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

    Some architectures may have ROM located at address zero. In this case, a special version of the "head" file must be used.

1.2.268 CONFIG_ARCH_HAVEHEAD: Board-specific Head File

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z80/Kconfig

    Use a board-specific version of the "head" file in the configs/<board-name>/src directory

1.2.269 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: Z180_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: Z180_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_Z180_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCL: SDCC for Linux, MAC OSX, or Cygwin

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    CONFIG_Z180_TOOLCHAIN_SDCCW: SDCC for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.270 CONFIG_LINKER_HOME_AREA: Physical start of _HOME area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Physical address of the start of the linker HOME area. Default: 0x0000

1.2.271 CONFIG_LINKER_CODE_AREA: Physical start of _CODE area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Physical address of the start of the linker _CODE area. Default: 0x0200

1.2.272 CONFIG_LINKER_DATA_AREA: Physical start of _DATA area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x8000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Physical address of the start of the linker _DATA area. Default: 0x8000

1.2.273 CONFIG_LINKER_ROM_AT_0000: ROM at Physical 0x0000

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Some architectures may have ROM located at physical address zero. In this case, a special version of the "head" file must be used.

1.2.274 CONFIG_Z180_BANKAREA_VIRTBASE: Virtual Start of Bank Area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x8000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    This setting provides the virtual address of the start of the Bank Area. NOTE that 0x0000 <= Z180_BANKAREA_BASE <= Z180_COMMONAREA_BASE is required! Default: 0x8000

    NuttX Memory Organization:

    Common Area 0: This area holds the common NuttX code that is directly call-able from all application threads. Common Area always starts at virtual address 0x0000 and extends to the Bank Area

    Base Area: This area holds the common NuttX data (including the share-able heap) that is accessible from all applications and extends to Common Area 1.

    NOTE: That is execution from RAM, the common NuttX code and data may be contiguous and lie in the same region (either Common Area 0 or the Bank Area). The two regions above would apply in a ROM'ed system, where Common Area 1 is ROM and the Base Area is RAM.

    Common Area 1: This area holds the code and data that is unique to a particular task. his area extends to the end of the virtual address space. All tasks share the same virtual Common Area 2 virtual address (but each has a unique mapping to different, underlying physical addresses).

1.2.275 CONFIG_Z180_BANKAREA_PHYSBASE: Physical Start of Bank Area

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x08000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    This setting provides the physical address of the start of the Bank Area. Default: 0x08000

1.2.276 CONFIG_Z180_COMMON1AREA_VIRTBASE: Virtual Start of Common Area 1

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xc000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    This setting provides the virtual address of the start of the Common Area 1. NOTE that 0x0000 <= Z180_BANKAREA_BASE <= Z180_COMMONAREA_BASE is required! Default: 0xc000

    NuttX Memory Organization:

    Common Area 0: This area holds the common NuttX code that is directly call-able from all application threads. Common Area always starts at virtual address 0x0000 and extends to the Bank Area

    Base Area: This area holds the common NuttX data (including the share-able heap) that is accessible from all applications and extends to Common Area 1.

    NOTE: That is execution from RAM, the common NuttX code and data may be contiguous and lie in the same region (either Common Area 0 or the Bank Area). The two regions above would apply in a ROM'ed system, where Common Area 1 is ROM and the Base Area is RAM.

    Common Area 1: This area holds the code and data that is unique to a particular task. his area extends to the end of the virtual address space. All tasks share the same virtual Common Area 2 virtual address (but each has a unique mapping to different, underlying physical addresses).

1.2.277 CONFIG_Z180_PHYSHEAP_START: Physical Start of Free Memory

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0c000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    This setting provides the physical address of the start of free physical memory that will be used to allocate memory for tasks (Common Area 1). Default: 0x0c000

1.2.278 CONFIG_Z180_PHYSHEAP_END: Physical End(+1) of Free Memory

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x100000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    This setting provides the physical address of the end(+1) of free physical memory that will be used to allocate memory for tasks (Common Area 1). Default: 0x100000

1.2.279 CONFIG_ARCH_HAVEHEAD: Board-specific Head File

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Use a board-specific version of the "head" file in the configs/<board-name>/src directory

1.2.280 Menu: Z180 Peripheral Support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.280.1 CONFIG_Z180_UART0: UART0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a serial port on UART0. On the Z8x182, bits 0-4 of port B will not be available if ASCI channel 0 is selected.

1.2.280.2 CONFIG_Z180_UART1: UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a serial port on UART1. On the Z8x182, bits 5-7 of port B will not be available if ASCI channel 0 is selected.

1.2.280.3 CONFIG_Z180_SCC: SCC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80181 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L181
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a serial port on the SCC

1.2.280.4 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA: ESCC Channel A

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80182 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a serial port on ESCC Channel A. Not available if port C is selected.

1.2.280.5 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB: ESCC Channel B

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , (CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80182 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182) && !CONFIG_Z180_MIMIC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a serial port on ESCC Channel B

1.2.280.6 CONFIG_Z180_PRT1: Timer 1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a Programmable Reload Timer 1 (PRT1, PRT0 is used by NuttX as the system timer)

1.2.280.7 CONFIG_Z180_PORTA: PORT A

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , (CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80181 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L181 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80182 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182) && !CONFIG_Z180_CTC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a Port A (called PIA1 on the Z8x181)

1.2.280.8 CONFIG_Z180_PORTB: PORT B

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80181 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L181 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80182 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a Port B (called PIA2 on the Z8x181). On the Z8x182, Bits 5-7 will not be available if ASCI channel 1 is used; Bits 0-4 will not be available if ASCI channel 0 is used.

1.2.280.9 CONFIG_Z180_PORTC: PORT C

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , (CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80182 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182) && !CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable a Port C. Not available if ESCC channel A is selected.

1.2.280.10 CONFIG_Z180_CTC: CTC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80181 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L181
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable the Counter/Timer (CTC)

1.2.280.11 CONFIG_Z180_MIMIC: 16550 MIMIC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80182 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8L182
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Select to enable the 16550 MIMIC

1.2.281 Choice: Serial console

  • Default: NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_Z180_UART0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART0

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_UART0
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    CONFIG_Z180_UART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_UART1
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    CONFIG_Z180_SCC_SERIAL_CONSOLE: SCC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_SCC
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA_SERIAL_CONSOLE: ESCC Channel A

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB_SERIAL_CONSOLE: ESCC Channel B

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.282 Menu: UART0 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.282.1 CONFIG_Z180_UART0_RXBUFSIZE: Receive Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.2.282.2 CONFIG_Z180_UART0_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.2.282.3 CONFIG_Z180_UART0_BAUD: Baud Rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 9600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the SCC.

1.2.282.4 CONFIG_Z180_UART0_BITS: Character Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The number of bits in one character. Must be either 5, 6, 7, or 8.

1.2.282.5 CONFIG_Z180_UART0_PARITY: Parity Setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.2.282.6 CONFIG_Z180_UART0_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.2.283 Menu: UART1 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.283.1 CONFIG_Z180_UART1_RXBUFSIZE: Receive Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.2.283.2 CONFIG_Z180_UART1_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.2.283.3 CONFIG_Z180_UART1_BAUD: Baud Rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 9600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the SCC.

1.2.283.4 CONFIG_Z180_UART1_BITS: Character Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The number of bits in one character. Must be either 5, 6, 7, or 8.

1.2.283.5 CONFIG_Z180_UART1_PARITY: Parity Setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.2.283.6 CONFIG_Z180_UART1_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.2.284 Menu: SCC Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_SCC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.284.1 CONFIG_Z180_SCC_RXBUFSIZE: Receive Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.2.284.2 CONFIG_Z180_SCC_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.2.284.3 CONFIG_Z180_SCC_BAUD: Baud Rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 9600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the SCC.

1.2.284.4 CONFIG_Z180_SCC_BITS: Character Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The number of bits in one character. Must be either 5, 6, 7, or 8.

1.2.284.5 CONFIG_Z180_SCC_PARITY: Parity Setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.2.284.6 CONFIG_Z180_SCC_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.2.285 Menu: ESCC Channel A Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.285.1 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA_RXBUFSIZE: Receive Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.2.285.2 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.2.285.3 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA_BAUD: Baud Rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 9600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the SCC.

1.2.285.4 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA_BITS: Character Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The number of bits in one character. Must be either 5, 6, 7, or 8.

1.2.285.5 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA_PARITY: Parity Setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.2.285.6 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCA_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.2.286 Menu: ESCC Channel B Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180 , CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

1.2.286.1 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB_RXBUFSIZE: Receive Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.2.286.2 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.2.286.3 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB_BAUD: Baud Rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 9600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the SCC.

1.2.286.4 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB_BITS: Character Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    The number of bits in one character. Must be either 5, 6, 7, or 8.

1.2.286.5 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB_PARITY: Parity Setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.2.286.6 CONFIG_Z180_ESCCB_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z180
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/z180/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.2.287 Menu: ez80 Peripheral Support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

1.2.287.1 CONFIG_EZ80_UART0: UART0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

1.2.287.2 CONFIG_EZ80_UART1: UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

1.2.287.3 CONFIG_EZ80_UART2: UART2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

1.2.287.4 CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC: Ethernet MAC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    Enables support for ez80 EMAC driver.

1.2.288 CONFIG_EZ80_FIAD: PHY Address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x1f
  • Range: 0x00 - 0x1f
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    Provides the MII address of the PHY device

1.2.289 CONFIG_EZ80_PHYCONFIG: PHY Configuration

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    0:Autonegotiate, 1:100FD, 2:100HD, 3:10FD, 4:10HD

1.2.290 CONFIG_EZ80_RAMADDR: Address of internal SRAM

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffc000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    Address of internal SRAM (default is 0xffc000)

1.2.291 CONFIG_EZ80_PKTBUFSIZE: Packet Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    The size of one packet buffer. EZ80_PKTBUFSIZE + (EZ80_NTXPKTBUFS+EZ80_NRXPKTBUFS) must add up to exactly 8192 bytes.

1.2.292 CONFIG_EZ80_NTXPKTBUFS: Number of Tx Packets

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    The number of Tx packets. EZ80_PKTBUFSIZE + (EZ80_NTXPKTBUFS+EZ80_NRXPKTBUFS) must add up to exactly 8192 bytes.

1.2.293 CONFIG_EZ80_NRXPKTBUFS: Number of Rx Packets

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    The number of Rx packets. EZ80_PKTBUFSIZE + (EZ80_NTXPKTBUFS+EZ80_NRXPKTBUFS) must add up to exactly 8192 bytes.

1.2.294 CONFIG_EZ80_MDCDIV: SCLK Divider

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    The value to use for the divider to derive the MII MDC clock from SCLK. Options are 1->4; 2->6; 3->8; 4->10; 5->14; 6->20; and 7->28

1.2.295 CONFIG_EZ80_TXPOLLTIMERMS: Tx Poll Milliseconds

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    Specifies how often the EMAC controller should poll for a Tx packet (milliseconds)

1.2.296 CONFIG_ARCH_MCFILTER: Multicast Filtering

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80 , CONFIG_EZ80_EMAC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    Enables multicast MAC address filtering (not fully implemented)

1.2.297 CONFIG_ARCH_TIMERHOOK: Timer Hook

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/z80/src/ez80/Kconfig

    Select this option to enabled a direct call-out from the ez80 timer interrupt handler. If this is enabled, the ez80 timer interrupt interrupt will call a user provided function called up_timerhook(). At present, this timer hook is only used for driving the segment LED on board certain ez80 boards.

1.2.298 CONFIG_ARCH_STACKDUMP: Dump stack on assertions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Enable to do stack dumps after assertions

1.2.299 CONFIG_ENDIAN_BIG: Big Endian Architecture

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Select if architecture operates using big-endian byte ordering.

1.2.300 CONFIG_ARCH_RAMFUNCS: Copy functions to RAM on startup

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMFUNCS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Copy some functions to RAM at boot time. This is done in some architectures to improve performance. In other cases, it is done so that FLASH can be reconfigured while the MCU executes out of SRAM.

1.2.301 CONFIG_ARCH_RAMVECTORS: Support RAM interrupt vectors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMVECTORS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If ARCH_RAMVECTORS is defined, then the architecture will support modifiable vectors in a RAM-based vector table.

1.2.302 CONFIG_BOARD_LOOPSPERMSEC: Delay loops per millisecond

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5000
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Simple delay loops are used by some logic, especially during boot-up, driver initialization. These delay loops must be calibrated for each board in order to assure accurate timing by the delay loops.

1.2.303 CONFIG_ARCH_CALIBRATION: Calibrate delay loop

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Enables some built in instrumentation that causes a 100 second delay during boot-up. This 100 second delay serves no purpose other than it allows you to calibratre BOARD_LOOPSPERMSEC. You simply use a stop watch to measure the actual delay then adjust BOARD_LOOPSPERMSEC until the actual delay is 100 seconds.

1.2.304 CONFIG_ARCH_INTERRUPTSTACK: Interrupt Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    This architecture supports an interrupt stack. If defined, this symbol will be the size of the interrupt stack in bytes. If not defined (or defined to be zero), the user task stacks will be used during interrupt handling.

1.2.305 Choice: Boot Mode

  • Default: BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMEXTSRAM: Run from external SRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configuration support booting and running from external SRAM.

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH: Boot and run from flash

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Most configurations support XIP operation from FLASH but must copy initialized .data sections to RAM. (This is the default).

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMISRAM: Boot and run from internal SRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configuration support booting and running from internal SRAM.

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMSDRAM: Boot and run from external SDRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configuration support booting and running from external SDRAM.

    CONFIG_BOOT_COPYTORAM: Boot from FLASH but copy to ram

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configurations boot in FLASH but copy themselves entirely into RAM for better performance.

1.2.306 Menu: Boot Memory Configuration

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

1.2.306.1 CONFIG_RAM_START: Primary RAM start address (physical)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The physical start address of primary installed RAM. "Primary" RAM refers to the RAM that you link program code into. If program code does not excecute out of RAM but from FLASH, then you may designate any block of RAM as "primary."

1.2.306.2 CONFIG_RAM_VSTART: Primary RAM start address (virtual)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual start address of installed primary RAM. "Primary" RAM refers to the RAM that you link program code into. If program code does not excecute out of RAM but from FLASH, then you may designate any block of RAM as "primary."

1.2.306.3 CONFIG_RAM_SIZE: Primary RAM size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The size in bytes of the installed primary RAM. "Primary" RAM refers to the RAM that you link program code into. If program code does not excecute out of RAM but from FLASH, then you may designate any block of RAM as "primary."

1.2.306.4 CONFIG_FLASH_START: Boot FLASH start address (physical)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The physical start address of installed boot FLASH. "Boot" FLASH refers to the FLASH that you link program code into.

1.2.306.5 CONFIG_FLASH_VSTART: Boot FLASH start address (virtual)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual start address of installed boot FLASH. "Boot" FLASH refers to the FLASH that you link program code into.

1.2.306.6 CONFIG_FLASH_SIZE: Boot FLASH size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The size in bytes of the installed boot FLASH. "Boot" FLASH refers to the FLASH that you link program code into.

1.3 Menu: Board Selection

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.3.1 Choice: Select target board

  • Default: ARCH_BOARD_CUSTOM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    • Select the board hosting the architure. You must first select the exact MCU part number, then the boards supporting that part will be available for selection. Use ARCH_BOARD_CUSTOM to create a new board configuration.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_AMBER: Amber Web Server

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ATMEGA128
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is placeholder for the SoC Robotics Amber Web Server that is based on the Atmel AVR ATMega128 MCU. There is not much there yet and what is there is untested due to tool-related issues.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARDUINO_DUE: Arduino Due

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ATSAM3X8E
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This options selects the Arduino DUE board featuring the Atmel ATSAM3X8E MCU running at 84 MHz.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_AVR32DEV1: Atmel AVR32DEV1 board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_AT32UC3B0256
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is a port of NuttX to the Atmel AVR32DEV1 board. That board is based on the Atmel AT32UC3B0256 MCU and uses a specially patched version of the GNU toolchain: The patches provide support for the AVR32 family. That patched GNU toolchain is available only from the Atmel website. STATUS: This port is functional but very basic. There are configurations for NSH and the OS test.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_C5471EVM: Spectrum Digital C5471 evaluation board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_C5471
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is a port to the Spectrum Digital C5471 evaluation board. The TMS320C5471 is a dual core processor from TI with an ARM7TDMI general purpose processor and a c54 DSP. It is also known as TMS320DA180 or just DA180. NuttX runs on the ARM core and is built with a GNU arm-nuttx-elf toolchain*. This port is complete and verified.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_CLOUDCTRL: Darcy's CloudController stm32f10x board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32F107VC
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Small network relay development board. Based on the Shenzhou IV development board design.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_COMPALE88: Compal e88 phone

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      These directories contain the board support for compal e88 and e99 phones. These ports are based on patches contributed by Denis Carikli for both the compal e99 and e88. The patches were made by Alan Carvalho de Assis and Denis Carikli using the Stefan Richter's Osmocom-bb patches.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_COMPALE99: Compal e99 phone

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      These directories contain the board support for compal e88 and e99 phones. These ports are based on patches contributed by Denis Carikli for both the compal e99 and e88. The patches were made by Alan Carvalho de Assis and Denis Carikli using the Stefan Richter's Osmocom-bb patches.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_DEMOS92S12NEC64: Freescale DMO9S12NE64 board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MCS92S12NEC64
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Freescale DMO9S12NE64 board based on the MC9S12NE64 hcs12 cpu. This port uses the m9s12x GCC toolchain. STATUS: (Still) under development; it is code complete but has not yet been verified.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_EA3131: Embedded Artists EA3131 Development board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC3131
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Embedded Artists EA3131 Development board. This board is based on the an NXP LPC3131 MCU. This OS is built with the arm-nuttx-elf toolchain*. STATUS: This port is complete and mature.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_EA3152: Embedded Artists EA3152 Development board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC3152
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Embedded Artists EA3152 Development board. This board is based on the an NXP LPC3152 MCU. This OS is built with the arm-nuttx-elf toolchain*. STATUS: This port is has not be exercised well, but since it is a simple derivative of the ea3131, it should be fully functional.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_EAGLE100: Micromint Eagle-100 Development board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S6918
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Micromint Eagle-100 Development board. This board is based on the an ARM Cortex-M3 MCU, the Luminary LM3S6918. This OS is built with the arm-nuttx-elf toolchain*. STATUS: This port is complete and mature.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_EKKLM3S9B96: TI/Stellaris EKK-LM3S9B96

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S9B96
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      TI/Stellaris EKK-LM3S9B96 board. This board is based on the an EKK-LM3S9B96 which is a Cortex-M3.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_EZ80F910200KITG: ZiLOG ez80f910200kitg development kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80F91
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      ez80Acclaim! Microcontroller. This port use the ZiLOG ez80f910200kitg development kit, eZ80F091 part, and the Zilog ZDS-II Windows command line tools. The development environment is Cygwin under WinXP.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_EZ80F910200ZCO: ZiLOG ez80f910200zco development kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_EZ80F91
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      ez80Acclaim! Microcontroller. This port use the Zilog ez80f910200zco development kit, eZ80F091 part, and the Zilog ZDS-II Windows command line tools. The development environment is Cygwin under WinXP.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FREEDOM_KL25Z: Freescale Freedom KL25Z

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MKL25Z128
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is the configuration for the Freescale Freedom KL25Z board. This board has the K25Z120LE3AN chip with a built-in SDA debugger.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_HYMINI_STM32V: HY-Mini STM32v board

    • Type: Boolean

    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MICROPENDOUS3: Opendous Micropendous 3 board

    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is a port to the Opendous Micropendous 3 board. This board may be populated with either an AVR AT90USB646, 647, 1286, or 1287 MCU. Support is configured for the AT90USB647.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MX1ADS: Motorola MX1ADS development board

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX1
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is a port to the Motorola MX1ADS development board. That board is based on the Freescale i.MX1 processor. The i.MX1 is an ARM920T. STATUS: This port is nearly code complete but was never fully integrated due to tool-related issues.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_NE64BADGE: FEG NE64 /PoE Badge board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MCS92S12NEC64
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Future Electronics Group NE64 /PoE Badge board based on the MC9S12NE64 hcs12 cpu. This port uses the m9s12x GCC toolchain. STATUS: Under development. The port is code-complete but has not yet been fully tested.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_NTOSD_DM320: Neuros OSD v1.0 Dev Board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_DM320
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This port uses the Neuros OSD v1.0 Dev Board with a GNU arm-nuttx-elf toolchain*: see

      http://wiki.neurostechnology.com/index.php/OSD_1.0_Developer_Home

      There are some differences between the Dev Board and the currently available commercial v1.0 Boards. See

      http://wiki.neurostechnology.com/index.php/OSD_Developer_Board_v1

      NuttX operates on the ARM9EJS of this dual core processor. STATUS: This port is code complete, verified, and included in the NuttX 0.2.1 release.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_OPEN1788: Wave Share Open1788

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_P112: P112 Z180-based platform

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8018216FSG
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      The P112 is notable because it was the first of the hobbyist single board computers to reach the production stage. The P112 hobbyist computers were relatively widespread and inspired other hobbyist centered home brew computing projects such as N8VEM home brew computing project. The P112 project still maintains many devoted enthusiasts and has an online repository of software and other information.

      The P112 computer originated as a commercial product of "D-X Designs Pty Ltd" of Australia. They describe the computer as "The P112 is a stand-alone 8-bit CPU board. Typically running CP/M (tm) or a similar operating system, it provides a Z80182 (Z-80 upgrade) CPU with up to 1MB of memory, serial, parallel and diskette IO, and realtime clock, in a 3.5-inch drive form factor. Powered solely from 5V, it draws 150mA (nominal: not including disk drives) with a 16MHz CPU clock. Clock speeds up to 24.576MHz are possible."

      The P112 board was last available new in 1996 by Dave Brooks. In late 2004 on the Usenet Newsgroup comp.os.cpm, talk about making another run of P112 boards was discussed. David Griffith decided to produce additional P112 kits with Dave Brooks blessing and the assistance of others. In addition Terry Gulczynski makes additional P112 derivative hobbyist home brew computers. Hal Bower was very active in the mid 1990's on the P112 project and ported the "Banked/Portable BIOS".

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_PCBLOGICPIC32MX: PIC32MX board from PCB Logic Design Co

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX460F512L
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is the port of NuttX to the PIC32MX board from PCB Logic Design Co. This board features the MicroChip PIC32MX460F512L. The board is a very simple -- little more than a carrier for the PIC32 MCU plus voltage regulation, debug interface, and an OTG connector. STATUS: Code complete but testing has been stalled due to tool related problems (PICkit 2 does not work with the PIC32).

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_PIC32_STARTERKIT: Microchip PIC32 Ethernet Starter Kit (DM320004)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX795F512L
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This is the port of NuttX to the Microchip PIC32 Ethernet Starter Kit (DM320004) with the Multimedia Expansion Board (MEB, DM320005). See www.microchip.com for further information.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_QEMU_I486: Qemu i486 Mode

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_X86 || CONFIG_ARCH_I486
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Port of NuttX to QEMU in i486 mode. This port will also run on real i486 hardwared (Google the Bifferboard).

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_RGMP: RGMP

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_RGMP
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      RGMP stands for RTOS and GPOS on Multi-Processor. RGMP is a project for running GPOS and RTOS simultaneously on multi-processor platforms. You can port your favorite RTOS to RGMP together with an unmodified Linux to form a hybrid operating system. This makes your application able to use both RTOS and GPOS features.

      See http://rgmp.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Main_Page for further information about RGMP.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAMA5D3X_EK: Atmel SAMA5D3x-EK development board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ATSAMA5D31 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ATSAMA5D33 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ATSAMA5D34 || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ATSAMA5D35
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      The port of NuttX to the Atmel SAMA5D3x-EK development board (where x=1,3,4, or 5).

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_XTRS: XTRS TRS80 Model 3 emulation

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      TRS80 Model 3. This port uses a vintage computer based on the Z80. An emulator for this computer is available to run TRS80 programs on a linux platform (http://www.tim-mann.org/xtrs.html).

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_Z16F2800100ZCOG: Zilog Z16F2800100ZCOG Development Kit

    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      z16f Microcontroller. This port use the ZiLIG z16f2800100zcog development kit and the Zilog ZDS-II Windows command line tools. The development environment is Cygwin under WinXP.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_Z80SIM: Z80 Instruction Set Simulator

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z80
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      z80 Microcontroller. This port uses a Z80 instruction set simulator. That simulator can be found in the NuttX GIT at http://sourceforge.net/p/nuttx/git/ci/master/tree/misc/sims/z80sim. This port also uses the SDCC toolchain (http://sdcc.sourceforge.net/") (verified with version 2.6.0).

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_Z8ENCORE000ZCO: ZiLOG Z8ENCORE000ZCO Development Kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8F6403
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      z8Encore! Microcontroller. This port use the ZiLOG Z8ENCORE000ZCO development kit, Z8F6403 part, and the Zilog ZDS-II Windows command line tools. The development environment is Cygwin under WinXP.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_Z8F64200100KIT: ZiLOG Z8F64200100KIT Development Kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_Z8F6423
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      z8Encore! Microcontroller. This port use the Zilog Z8F64200100KIT development kit, Z8F6423 part, and the Zilog ZDS-II Windows command line tools. The development environment is Cygwin under WinXP.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ZP214XPA: The0.net LPC2148 Development Board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC2148
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      This port is for the NXP LPC2148 as provided on the The0.net ZPA213X/4XPA development board. Includes support for the UG-2864AMBAG01 OLED also from The0.net

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ZKITARM: Zilogic ZKit-ARM-1769 Development Kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC1768
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Zilogic System's ARM development Kit, ZKIT-ARM-1769. This board is based on the NXP LPC1769. The Nuttx Buildroot toolchain is used by default.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIM: User mode simulation

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      A user-mode port of NuttX to the x86 Linux/Cygwin platform is available. The purpose of this port is primarily to support OS feature development. This port does not support interrupts or a real timer (and hence no round robin scheduler) Otherwise, it is complete.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_CUSTOM: Custom development board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

      Select this option if there is no directory for the board under configs/.

      Don't see the board you want? You must first select the exact MCU part number, then the boards supporting that part will be available for selection.

1.3.2 CONFIG_ARCH_LEDS: Board LED support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    Use board LEDs to show NuttX execution status state. Unique to boards that have LEDs

1.3.3 CONFIG_ARCH_BUTTONS: Board button support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    "Support interfaces to use buttons provided by the board."

1.3.4 CONFIG_ARCH_IRQBUTTONS: Button interrupt support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BUTTONS && CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    "Support interrupts on button presses and releases."

1.3.5 CONFIG_NSH_MMCSDMINOR: MMC/SD minor number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_MMCSD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    If board-specific NSH start-up logic needs to mount an MMC/SD device, then the setting should be provided to identify the MMC/SD minor device number (i.e., the N in /dev/mmcsdN). Default 0

1.3.6 CONFIG_NSH_MMCSDSLOTNO: MMC/SD slot number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_MMCSD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    If board-specific NSH start-up supports more than one MMC/SD slot, then this setting should be provided to indicate which slot should be used. Default: 0.

1.3.7 CONFIG_NSH_MMCSDSPIPORTNO: MMC/SD SPI device number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_MMCSD && CONFIG_MMCSD_SPI
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/Kconfig

    If board-specif NSH start-up logic will mount an SPI-based MMC/SD volume, then this setting may be needed to tell the board logic which SPI bus to use. Default: 0 (meaning is board-specific).

1.3.8 CONFIG_ARDUINO_ITHEAD_TFT: ITEAD 2.4 inch TFT w/Touch

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARDUINO_DUE, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARDUINO_DUE
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/arduino-due/Kconfig

    Select this option if you have the ITEAD 2.4" TFT module installed. This will enable support for the peripherals on that module including the SD card, TFT LCD, and touchscreen controller.

1.3.9 Choice: Select Wildfire STM32 version

  • Default: ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32V2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/fire-stm32v2/Kconfig

    • This port has logic differences to support either the Version 2 or Version 3 of the Wildfire board.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32V2: Wildfire STM32v2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/fire-stm32v2/Kconfig

      Selects the M3 Wildfire version 2.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32V3: Wildfire STM32v3

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_FIRE_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/fire-stm32v2/Kconfig

      Selects the M3 Wildfire version 3.

1.3.10 CONFIG_LCD_R61505U: LCD Based on R61505U LCD Controller

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_HYMINI_STM32V, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_HYMINI_STM32V , CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER && !CONFIG_LCD_SSD1289
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/hymini-stm32v/Kconfig

    Enables HY-Mini STM32v support for any LCD based on the R61505U, LCD Controller.

1.3.11 CONFIG_MIKROE_FLASH: MTD driver for onboard 1M FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P, CONFIG_MTD_SMART, CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS, CONFIG_STM32_SPI3, CONFIG_MTD_BYTE_WRITE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Configures an MTD device for use with the onboard flash

1.3.12 CONFIG_MIKROE_FLASH_MINOR: Minor number for the FLASH /dev/smart entry

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_MIKROE_FLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Sets the minor number for the FLASH MTD /dev entry

1.3.13 CONFIG_MIKROE_FLASH_PART: Enable partition support on FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_MIKROE_FLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Enables creation of partitions on the FLASH

1.3.14 CONFIG_MIKROE_FLASH_PART_LIST: Flash partition size list

  • Type: String
  • Default: "256,768"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_MIKROE_FLASH_PART
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Comma separated list of partition sizes in KB

1.3.15 CONFIG_MIKROE_RAMMTD: MTD driver for SMARTFS RAM disk

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Configures an MTD based RAM device for use with SMARTFS.

1.3.16 CONFIG_MIKROE_RAMMTD_MINOR: Minor number for RAM /dev/smart entry

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_MIKROE_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Sets the minor number for the RAM MTD /dev entry

1.3.17 CONFIG_MIKROE_RAMMTD_SIZE: Size in KB of the RAM device to create

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_MIKROE_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Sets the size of static RAM allocation for the SMART RAM device

1.3.18 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_SEC: PM_STANDBY delay (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 15
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.19 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_NSEC: PM_STANDBY delay (nanoseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.20 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP: PM_SLEEP wake-up alarm

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Wake-up of PM_SLEEP mode after a delay and resume normal operation.

1.3.21 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_SEC: PM_SLEEP delay (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.22 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_NSEC: PM_SLEEP delay (nanoseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIKROE_STM32F4 , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mikroe-stm32f4/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.23 CONFIG_MIRTOO_RELEASE: Mirtoo Release 1 (R1)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIRTOO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_MIRTOO
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/mirtoo/Kconfig

    Select the Mirtoo release number

1.3.24 CONFIG_SAMA5_NOR_MAIN: Build nor_main

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAMA5D3X_EK, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAMA5D3X_EK , CONFIG_SAMA5_BOOT_ISRAM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sama5d3x-ek/Kconfig

    nor_main is a tiny program that runs in ISRAM. nor_main will enable NOR flash then either (1) jump to the program in NOR flash or (2) wait for you to break in with GDB to debug the NOR program.

1.3.25 CONFIG_SAMA5_NOR_START: Start NOR program

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAMA5D3X_EK, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAMA5D3X_EK , CONFIG_SAMA5_NOR_MAIN
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sama5d3x-ek/Kconfig

    The default behavior of the NOR boot program is to initialize the NOR FLASH at CS0, then patiently wait for you to break into the program with GDB. An alternative behvior is enabled with this option: If SAMA5_NOR_START is defined, then it will not wait but will, instead, immediately start the program in NOR FLASH.

1.3.26 Menu: SAM4L Xplained Pro Modules

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

1.3.26.1 CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_SLCD1MODULE: SLCD1 Module

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

    The SLCD 1 module is attached. This module provides a segment LCD that connects directly to the "EXT5 SEGMENT LCD" connector. When the SLCD is connected, EXT2 is not available for other modules.

1.3.26.2 CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_IOMODULE: I/O1 Module

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

    The I/O 1 module is attached. This module provides an MMC/SD card slot.

1.3.26.3 Choice: I/O1 Module Location

  • Default: SAM4L_XPLAINED_IOMODULE_EXT1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED , CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_IOMODULE
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_IOMODULE_EXT1: EXT1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED , CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_IOMODULE
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_IOMODULE_EXT2: EXT2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED , CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_IOMODULE , !CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_SLCD1MODULE
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

1.3.26.4 CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_OLED1MODULE: OLED1 Module

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

    The OLED 1 module is attached. This module provides an OLED plus 3 additional switches and 3 additional LEDs.

1.3.26.5 Choice: OLED1 Module Location

  • Default: SAM4L_XPLAINED_OLED1MODULE_EXT1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED , CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_OLED1MODULE
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_OLED1MODULE_EXT1: EXT1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED , CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_OLED1MODULE
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_OLED1MODULE_EXT2: EXT2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SAM4L_XPLAINED , CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_OLED1MODULE , !CONFIG_SAM4L_XPLAINED_SLCD1MODULE
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/sam4l-xplained/Kconfig

1.3.27 Menu: LCD Controller Selection

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

1.3.27.1 CONFIG_STM32_ILI1505_DISABLE: Disable ILI1505

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI1505 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.27.2 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9300_DISABLE: Disable ILI9300

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI9300 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.27.3 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9320_DISABLE: Disable ILI9320

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI9320 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.27.4 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9321_DISABLE: Disable ILI9321

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI9321 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.27.5 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9325_DISABLE: Disable ILI9325

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI9325 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.27.6 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9328_DISABLE: Disable ILI9328

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI9328 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.27.7 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9331_DISABLE: Disable ILI9331

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI9331 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.27.8 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9919_DISABLE: Disable ILI9919

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SHENZHOU , CONFIG_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/shenzhou/Kconfig

    This may be defined to disable support for the ILI9919 LCD controller You might want to eliminate unused LCD controll support in order to reduce the FLASH footprint.

1.3.28 CONFIG_STM3210E_LCD: Select support for the STM3210E-EVAL LCD

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL , CONFIG_LCD && CONFIG_STM32_FSMC
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Enable support for the LCD on the STM3210E-EVAL board. See additional, LCD-common settings in the drivers/lcd Kconfig file.

1.3.29 CONFIG_LCD_BACKLIGHT: LCD backlight support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3210E_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Define to support a backlight.

1.3.30 CONFIG_LCD_PWM: LCD backlight PWM control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL , CONFIG_LCD_BACKLIGHT && CONFIG_STM32_TIM1
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    If STM32_TIM1 is also defined, then an adjustable backlight will be provided using timer 1 to generate various pulse widthes. The granularity of the settings is determined by LCD_MAXPOWER. If LCD_PWM (or STM32_TIM1) is not defined, then a simple on/off backlight is provided.

1.3.31 CONFIG_LCD_RDSHIFT: LCD data shift

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3210E_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    When reading 16-bit gram data, there appears to be a shift in the returned data. This value fixes the offset. Default 5.

1.3.32 CONFIG_STM32_AM240320_DISABLE: Disable AM240320 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3210E_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The LCD driver dynamically selects the LCD based on the reported LCD ID value. However, code size can be reduced by suppressing support for individual LCDs using this option

1.3.33 CONFIG_STM32_SPFD5408B_DISABLE: Disable SPFD5408B support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3210E_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The LCD driver dynamically selects the LCD based on the reported LCD ID value. However, code size can be reduced by suppressing support for individual LCDs using this option

1.3.34 CONFIG_STM32_R61580_DISABLE: Disable R61580 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3210E_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The LCD driver dynamically selects the LCD based on the reported LCD ID value. However, code size can be reduced by suppressing support for individual LCDs using this option

1.3.35 CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS: PM Button support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_ARCH_IRQBUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Enable PM button EXTI interrupts to support PM testing

1.3.36 CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS_MIN: Minimum button number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The lowest button code to use for PM testing (see board.h)

1.3.37 CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS_MAX: Maximum button number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 7
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The highest button code to use for PM testing (see board.h)

1.3.38 CONFIG_PM_IRQBUTTONS_MIN: Minimum interrupting button number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The lowest interrupting button code to use for PM testing (see board.h)

1.3.39 CONFIG_PM_IRQBUTTONS_MAX: Maximum interrupting button number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 7
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The highest interrupting button code to use for PM testing (see board.h)

1.3.40 CONFIG_PM_BUTTON_ACTIVITY: Button PM activity weight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    The activity weight to report to the power management subsystem when a button is pressed.

1.3.41 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_SEC: PM_STANDBY delay (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 15
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.42 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_NSEC: PM_STANDBY delay (nanoseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.43 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP: PM_SLEEP wake-up alarm

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Wake-up of PM_SLEEP mode after a delay and resume normal operation.

1.3.44 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_SEC: PM_SLEEP delay (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.45 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_NSEC: PM_SLEEP delay (nanoseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3210E_EVAL, CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3210e-eval/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.46 CONFIG_STM3220G_LCD: Select support for the STM3210E-EVAL LCD

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL , CONFIG_LCD && CONFIG_STM32_FSMC
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3220g-eval/Kconfig

    Enable support for the LCD on the STM3220G-EVAL board. See additional, LCD-common settings in the drivers/lcd Kconfig file.

1.3.47 CONFIG_LCD_RDSHIFT: LCD data shift

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3220G_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3220g-eval/Kconfig

    When reading 16-bit gram data, there appears to be a shift in the returned data. This value fixes the offset. Default 5.

1.3.48 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9320_DISABLE: Disable LCD_ILI9320 (and LCD_ILI9321) support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3220G_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3220g-eval/Kconfig

    The LCD driver dynamically selects the LCD based on the reported LCD ID value. However, code size can be reduced by suppressing support for individual LCDs using this option.

1.3.49 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9325_DISABLE: Disable LCD_ILI9325 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3220G_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3220G_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3220g-eval/Kconfig

    The LCD driver dynamically selects the LCD based on the reported LCD ID value. However, code size can be reduced by suppressing support for individual LCDs using this option

1.3.50 CONFIG_STM3240G_LCD: Select support for the STM3210E-EVAL LCD

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL , CONFIG_LCD && CONFIG_STM32_FSMC
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3240g-eval/Kconfig

    Enable support for the LCD on the STM3240G-EVAL board. See additional, LCD-common settings in the drivers/lcd Kconfig file.

1.3.51 CONFIG_LCD_RDSHIFT: LCD data shift

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3240G_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3240g-eval/Kconfig

    When reading 16-bit gram data, there appears to be a shift in the returned data. This value fixes the offset. Default 5.

1.3.52 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9320_DISABLE: Disable LCD_ILI9320 (and LCD_ILI9321) support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3240G_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3240g-eval/Kconfig

    The LCD driver dynamically selects the LCD based on the reported LCD ID value. However, code size can be reduced by suppressing support for individual LCDs using this option.

1.3.53 CONFIG_STM32_ILI9325_DISABLE: Disable LCD_ILI9325 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM3240G_EVAL , CONFIG_STM3240G_LCD
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm3240g-eval/Kconfig

    The LCD driver dynamically selects the LCD based on the reported LCD ID value. However, code size can be reduced by suppressing support for individual LCDs using this option

1.3.54 CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS: PM Button support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_ARCH_IRQBUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f100rc_generic/Kconfig

    Enable PM button EXTI interrupts to support PM testing

1.3.55 CONFIG_PM_BUTTON_ACTIVITY: Button PM activity weight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC , CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f100rc_generic/Kconfig

    The activity weight to report to the power management subsystem when a button is pressed.

1.3.56 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_SEC: PM_STANDBY delay (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 15
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f100rc_generic/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.57 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_NSEC: PM_STANDBY delay (nanoseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f100rc_generic/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.58 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP: PM_SLEEP wake-up alarm

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f100rc_generic/Kconfig

    Wake-up of PM_SLEEP mode after a delay and resume normal operation.

1.3.59 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_SEC: PM_SLEEP delay (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f100rc_generic/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.60 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_NSEC: PM_SLEEP delay (nanoseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F100RC_GENERIC , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f100rc_generic/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F4_DISCOVERY, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F4_DISCOVERY , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f4discovery/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f4discovery/Kconfig

    Wake-up of PM_SLEEP mode after a delay and resume normal operation.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F4_DISCOVERY, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F4_DISCOVERY , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f4discovery/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F4_DISCOVERY, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F4_DISCOVERY , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/stm32f4discovery/Kconfig

    Number of additional nanoseconds to wait in PM_SLEEP before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.68 Choice: Select Sure PIC32MX Board

  • Default: ARCH_DBDP11215
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SUREPIC32MX, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SUREPIC32MX
  • Kconfig file: ./configs/sure-pic32mx/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_DBDP11215: DB_DP11215 PIC32 Storage Demo Board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SUREPIC32MX, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SUREPIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/sure-pic32mx/Kconfig

      DB_DP11215 PIC32 Storage Demo Board

      - PIC32MX44F512H - SD card slot - RS-2323 Interface - USB (MINI-B) - 2x16 LCD display - Three tactile switches - Four user LEDs

    CONFIG_ARCH_DBDP11212: DB-DP11212 PIC32 General Purpose Demo Board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SUREPIC32MX, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SUREPIC32MX
    • Kconfig file: ./configs/sure-pic32mx/Kconfig

      DB-DP11212 PIC32 General Purpose Demo Board

      - PIC32MX44F512H - LM75A temperature sensor and temperature resistor (NTC-SMD thermistor) - SPI FLASH: AT25DF041A - USB (MINI-B) - 2x16 LCD display - 4 digit, 8 segment LED display - Three tactile switches

1.4 Menu: RTOS Features

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.4.1 CONFIG_BOARD_INITIALIZE: Custom board/driver initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./sched/Kconfig

    By default, there are three points in time where you can insert custom initialization logic:

    1) <arch>_boardinitialize(): This function is used only for initialize of very low-level things like configuration of GPIO pins, power setting. The OS has not been initialized at this point, so you cannot allocate memory or initialize device drivers at this phase.

    2) The next level of initialization is performed by a call to up_initialize() (in arch/<arch>/src/common/up_initialize.c). The OS has been initialized at this point and it is okay to initialize drivers in this phase.

    3) And, finally, when the user application code starts.

    If BOARD_INITIALIZE is selected, then an additional initialization call will be performed in the boot-up sequence to a function called board_initialize(). board_initialize() will be call between phases 2) and 3) above, immediately after up_initialize() is called. This additional initialization phase may be used, for example, to initialize board-specific device drivers.

1.4.2 CONFIG_MSEC_PER_TICK: Milliseconds per system timer tick

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Kconfig file: ./sched/Kconfig

    The default system timer is 100Hz or MSEC_PER_TICK=10. This setting may be defined to inform NuttX that the processor hardware is providing system timer interrupts at some interrupt interval other than 10 msec.

1.4.3 CONFIG_RR_INTERVAL: Round robin timeslice (MSEC)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Kconfig file: ./sched/Kconfig

    The round robin timeslice will be set this number of milliseconds; Round robin scheduling can be disabled by setting this value to zero.

1.4.4 CONFIG_SCHED_INSTRUMENTATION: Monitor system performance

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./sched/Kconfig

    Enables instrumentation in scheduler to monitor system performance. If enabled, then the board-specific logic must provide the following functions (see include/sched.h):

    void sched_note_start(FAR struct tcb_s *tcb); void sched_note_stop(FAR struct tcb_s *tcb); void sched_note_switch(FAR struct tcb_s *pFromTcb, FAR struct tcb_s *pToTcb);

1.4.5 CONFIG_TASK_NAME_SIZE: Maximum task name size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Kconfig file: ./sched/Kconfig

    Spcifies that maximum size of a task name to save in the TCB. Useful if scheduler instrumentation is selected. Set to zero to disable.

1.4.6 CONFIG_SCHED_HAVE_PARENT: Support parent/child task relationships

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./sched/Kconfig

    Remember the ID of the parent task when a new child task is created. This support enables some additional features (such as SIGCHLD) and modifies the behavior of other interfaces. For example, it makes waitpid() more standards complete by restricting the waited-for tasks to the children of the caller. Default: disabled.

1.4.7 CONFIG_SCHED_CHILD_STATUS: Retain child exit status

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SCHED_HAVE_PARENT
  • Kconfig file: ./sched/Kconfig

    If this option is selected, then the exit status of the child task will be retained after the child task exits. This option should be selected if you require knowledge of a child process' exit status. Without this setting, wait(), waitpid() or waitid() may fail. For example, if you do:

    1) Start child task 2) Wait for exit status (using wait(), waitpid(), or waitid()).

    This can fail because the child task may run to completion before the wait begins.
