  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART0 Tx buffer size. Default: 256

1.5.213 CONFIG_16550_UART0_IFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART0 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART0 RTS flow control

1.5.214 CONFIG_16550_UART0_OFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART0 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART0 CTS flow control

1.5.215 CONFIG_16550_UART1: 16550 UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.216 CONFIG_16550_UART1_BASE: 16550 UART1 base address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.217 CONFIG_16550_UART1_CLOCK: 16550 UART1 clock

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.218 CONFIG_16550_UART1_IRQ: 16550 UART1 IRQ number

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.219 CONFIG_16550_UART1_BAUD: 16550 UART1 BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.220 CONFIG_16550_UART1_PARITY: 16550 UART1 parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

1.5.221 CONFIG_16550_UART1_BITS: 16550 UART1 number of bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 number of bits. Default: 8

1.5.222 CONFIG_16550_UART1_2STOP: 16550 UART1 two stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

1.5.223 CONFIG_16550_UART1_RXBUFSIZE: 16550 UART1 Rx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 Rx buffer size. Default: 256

1.5.224 CONFIG_16550_UART1_TXBUFSIZE: 16550 UART1 Tx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 Tx buffer size. Default: 256

1.5.225 CONFIG_16550_UART1_IFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART1 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART1 RTS flow control

1.5.226 CONFIG_16550_UART1_OFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART1 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART1 CTS flow control

1.5.227 CONFIG_16550_UART2: 16550 UART2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.228 CONFIG_16550_UART2_BASE: 16550 UART2 base address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.231 CONFIG_16550_UART2_BAUD: 16550 UART2 BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.232 CONFIG_16550_UART2_PARITY: 16550 UART2 parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART2 parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART2 number of bits. Default: 8

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART2 Rx buffer size. Default: 256

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART2 Tx buffer size. Default: 256

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART2 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART2 CTS flow control

1.5.239 CONFIG_16550_UART3: 16550 UART3

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.243 CONFIG_16550_UART3_BAUD: 16550 UART3 BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.244 CONFIG_16550_UART3_PARITY: 16550 UART3 parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART3 parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

1.5.245 CONFIG_16550_UART3_BITS: 16550 UART3 number of bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART3 number of bits. Default: 8

  • Type: Integer

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

  • Default: n

1.5.251 Choice: 16550 Serial Console

  • Default: 16550_NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_16550_UART0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART0 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_UART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART1 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_UART2_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART2 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_UART3_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART3 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE: No 16550 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.252 CONFIG_16550_SUPRESS_CONFIG: Suppress 16550 configuration

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    This option is useful, for example, if you are using a bootloader that configures the 16550_UART. In that case, you may want to just leave the existing console configuration in place. Default: n

1.5.253 CONFIG_16550_REGINCR: Address increment between 16550 registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The address increment between 16550 registers. Options are 1, 2, or 4. Default: 1

1.5.254 CONFIG_16550_REGWIDTH: Bit width of 16550 registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The bit width of registers. Options are 8, 16, or 32. Default: 8

1.5.255 CONFIG_16550_ADDRWIDTH: Address width of 16550 registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The bit width of registers. Options are 8, 16, or 32. Default: 8

1.5.256 CONFIG_USART0_ISUART: USART0 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.257 CONFIG_USART1_ISUART: USART1 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.258 CONFIG_USART2_ISUART: USART2 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.259 CONFIG_USART3_ISUART: USART3 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART3_ISUART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.260 CONFIG_USART4_ISUART: USART4 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART4
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.261 CONFIG_USART5_ISUART: USART5 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART5
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.262 CONFIG_USART6_ISUART: USART6 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART6
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.263 CONFIG_USART7_ISUART: USART7 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART7
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.264 CONFIG_USART8_ISUART: USART8 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART8
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.265 CONFIG_STANDARD_SERIAL: Enable standard \"upper-half\" serial driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL

    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, !CONFIG_DEV_LOWCONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable the standard, upper-half serial driver used by most MCU serial peripherals.

1.5.266 CONFIG_SERIAL_NPOLLWAITERS: Number of poll threads

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, !CONFIG_DISABLE_POLL && CONFIG_STANDARD_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Maximum number of threads than can be waiting for POLL events. Default: 2

1.5.267 CONFIG_SERIAL_TIOCSERGSTRUCT: Support TIOCSERGSTRUCT

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_DEBUG && (CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL || CONFIG_16550_UART)
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    As a debug option, many serial bottom half drivers support the TIOCSERGSTRUCT that allows you to get the internal driver data structure. By default, this IOCTL is not supported in order to reduce footprint. But if (1) the driver supports the TIOCSERGSTRUCT ioctl, and (2) this option is selected, then support for the TIOCSERGSTRUCT will be enabled.

1.5.268 Choice: Serial console

  • Default: NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_UART_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART0

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART0

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART0_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART1_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART2_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART2_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART2_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART3_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART3

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART3
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART3_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART3

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART3
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART4_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART4

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART4
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART4_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART4

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART4_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART5_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART5

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART5
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART5_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART5

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART5_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART6_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART6

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART6
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART6_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART6

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART6_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART7_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART7

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART7
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART7_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART7

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART7_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART8_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART8
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART8_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART8_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE: No serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.269 Menu: UART Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.269.1 CONFIG_UART_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.5.269.2 CONFIG_UART_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.5.269.3 CONFIG_UART_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.5.269.4 CONFIG_UART_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.5.269.5 CONFIG_UART_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.5.269.6 CONFIG_UART_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.5.269.7 CONFIG_UART_IFLOWCONTROL: UART RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART RTS flow control

1.5.269.8 CONFIG_UART_OFLOWCONTROL: UART CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART CTS flow control

1.5.270 Menu: UART0 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.5.270.5 CONFIG_UART0_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.5.270.6 CONFIG_UART0_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.5.270.7 CONFIG_UART0_IFLOWCONTROL: UART0 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART0 RTS flow control

1.5.270.8 CONFIG_UART0_OFLOWCONTROL: UART0 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART0 CTS flow control

1.5.271 Menu: USART0 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART0_ISUART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.271.1 CONFIG_USART0_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.5.271.2 CONFIG_USART0_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.5.271.3 CONFIG_USART0_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the USART.

1.5.271.4 CONFIG_USART0_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.5.271.5 CONFIG_USART0_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.5.271.6 CONFIG_USART0_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.5.271.7 CONFIG_USART0_IFLOWCONTROL: USART0 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART0 RTS flow control

1.5.271.8 CONFIG_USART0_OFLOWCONTROL: USART0 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART0 CTS flow control

1.5.272 Menu: UART1 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.272.1 CONFIG_UART1_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.5.272.2 CONFIG_UART1_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.5.272.3 CONFIG_UART1_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.5.272.4 CONFIG_UART1_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.5.272.5 CONFIG_UART1_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.5.272.6 CONFIG_UART1_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.5.272.7 CONFIG_UART1_IFLOWCONTROL: UART1 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART1 RTS flow control

1.5.272.8 CONFIG_UART1_OFLOWCONTROL: UART1 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART1 CTS flow control

  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.5.283.6 CONFIG_UART6_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.5.283.7 CONFIG_UART6_IFLOWCONTROL: UART6 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART6 RTS flow control

1.5.283.8 CONFIG_UART6_OFLOWCONTROL: UART6 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART6 CTS flow control

1.5.284 Menu: USART7 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART7_ISUART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.284.1 CONFIG_USART7_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.5.284.2 CONFIG_USART7_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the USART.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.5.284.5 CONFIG_USART7_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.5.284.6 CONFIG_USART7_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART7 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART7 CTS flow control

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART8_ISUART

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256

  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL

    Enable USART8 CTS flow control

1.5.287 Menu: UART8 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART8
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.5.287.1 CONFIG_UART8_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.5.287.2 CONFIG_UART8_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.5.287.3 CONFIG_UART8_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.5.287.4 CONFIG_UART8_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL

    1=Two stop bits

1.5.288 CONFIG_USBDEV: USB Device Driver Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    USB device drivers. See also include/nuttx/usb/usbdev.h

1.5.289 CONFIG_USBDEV_ISOCHRONOUS: Enable isochronous

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Build in extra support for isochronous endpoints

1.5.290 CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED: Enable high and full speed

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Hardware handles high and full speed operation (USB 2.0)

1.5.291 Choice: Select USB device powered

  • Default: USBDEV_SELFPOWERED
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_USBDEV_SELFPOWERED: Self powered

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

      Will cause USB features to indicate that the device is self-powered

    CONFIG_USBDEV_BUSPOWERED: Bus powered

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

      Will cause USB features to indicate that the device is self-powered

1.5.292 CONFIG_USBDEV_MAXPOWER: Maximum power consumption in mA

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Maximum power consumption in mA. This selection should only apply if the device is bus powered (USBDEV_BUSPOWERED). It is, however, used unconditionally in several USB device drivers.

1.5.293 CONFIG_USBDEV_DMA: Enable DMA methods

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Select this enable DMA-related methods in USB device controller driver interface. These methods include the DMA buffer allocation methods: allobuffer() and freebuffer().

    The USB class driver allocates packet I/O buffers for data transfer by calling the driver allocbuffer() and freebuffer() methods. Those methods are only available if USBDEV_DMA is defined in the system configuration.

1.5.294 CONFIG_USBDEV_DMAMEMORY: Board DMA Allocation Hooks

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The USB class driver allocates packet I/O buffers for data transfer by calling the driver allocbuffer() and freebuffer() methods. Those methods are only available if USBDEV_DMA is defined in the system configuration.

    If USBDEV_DMAMEMORY is also defined in the NuttX configuration, then the driver implementations of the allocbuffer() and freebuffer() methods may use board-specific usbdev_dma_alloc() and usbdev_dma_free(). If USBDEV_DMA and USBDEV_DMAMEMORY are both defined, then the board- specific logic must provide the functions usbdev_dma_alloc() and usbdev_dma_free(): usbdev_dma_alloc() will allocate DMA-capable memory of the specified size; usbdev_dma_free() is the corresponding function that will be called to free the DMA-capable memory.

1.5.295 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE: Enable USB tracing for debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Enables USB tracing for debug

1.5.296 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_NRECORDS: Number of trace entries to remember

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Number of trace entries to remember

1.5.297 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_STRINGS: Decode device controller events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If USBDEV_TRACE_STRINGS is defined, then the USB device controller driver must provide arrays of strings to support decoding of device- specific trace events. These arrays of strings (and the type struct trace_msg_t) are defined in include/nuttx/usb/usbdev_trace.h:

    #ifdef CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_STRINGS extern const struct trace_msg_t g_usb_trace_strings_deverror[]; extern const struct trace_msg_t g_usb_trace_strings_intdecode[]; #endif

1.5.298 CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE: USB composite device support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Enables USB composite device support

1.5.299 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_EP0MAXPACKET: Max packet size for endpoint 0

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max packet size for endpoint 0

1.5.300 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VENDORID: Composite vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.301 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VENDORSTR: Composite vendor ID

  • Type: String
  • Default: "Nuttx"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The vendor ID code/string

1.5.302 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_PRODUCTID: Composite product id

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.303 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_PRODUCTSTR: Composite product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "Composite device"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The product ID code/string

1.5.304 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_SERIALSTR: Composite serial string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "001"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Device serial number string

1.5.305 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_CONFIGSTR: Configuration string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "Nuttx COMPOSITE config"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Configuration string

1.5.306 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VERSIONNO: Composite version number

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Interface version number.

1.5.307 CONFIG_PL2303: Prolific PL2303 serial/USB converter emulation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_REMOVABLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    This logic emulates the Prolific PL2303 serial/USB converter

1.5.308 CONFIG_PL2303_CONSOLE: PL2303 console device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Register the USB device as /dev/console so that is will be used as the console device.

1.5.309 CONFIG_PL2303_EPINTIN: Interrupt IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.310 CONFIG_PL2303_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.311 CONFIG_PL2303_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.312 CONFIG_PL2303_EP0MAXPACKET: Packet and request buffer sizes

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.313 CONFIG_PL2303_NWRREQS: Number of read requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of read requests that can be in flight

1.5.314 CONFIG_PL2303_NRDREQS: Number of write requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.5.315 CONFIG_PL2303_BULKIN_REQLEN: Size of one write request buffer

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 96
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Ideally, the BULKOUT request size should *not* be the same size as the maxpacket size. That is because IN transfers of exactly the maxpacket size will be followed by a NULL packet. The BULKOUT, on the other hand, request buffer size is always the same as the maxpacket size.

1.5.316 CONFIG_PL2303_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial receive/transmit buffers

1.5.317 CONFIG_PL2303_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial receive/transmit buffers

1.5.318 CONFIG_PL2303_VENDORID: Vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x067b
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.319 CONFIG_PL2303_PRODUCTID: Product ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x2303
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.320 CONFIG_PL2303_VENDORSTR: Vendor string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.321 CONFIG_PL2303_PRODUCTSTR: Product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "PL2303 Emulation"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.322 CONFIG_CDCACM: USB Modem (CDC ACM) support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_REMOVABLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Enables USB Modem (CDC ACM) support

1.5.323 CONFIG_CDCACM_CONSOLE: CDC/ACM console device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Register the USB device as /dev/console so that is will be used as the console device.

1.5.324 CONFIG_CDCACM_COMPOSITE: CDC/ACM composite support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM , CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Configure the CDC serial driver as part of a composite driver (only if USBDEV_COMPOSITE is also defined)

1.5.325 CONFIG_CDCACM_IFNOBASE: Offset the CDC/ACM interface numbers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM , CONFIG_CDCACM_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the CDC/ACM interface numbers so that they are unique and contiguous. When used with the Mass Storage driver, the correct value for this offset is zero.

1.5.326 CONFIG_CDCACM_STRBASE: Offset the CDC/ACM string numbers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM , CONFIG_CDCACM_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the CDC/ACM string numbers so that they are unique and contiguous. When used with the Mass Storage driver, the correct value for this offset is four (this value actuallly only needs to be defined if names are provided for the Notification interface, config CDCACM_NOTIFSTR, or the data interface, CDCACM_DATAIFSTR).

1.5.327 CONFIG_CDCACM_EP0MAXPACKET: Endpoint 0 max packet size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Endpoint 0 max packet size. Default 64.

1.5.328 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN: Interrupt IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoint that supports interrupt IN operation. Default 1.

1.5.329 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN_FSSIZE: Interupt IN full speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the interrupt IN endpoint if full speed mode. Default 64.

1.5.330 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN_HSSIZE: Interupt IN high speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the interrupt IN endpoint if high speed mode. Default 64.

1.5.331 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoint that supports bulk OUT operation. Default: 3

1.5.332 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT_FSSIZE: Bulk OUT full speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk OUT endpoint if full speed mode. Default 64.

1.5.333 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT_HSSIZE: Bulk OUT out high speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk OUT endpoint if high speed mode. Default 512.

1.5.334 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoint that supports bulk IN operation. Default: 2

1.5.335 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN_FSSIZE: Bulk IN full speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk IN endpoint if full speed mode. Default 64.

1.5.336 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN_HSSIZE: Bulk IN high speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk IN endpoint if high speed mode. Default 512.

1.5.337 CONFIG_CDCACM_NWRREQS: Number of read requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of read requests that can be in flight

1.5.338 CONFIG_CDCACM_NRDREQS: Number of write requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.5.339 CONFIG_CDCACM_BULKIN_REQLEN: Size of one write request buffer

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 96
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Ideally, the BULKOUT request size should *not* be the same size as the maxpacket size. That is because IN transfers of exactly the maxpacket size will be followed by a NULL packet. The BULKOUT, on the other hand, request buffer size is always the same as the maxpacket size.

1.5.340 CONFIG_CDCACM_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial receive/transmit buffers

1.5.341 CONFIG_CDCACM_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial receive/transmit buffers

1.5.342 CONFIG_CDCACM_VENDORID: Vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0525
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The vendor ID code/string. Default 0x0525 and "NuttX" 0x0525 is the Netchip vendor and should not be used in any products. This default VID was selected for compatibility with the Linux CDC ACM default VID.

1.5.343 CONFIG_CDCACM_PRODUCTID: Product ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xa4a7
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The product ID code/string. Default 0xa4a7 and "CDC/ACM Serial" 0xa4a7 was selected for compatibility with the Linux CDC ACM default PID.

1.5.344 CONFIG_CDCACM_VENDORSTR: Vendor string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.345 CONFIG_CDCACM_PRODUCTSTR: Product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "CDC/ACM Serial"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.346 CONFIG_USBMSC: USB Mass storage class device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    References: "Universal Serial Bus Mass Storage Class, Specification Overview," Revision 1.2, USB Implementer's Forum, June 23, 2003.

    "Universal Serial Bus Mass Storage Class, Bulk-Only Transport," Revision 1.0, USB Implementer's Forum, September 31, 1999.

    "SCSI Primary Commands - 3 (SPC-3)," American National Standard for Information Technology, May 4, 2005

    "SCSI Primary Commands - 4 (SPC-4)," American National Standard for Information Technology, July 19, 2008

    "SCSI Block Commands -2 (SBC-2)," American National Standard for Information Technology, November 13, 2004

    "SCSI Multimedia Commands - 3 (MMC-3)," American National Standard for Information Technology, November 12, 2001

1.5.347 CONFIG_USBMSC_COMPOSITE: Mass storage composite support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC , CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Configure the mass storage driver as part of a composite driver (only if USBDEV_COMPOSITE is also defined)

1.5.348 CONFIG_USBMSC_IFNOBASE: Offset the mass storage interface number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC , CONFIG_USBMSC_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the mass storage interface number so that it is unique and contiguous. When used with the CDC/ACM driver, the correct value for this offset is two (because of the two CDC/ACM interfaces that will precede it).

1.5.349 CONFIG_USBMSC_STRBASE: Offset the mass storage string numbers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC , CONFIG_USBMSC_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the mass storage string numbers so that they are unique and contiguous. When used with the CDC/ACM driver, the correct value for this offset is four (or perhaps 5 or 6, depending on if CDCACM_NOTIFSTR or CDCACM_DATAIFSTR are defined).

1.5.350 CONFIG_USBMSC_EP0MAXPACKET: Max packet size for endpoint 0

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max packet size for endpoint 0

1.5.351 CONFIG_USBMSC_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoints that support bulk OUT and IN operations

1.5.352 CONFIG_USBMSC_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoints that support bulk OUT and IN operations

1.5.353 CONFIG_USBMSC_NWRREQS: The number of write requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.5.354 CONFIG_USBMSC_NRDREQS: The number of read requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.5.355 CONFIG_USBMSC_BULKINREQLEN: Bulk in request size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.356 CONFIG_USBMSC_BULKOUTREQLEN: Bulk out request size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The size of the buffer in each write/read request. This value needs to be at least as large as the endpoint maxpacket and ideally as large as a block device sector.

1.5.357 CONFIG_USBMSC_VENDORID: Mass stroage Vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.358 CONFIG_USBMSC_VENDORSTR: Mass stroage vendor string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "Nuttx"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The vendor ID code/string

1.5.359 CONFIG_USBMSC_PRODUCTID: Mass stroage Product ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.360 CONFIG_USBMSC_PRODUCTSTR: Mass storage product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "Mass Storage"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.361 CONFIG_USBMSC_VERSIONNO: USB MSC Version Number

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: "0x399"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.5.362 CONFIG_USBMSC_REMOVABLE: Mass stroage remove able

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Select if the media is removable USB Composite Device Configuration

1.5.363 CONFIG_USBHOST: USB Host Driver Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    USB host drivers. See also include/nuttx/usb/usbhost.h

1.5.364 CONFIG_USBHOST_NPREALLOC: Number of pre-allocated class instances

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Number of pre-allocated class instances

1.5.365 CONFIG_USBHOST_BULK_DISABLE: Disable bulk endpoint support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    On some architectures, selecting this setting will reduce driver size by disabling bulk endpoint support

1.5.366 CONFIG_USBHOST_INT_DISABLE: Disable interrupt endpoint support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    On some architectures, selecting this setting will reduce driver size by disabling interrupt endpoint support

1.5.367 CONFIG_USBHOST_ISOC_DISABLE: Disable isochronous endpoint support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    On some architectures, selecting this setting will reduce driver size by disabling isochronous endpoint support

1.5.368 CONFIG_USBHOST_MSC: Mass Storage Class Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, !CONFIG_BULK_DISABLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Enable support for the keyboard class driver. This also depends on NFILE_DESCRIPTORS > 0 && SCHED_WORKQUEUE=y

1.5.369 CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD: HID Keyboard Class Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, !CONFIG_INT_DISABLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Enable support for the keyboard class driver. This also depends on SCHED_WORKQUEUE && !DISABLE_SIGNALS

1.5.370 CONFIG_HIDKBD_POLLUSEC: Keyboard Poll Rate (MSEC)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Device poll rate in microseconds. Default: 100,000 microseconds.

1.5.371 CONFIG_HIDKBD_DEFPRIO: Polling Thread Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Priority of the polling thread. Default: 50.

1.5.372 CONFIG_HIDKBD_STACKSIZE: Polling thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Stack size for polling thread. Default: 1024

1.5.373 CONFIG_HIDKBD_BUFSIZE: Scancode Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Scancode buffer size. Default: 64.

1.5.374 CONFIG_HIDKBD_NPOLLWAITERS: Max Number of Waiters for Poll Event

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD , !CONFIG_DISABLE_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    If the poll() method is enabled, this defines the maximum number of threads that can be waiting for keyboard events. Default: 2.

1.5.375 CONFIG_HIDKBD_RAWSCANCODES: Use Raw Scan Codes

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    If set to y no conversions will be made on the raw keyboard scan codes. This option is useful during testing. Default: ASCII conversion.

1.5.376 CONFIG_HIDKBD_ENCODED: Encode Special Keys

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD , !CONFIG_HIDKBD_RAWSCANCODES && CONFIG_LIB_KBDCODEC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    Encode special key press events in the user buffer. In this case, the user end must decode the encoded special key values using the interfaces defined in include/nuttx/input/kbd_codec.h. These special keys include such things as up/down arrows, home and end keys, etc. If this not defined, only 7-bit print-able and control ASCII characters will be provided to the user.

1.5.377 CONFIG_HIDKBD_ALLSCANCODES: Use All Scancodes

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    If set to y all 231 possible scancodes will be converted to something. Default: 104 key US keyboard.

1.5.378 CONFIG_HIDKBD_NODEBOUNCE: Disable Debounce

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBHOST, CONFIG_USBHOST_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbhost/Kconfig

    If set to y normal debouncing is disabled. Default: Debounce enabled (No repeat keys).

1.5.379 CONFIG_WIRELESS: Wireless Device Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Drivers for various wireless devices.

1.5.380 CONFIG_WL_CC1101: CC1101 RF transceiver support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WIRELESS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/Kconfig

1.5.381 CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01: nRF24l01+ transceiver support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WIRELESS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/Kconfig

    This options adds driver support for the Nordic nRF24L01+ chip.

1.5.382 CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01_DFLT_ADDR_WIDTH: Default address width

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Range: 3 - 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WIRELESS, CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/Kconfig

    Default address width to be used by the nRF24l01+ driver. Note that this default can be changed through the driver API.

1.5.383 CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01_CHECK_PARAMS: Check call parameters

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WIRELESS, CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/Kconfig

    This option adds some sanity check code to parameters given in the driver API functions. If this option is disabled, parameter values are passed 'as is' to the module hardware registers.

1.5.384 CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01_RXSUPPORT: Support messages reception

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WIRELESS, CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/Kconfig

    If this opion is disabled the driver supports only the transmission of messages. Reception of messages will be disabled (and corresponding functions removed). Note: this option is intended to reduce driver code size for 'transmission only' devices.

1.5.385 CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01_RXFIFO_LEN: RX fifo length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Range: 34 - 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WIRELESS, CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01 , CONFIG_WL_NRF24L01_RXSUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/Kconfig

    Length of the software based fifo used to store content of received messages.

1.5.386 CONFIG_RAMLOG: RAM log device support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    This is a driver that was intended to support debugging output, aka syslogging, when the normal serial output is not available. For example, if you are using a telnet or USB serial console, the debug output will get lost. However, the RAMLOG device should be usable even if system logging is disabled.

    This driver is similar to a pipe in that it saves the debugging output in a FIFO in RAM. It differs from a pipe in numerous details as needed to support logging.

1.5.387 CONFIG_RAMLOG_SYSLOG: Use RAMLOG for SYSLOG

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, CONFIG_SYSLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Use the RAM logging device for the syslogging interface. If this feature is enabled (along with SYSLOG), then all debug output (only) will be re-directed to the circular buffer in RAM. This RAM log can be view from NSH using the 'dmesg'command.

    Do not enable more than one SYSLOG device.

1.5.388 CONFIG_RAMLOG_CONSOLE: Use RAMLOG for /dev/console

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, CONFIG_DEV_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Use the RAM logging device as a system console. If this feature is enabled (along with DEV_CONSOLE), then all console output will be re-directed to a circular buffer in RAM. This is useful, for example, if the only console is a Telnet console. Then in that case, console output from non-Telnet threads will go to the circular buffer and can be viewed using the NSH 'dmesg' command.

1.5.389 CONFIG_RAMLOG_CONSOLE_BUFSIZE: RAMLOG buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, CONFIG_RAMLOG_SYSLOG || CONFIG_RAMLOG_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Size of the console RAM log. Default: 1024

1.5.390 CONFIG_RAMLOG_CRLF: RAMLOG CR/LF

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Pre-pend a carriage return before every linefeed that goes into the RAM log.

1.5.391 CONFIG_RAMLOG_NONBLOCKING: RAMLOG non-block reads

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Reading from the RAMLOG will never block if the RAMLOG is empty. If the RAMLOG is empty, then zero is returned (usually interpreted as end-of-file).

1.5.392 CONFIG_RAMLOG_NPOLLWAITERS: RAMLOG number of poll waiters

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, !CONFIG_DISABLE_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    The maximum number of threads that may be waiting on the poll method.

1.6 Menu: Networking Support

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.6.1 CONFIG_NET: Networking support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enable or disable all network features

1.6.2 Choice: Board PHY Selection

  • Default: PHY_KS8721
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    • Identify the PHY on your board. This setting is not used by all Ethernet drivers no do all Ethernet drivers support all PHYs.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_PHY_KS8721: Micrel KS8721 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_PHY_DP83848C: National Semiconduction DP83848C PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_PHY_LAN8720: SMSC LAN8720 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_PHY_DM9161: Davicom DM9161 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.6.3 CONFIG_NET_NOINTS: Not interrupt driven

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    NET_NOINT indicates that uIP is not called from the interrupt level. If NET_NOINTS is defined, critical sections will be managed with semaphores; Otherwise, it assumed that uIP will be called from interrupt level handling and critical sections will be managed by enabling and disabling interrupts.

1.6.4 CONFIG_NET_MULTIBUFFER: Use multiple device-side I/O buffers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Traditionally, uIP has used a single buffer for all incoming and outgoing traffic. If this configuration is selected, then the driver can manage multiple I/O buffers and can, for example, be filling one input buffer while sending another output buffer. Or, as another example, the driver may support queuing of concurrent input/ouput and output transfers for better performance.

1.6.5 CONFIG_NET_PROMISCUOUS: Promiscuous mode

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Force the Ethernet driver to operate in promiscuous mode (if supported by the Ethernet driver).

1.6.6 CONFIG_NET_IPv6: IPv6

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Build in support for IPv6. Not fully implemented.

1.6.7 CONFIG_NSOCKET_DESCRIPTORS: Number of socket descriptor

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Maximum number of socket descriptors per task/thread.

1.6.8 CONFIG_NET_NACTIVESOCKETS: Max socket operations

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Maximum number of concurrent socket operations (recv, send, etc.). Default: 16

1.6.9 CONFIG_NET_SOCKOPTS: Socket options

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enable or disable support for socket options

1.6.10 CONFIG_NET_BUFSIZE: Network packet size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 562

      Dependency: !CONFIG_NET_TCP && CONFIG_NET_UDP && !CONFIG_NET_SLIP

    • Default: 420

      Dependency: CONFIG_NET_TCP && !CONFIG_NET_UDP && !CONFIG_NET_SLIP

    • Default: 296

      Dependency: CONFIG_NET_SLIP

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    uIP buffer size. Default: 562

1.6.11 CONFIG_NET_TCPURGDATA: Urgent data

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Determines if support for TCP urgent data notification should be compiled in. Urgent data (out-of-band data) is a rarely used TCP feature that is very seldom would be required.

1.6.12 Menu: TCP/IP Networking

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.6.12.1 CONFIG_NET_TCP: TCP/IP Networking

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    TCP support on or off

1.6.12.2 CONFIG_NET_TCP_CONNS: Number of TCP/IP connections

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Maximum number of TCP/IP connections (all tasks)

1.6.12.3 CONFIG_NET_MAX_LISTENPORTS: Number of listening ports

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Maximum number of listening TCP/IP ports (all tasks). Default: 20

1.6.12.4 CONFIG_NET_TCP_READAHEAD_BUFSIZE: TCP/IP read-ahead buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 562
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Read-ahead buffers allows buffering of TCP/IP packets when there is no receive in place to catch the TCP packet. In that case, the packet will be retained in the NuttX read-ahead buffers.

    This setting specifies the size of one TCP/IP read-ahead buffer. This should best be a equal to the maximum packet size (NET_BUFSIZE).

1.6.12.5 CONFIG_NET_NTCP_READAHEAD_BUFFERS: Number of TCP/IP read-ahead buffers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Read-ahead buffers allows buffering of TCP/IP packets when there is no receive in place to catch the TCP packet. In that case, the packet will be retained in the NuttX read-ahead buffers.

    This setting specifies the number of TCP/IP read-ahead buffers This value can be set to zero to disable all TCP/IP read-ahead buffering. You might want to disable TCP/IP read-ahead buffering on a highly memory constained system that does not have any TCP/IP packet rate issues.

1.6.12.6 CONFIG_NET_TCP_RECVDELAY: TCP Rx delay

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    If NET_NTCP_READAHEAD_BUFFERS is zero, then there will be no buffering of TCP/IP packets: Any TCP/IP packet received will be ACKed, but its contents will be dropped in the bit-bucket.

    One low-performance option is delay for a short period of time after a TCP/IP packet is received to see if another comes right behind it. Then the packet data from both can be combined. This option only makes since if performance is not an issue and you need to handle short bursts of small, back-to-back packets. The delay is in units of deciseconds.

1.6.12.7 CONFIG_NET_TCPBACKLOG: TCP/IP backlog support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Incoming connections pend in a backlog until accept() is called. The size of the backlog is selected when listen() is called.

1.6.12.8 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SPLIT: Enable packet splitting

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    send() will not return until the the transfer has been ACKed by the recipient. But under RFC 1122, the host need not ACK each packet immediately; the host may wait for 500 MS before ACKing. This combination can cause very slow performance with small transfers are made to an RFC 1122 client. However, the RFC 1122 must ACK at least every second (odd) packet.

    This option enables logic to trick the RFC 1122 host be exploiting this last RFC 1122 requirement: If an odd number of packets were to be sent, then send() will split the last even packet to guarantee that an even number of packets will be sent and the RFC 1122 host will ACK the final packet immediately.

1.6.12.9 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SPLIT_SIZE: Split size threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 40
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_TCP , CONFIG_NET_TCP_SPLIT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Packets of this size or smaller than this will not be split.

1.6.13 Menu: UDP Networking

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.6.13.1 CONFIG_NET_UDP: UDP Networking

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enable or disable UDP networking support.

1.6.13.2 CONFIG_NET_UDP_CHECKSUMS: UDP checksums

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enable/disable UDP checksum support

1.6.13.3 CONFIG_NET_UDP_CONNS: Number of UDP sockets

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    The maximum amount of open concurrent UDP sockets

1.6.13.4 CONFIG_NET_BROADCAST: UDP broadcast Rx support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Incoming UDP broadcast support

1.6.14 CONFIG_NET_ICMP: ICMP networking support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enable minimal ICMP support. Includes built-in support for sending replies to received ECHO (ping) requests.

1.6.15 CONFIG_NET_ICMP_PING: ICMP ping interfaces

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Provide interfaces to support application level support for for sending ECHO (ping) requests and associating ECHO replies.

1.6.16 CONFIG_NET_PINGADDRCONF: Ping address configuration

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Use "ping" packet for setting IP address

1.6.17 CONFIG_NET_IGMP: IGMPv2 clientsupport

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enable IGMPv2 client support.

1.6.18 CONFIG_PREALLOC_IGMPGROUPS: Number of pre-allocated IGMP groups

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_IGMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Pre-allocated IGMP groups are used only if needed from interrupt level group created (by the IGMP server). Default: 4.

1.6.19 CONFIG_NET_STATISTICS: Collect network statistics

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    uIP statistics on or off

1.6.20 CONFIG_NET_RECEIVE_WINDOW: Receive window size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 562
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    The size of the advertised receiver's window. Should be set low (i.e., to the size of the NET_BUFSIZE) if the application is slow to process incoming data, or high (32768 bytes) if the application processes data quickly.

1.6.21 CONFIG_NET_ARPTAB_SIZE: ARP table size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    The size of the ARP table

1.6.22 CONFIG_NET_ARP_IPIN: ARP address harvesting

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Harvest IP/MAC address mappings from the ARP table from incoming IP packets.

1.6.23 CONFIG_NET_MULTICAST: Multi-cast Tx support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Outgoing multi-cast address support

1.6.24 CONFIG_NET_SLIP: SLIP support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enables building of the SLIP driver. SLIP requires at least one IP protocol selected and the following additional network settings: NET_NOINTS and NET_MULTIBUFFER.

    NET_BUFSIZE *must* be set to 296. Other optional configuration settings that affect the SLIP driver: NET_STATISTICS. Default: Ethernet

    SLIP supports point-to-point IP communications over a serial port. The default data link layer for uIP is Ethernet. If NET_SLIP is defined in the NuttX configuration file, then SLIP will be supported. The basic differences between the SLIP and Ethernet configurations is that when SLIP is selected:

    * The link level header (that comes before the IP header) is omitted. * All MAC address processing is suppressed. * ARP is disabled.

    If NET_SLIP is not selected, then Ethernet will be used (there is no need to define anything special in the configuration file to use Ethernet -- it is the default).

1.6.25 CONFIG_SLIP_NINTERFACES: Number of SLIP interfaces

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SLIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Selects the number of physical SLIP interfaces to support. Default: 1

1.6.26 CONFIG_SLIP_STACKSIZE: SLIP stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SLIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Select the stack size of the SLIP RX and TX tasks. Default: 2048

1.6.27 CONFIG_SLIP_DEFPRIO: SLIP priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SLIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    The priority of the SLIP RX and TX tasks. Default: 128

1.7 Menu: File Systems

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.7.1 CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT: Disable support for mount points

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

1.7.2 CONFIG_FS_RAMMAP: File mapping emulation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/mmap/Kconfig

    NuttX operates in a flat open address space and is focused on MCUs that do support Memory Management Units (MMUs). Therefore, NuttX generally does not require mmap() functionality and the MCUs generally cannot support true memory-mapped files.

    However, memory mapping of files is the mechanism used by NXFLAT, the NuttX tiny binary format, to get files into memory in order to execute them. mmap() support is therefore required to support NXFLAT.

    If FS_RAMMAP is defined in the configuration, then mmap() will support simulation of memory mapped files by copying files whole into RAM. These copied files have some of the properties of standard memory mapped files.

    See nuttx/fs/mmap/README.txt for additonal information.

1.7.3 CONFIG_FS_FAT: FAT file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/fat/Kconfig

    Enable FAT filesystem support

1.7.4 CONFIG_FAT_LCNAMES: FAT upper/lower names

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/fat/Kconfig

    Enable use of the NT-style upper/lower case 8.3 file name support.

1.7.5 CONFIG_FAT_LFN: FAT long file names

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/fat/Kconfig

    Enable FAT long file names. NOTE: Microsoft claims patents on FAT long file name technology. Please read the disclaimer in the top-level COPYING file and only enable this feature if you understand these issues.

1.7.6 CONFIG_FAT_MAXFNAME: FAT maximum file name size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_FAT, CONFIG_FAT_LFN
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/fat/Kconfig

    If FAT_LFN is defined, then the default, maximum long file name is 255 bytes. This can eat up a lot of memory (especially stack space). If you are willing to live with some non-standard, short long file names, then define this value to be something more reasonable. A good choice would be the same value as selected for NAME_MAX which will limit the visibility of longer file names anyway.

1.7.7 CONFIG_FS_FATTIME: FAT timestamps

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/fat/Kconfig

    Support FAT date and time. NOTE: There is not much sense in supporting FAT date and time unless you have a hardware RTC or other way to get the time and date.

1.7.8 CONFIG_FAT_DMAMEMORY: DMA memory allocator

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/fat/Kconfig

    The FAT file system allocates two I/O buffers for data transfer, each are the size of one device sector. One of the buffers is allocated once for each FAT volume that is mounted; the other buffers are allocated each time a FAT file is opened.

    Some hardware, however, may require special DMA-capable memory in order to perform the the transfers. If FAT_DMAMEMORY is defined then the architecture-specific hardware must provide the functions fat_dma_alloc() and fat_dma_free(): fat_dmalloc() will allocate DMA-capable memory of the specified size; fat_dmafree() is the corresponding function that will be called to free the DMA-capable memory.

1.7.9 CONFIG_NFS: NFS client file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET && !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nfs/Kconfig

    Enable network file system (NFS) client file system

1.7.10 CONFIG_NFS_STATISTICS: NFS Stastics

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nfs/Kconfig

    Collect support for NFS statistics. There is no user interface to obtain these statistics, however. So they would only be of value if you add debug instrumentation or use a debugger.

1.7.11 CONFIG_FS_NXFFS: NXFFS file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nxffs/Kconfig

    Enable NuttX FLASH file system (NXFF) support.

1.7.12 CONFIG_NXFFS_PREALLOCATED: Single, preallocated volume

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nxffs/Kconfig

    If CONFIG_NXFSS_PREALLOCATED is defined, then this is the single, pre- allocated NXFFS volume instance.

1.7.13 CONFIG_NXFFS_ERASEDSTATE: FLASH erased state

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nxffs/Kconfig

    The erased state of FLASH. This must have one of the values of 0xff or 0x00. Default: 0xff.

1.7.14 CONFIG_NXFFS_PACKTHRESHOLD: Re-packing threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nxffs/Kconfig

    When packing flash file data, don't both with file chunks smaller than this number of data bytes. Default: 32.

1.7.15 CONFIG_NXFFS_MAXNAMLEN: Maximum file name length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nxffs/Kconfig

    The maximum size of an NXFFS file name. Default: 255.

1.7.16 CONFIG_NXFFS_TAILTHRESHOLD: Tail threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/nxffs/Kconfig

    clean-up can either mean packing files together toward the end of the file or, if file are deleted at the end of the file, clean up can simply mean erasing the end of FLASH memory so that it can be re-used again. However, doing this can also harm the life of the FLASH part because it can mean that the tail end of the FLASH is re-used too often. This threshold determines if/when it is worth erased the tail end of FLASH and making it available for re-use (and possible over-wear). Default: 8192.

1.7.17 CONFIG_FS_ROMFS: ROMFS file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/romfs/Kconfig

    Enable ROMFS filesystem support

1.7.18 CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS: SMART file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Enable NuttX SMART Flash file system (SMARTFS) support.

1.7.19 CONFIG_SMARTFS_ERASEDSTATE: FLASH erased state

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    The erased state of FLASH. This must have one of the values of 0xff or 0x00. Default: 0xff.

1.7.20 CONFIG_SMARTFS_MAXNAMLEN: Maximum file name length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    The maximum size of a SMARTFS file name at a given directory level. Overall path name is not restricted by this value, only individual segments in a path, such as (assuming /usr is the mount point):

      /usr/games/chess/player_stats/game1.xml

    Default: 16.

1.7.21 CONFIG_SMARTFS_MULTI_ROOT_DIRS: Support multiple Root Directories / Mount Points

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
