    Enable the USB compsite class driver example

1.13.2.21 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CXXTEST: C++ test program

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/cxxtest/Kconfig

    Enable the C++ test program

1.13.2.22 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CXXTEST_CXXINITIALIZE: C++ Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CXXTEST, CONFIG_HAVE_CXX && CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/cxxtest/Kconfig

    By default, if CONFIG_HAVE_CXX and CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are defined, then this example will call the NuttX function to initialize static C++ constructors. This option may be disabled, however, if that static initialization was preformed elsewhere.

1.13.2.23 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DHCPD: DHCP server example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/dhcpd/Kconfig

    Enable the DHCP server example

1.13.2.24 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ELF: ELF Loader Example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/elf/Kconfig

    Enable the ELF loader example

1.13.2.25 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ELF_DEVMINOR: ROMFS Minor Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ELF
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/elf/Kconfig

    The minor device number of the ROMFS block. For example, the N in /dev/ramN. Used for registering the RAM block driver that will hold the ROMFS file system containing the ELF executables to be tested. Default: 0

1.13.2.26 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ELF_DEVPATH: ROMFS Devie Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/ram0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ELF
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/elf/Kconfig

    The path to the ROMFS block driver device. This must match EXAMPLES_ELF_DEVMINOR. Used for registering the RAM block driver that will hold the ROMFS file system containing the ELF executables to be tested. Default: "/dev/ram0"

1.13.2.27 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_FTPC: FTP client example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ftpc/Kconfig

    Enable the FTP client example

1.13.2.28 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_FTPD: FTP server example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ftpd/Kconfig

    Enable the FTP server example

1.13.2.29 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HELLO: \"Hello, World!\" example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/hello/Kconfig

    Enable the \"Hello, World!\" example

1.13.2.30 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HELLOXX: \"Hello, World!\" C++ example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/helloxx/Kconfig

    Enable the \"Hello, World!\" C++ example

1.13.2.31 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HELLOXX_CXXINITIALIZE: C++ Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HELLOXX, CONFIG_HAVE_CXX && CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/helloxx/Kconfig

    By default, if CONFIG_HAVE_CXX and CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are defined, then this example will call the NuttX function to initialize static C++ constructors. This option may be disabled, however, if that static initialization was preformed elsewhere.

1.13.2.32 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_JSON: JSON example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/json/Kconfig

    An example for the netutils/json library.

1.13.2.33 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD: USB HID keyboard example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/hidkbd/Kconfig

    Enable the USB HID keyboard example

1.13.2.34 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD_DEFPRIO: Waiter Thread Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/hidkbd/Kconfig

    Priority of "waiter" thread. Default: 50

1.13.2.35 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD_STACKSIZE: Waiter Thread Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/hidkbd/Kconfig

    Stacksize of "waiter" thread. Default 1024

1.13.2.36 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD_DEVNAME: Keyboard Device Name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/kbda"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/hidkbd/Kconfig

    Name of keyboard device to be used. Default: "/dev/kbda"

1.13.2.37 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD_ENCODED: Encode Special Keys

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HIDKBD, CONFIG_HIDKBD_ENCODED && CONFIG_LIB_KBDCODEC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/hidkbd/Kconfig

    Decode special key press events in the user buffer. In this case, the example coded will use the interfaces defined in include/nuttx/input/kbd_codec.h to decode the returned keyboard data. These special keys include such things as up/down arrows, home and end keys, etc. If this not defined, only 7-bit print-able and control ASCII characters will be provided to the user.

1.13.2.38 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KEYPADTEST: Keypad test example program

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/keypadtest/Kconfig

    Enable the Keypad test example programe

1.13.2.39 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KEYPAD_DEVNAME: Keypad Device Name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/keypad"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KEYPADTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/keypadtest/Kconfig

    The name of the keypad device that will be opened in order to perform the keypad test. Default: "/dev/keypad"

1.13.2.40 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KEYPADTEST_ENCODED: Use Keyboard CODEC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KEYPADTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/keypadtest/Kconfig

    Use the keyboard encoded/decoder to pass control information from the keypad driver to the keypad test. This is the keyboard CODEC defined in nuttx/input/kbd_codec.h.

1.13.2.41 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IGMP: IGMP example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/igmp/Kconfig

    Enable the IGMP example

1.13.2.42 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_LCDRW: LCD read/write example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/lcdrw/Kconfig

    Enable the LCD read/write example

1.13.2.43 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MM: Memory management example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/mm/Kconfig

    Enable the memory management example

1.13.2.44 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS: FreeModBus example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

    Enable the FreeModBus example

1.13.2.45 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS_PORT: Port used for MODBUS transmissions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

    Port used for MODBUS transmissions, default = 0 (i.e., /dev/ttyS0)

1.13.2.46 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS_BAUD: MODBUS baudrate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 38400
  • Range: 50 - 3000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

    MODBUS baudrate, allowed values {50, 75, 110, 134, 150, 200, 300, 600, 1200, 1800, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200, 128000, 230400, 256000, 460800, 500000, 576000, 921600, 1000000, 1152000, 1500000, 2000000, 2500000, 3000000}

1.13.2.47 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS_PARITY: MODBUS parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

    MODBUS parity, 0 - none, 1 - odd, 2 - even

1.13.2.48 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS_REG_INPUT_START: Input registers start address

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.2.49 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS_REG_INPUT_NREGS: Number of input registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.2.50 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS_REG_HOLDING_START: Holding registers start address

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.2.51 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS_REG_HOLDING_NREGS: Number of holding registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 130
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.2.52 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MOUNT: File system mount example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/mount/Kconfig

    Enable the file system mount example

1.13.2.53 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART: MTD partition test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION && !CONFIG_NUTTX_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    Enable the MTD partition test example.

    NOTE: This example uses some internal NuttX interfaces and, hence, is not available in the kernel build.

1.13.2.54 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT: Architecture-specific initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    The default is to use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c. But an architecture-specific MTD driver can be used instead by defining EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT. In this case, the initialization logic will call mtdpart_archinitialize() to obtain the MTD driver instance.

1.13.2.55 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_NEBLOCKS: Number of erase blocks (simulated)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    When EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT is not defined, this test will use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c to simulate FLASH. In this case, this value must be provided to give the nubmer of erase blocks in MTD RAM device.

    The size of the allocated RAM drive will be:

      EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ERASESIZE * EXAMPLES_MTDPART_NEBLOCKS

1.13.2.56 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_NPARTITIONS: Number of partitions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    This setting provides the number of partitions to test. The test will divide the reported size of the MTD device into equal- sized sub-regions for each test partition.

1.13.2.57 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST: Network test example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

    Enable the network test example

1.13.2.58 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_SERVER: Target is server

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

    Select to use the host as the client side of the test. Default: The target is the client side of the test

1.13.2.59 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_PERFORMANCE: Test for Performance

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

    Configure the example to test for network performance. Default: Test is for network functionality.

1.13.2.60 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

1.13.2.61 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

1.13.2.62 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

1.13.2.63 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

1.13.2.64 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_CLIENTIP: Client IP Address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 0x0a000001

      Dependency: !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_SERVER

    • Default: 0x0a000002

      Dependency: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST_SERVER

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nettest/Kconfig

    IP address of the client. If the target is the client, then EXAMPLES_NETTEST_CLIENTIP should be the same as EXAMPLES_NETTEST_IPADDR (default). If the target is the server, then the default value of EXAMPLES_NETTEST_CLIENTIP is set to the gateway address, EXAMPLES_NETTEST_DRIPADDR.

1.13.2.65 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NRF24L01TERM: Basic nRF24L01 terminal

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nrf24l01_term/Kconfig

1.13.2.66 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NSH: NuttShell (NSH) example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_SYSTEM_READLINE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nsh/Kconfig

    Enable the NuttShell (NSH) example

1.13.2.67 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NSH_CXXINITIALIZE: C++ Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NSH, CONFIG_HAVE_CXX && CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nsh/Kconfig

    If HAVE_CXX and HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are slected, then this NSH example can be configured to initialize C++ constructors when it is started. NSH does not use C++ and, by default, assumes that constructors are initialized elsewhere. However, you can force NSH to initialize constructors by setting this option.

1.13.2.68 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NULL: NULL example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/null/Kconfig

    Enable the NULL example

1.13.2.69 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX: NX graphics example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    Enable the NX graphics example

1.13.2.70 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_VPLANE: Video Plane

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The plane to select from the framebuffer driver for use in the test. Default: 0

1.13.2.71 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEVNO: Video Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The LCD device to select from the LCD driver for use in the test: Default: 0

1.13.2.72 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_COLORS: Use Default Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

1.13.2.73 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_BGCOLOR: Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The color of the background. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NX_BPP.

1.13.2.74 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_COLOR1: Color of Window 1

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The color of window 1. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NX_BPP.

1.13.2.75 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_COLOR2: Color of Window 2

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The color of window 2. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NX_BPP.

1.13.2.76 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_TBCOLOR: Toolbar Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The color of the toolbar. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NX_BPP.

1.13.2.77 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_FONTCOLOR: Font Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The color of the fonts. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NX_BPP.

1.13.2.78 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_FONT: Use Default Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

1.13.2.79 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_FONTID: Font ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_DEFAULT_FONT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    Selects the font (see font ID numbers in include/nuttx/nx/nxfonts.h)

1.13.2.80 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_BPP: Bits-Per-Pixel

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    Pixels per pixel to use. Valid options include 2, 4, 8, 16, 24, and 32. Default is 32.

1.13.2.81 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_RAWWINDOWS: Use Raw Windows

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    Use raw windows; Default is to use pretty, framed NXTK windows with toolbars.

1.13.2.82 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_EXTERNINIT: External Device Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The driver for the graphics device on this platform requires some unusual initialization. This is the for, for example, SPI LCD/OLED devices. If this configuration is selected, then the platform code must provide an LCD initialization function with a prototype like:

    #ifdef CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER FAR struct lcd_dev_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #else FAR struct fb_vtable_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #endif

1.13.2.83 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_STACKSIZE: NX Server Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The stacksize to use when creating the NX server. Default 2048

1.13.2.84 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_CLIENTPRIO: Client Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The client priority. Default: 100

1.13.2.85 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_SERVERPRIO: Server Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 120
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The server priority. Default: 120

1.13.2.86 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_LISTENERPRIO: Listener Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 80
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The priority of the event listener thread. Default 80.

1.13.2.87 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX_NOTIFYSIGNO: Notify Signal Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NX, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nx/Kconfig

    The signal number to use with nx_eventnotify(). Default: 4

1.13.2.88 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXCONSOLE: NxConsole example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxconsole/Kconfig

    Enable the NxConsole example

1.13.2.89 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS: NXFFS file system example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

    Enable the NXFFS file system example

1.13.2.90 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_ARCHINIT: Architecture-specific initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

    The default is to use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c. But an architecture-specific MTD driver can be used instead by defining EXAMPLES_NXFFS_ARCHINIT. In this case, the initialization logic will call mtdpart_archinitialize() to obtain the MTD driver instance.

1.13.2.91 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_NEBLOCKS: Number of erase blocks (simulated)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_ARCHINIT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

    When EXAMPLES_NXFFS_ARCHINIT is not defined, this test will use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c to simulate FLASH. In this case, this value must be provided to give the nubmer of erase blocks in MTD RAM device.

    The size of the allocated RAM drive will be:

      RAMMTD_ERASESIZE * EXAMPLES_NXFFS_NEBLOCKS

1.13.2.92 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_MAXNAME: Max name size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Range: 1 - 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

    Determines the maximum size of names used in the filesystem

1.13.2.93 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_MAXFILE: Max file size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

    Determines the maximum size of a file

1.13.2.94 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_MAXIO: Max I/O

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 347
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

1.13.2.95 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_MAXOPEN: Max open files

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

1.13.2.96 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_MOUNTPT: NXFFS mountpoint

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt/nxffs"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

1.13.2.97 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_NLOOPS: Number of test loops

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

1.13.2.98 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS_VERBOSE: Verbose output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxffs/Kconfig

1.13.2.99 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXFLAT: NXFLAT example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxflat/Kconfig

    Enable the NXFLAT example

1.13.2.100 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO: NX graphics \"Hello, World!\" example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    Enable the NX graphics \"Hello, World!\" example

1.13.2.101 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_VPLANE: Video Plane

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    The plane to select from the framebuffer driver for use in the test. Default: 0

1.13.2.102 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_DEVNO: Video Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    The LCD device to select from the LCD driver for use in the test: Default: 0

1.13.2.103 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_BPP: Bits-Per-Pixel

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    Pixels per pixel to use. Valid options include 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 24, and 32. Default is 32.

1.13.2.104 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_DEFAULT_COLORS: Use Default Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

1.13.2.105 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_BGCOLOR: Background color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    The color of the background. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_BPP.

1.13.2.106 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_FONTCOLOR: Background font color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    The color of the fonts used in the background window. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_BPP.

1.13.2.107 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_DEFAULT_FONT: Use Default Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

1.13.2.108 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_FONTID: Background font ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_DEFAULT_FONT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    Selects the font used in the background window (see font ID numbers in include/nuttx/nx/nxfonts.h)

1.13.2.109 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO_EXTERNINIT: External Device Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXHELLO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxhello/Kconfig

    The driver for the graphics device on this platform requires some unusual initialization. This is the case, for example, for SPI LCD/OLED devices. If this configuration is selected, then the platform code must provide an LCD initialization function with a prototype like:

    #ifdef CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER FAR struct lcd_dev_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #else FAR struct fb_vtable_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #endif

1.13.2.110 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXIMAGE: NX graphics image example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nximage/Kconfig

    Enable the X graphics image example

1.13.2.111 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES: NX graphics lines example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    Enable the X graphics lines example

1.13.2.112 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_VPLANE: Graphics Plane

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The plane to select from the frame-buffer driver for use in the test. Default: 0

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The LCD device to select from the LCD driver for use in the test: Default: 0

1.13.2.114 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BGCOLOR: Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The color of the background. Default depends on EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BPP.

1.13.2.115 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_LINEWIDTH: Line Width

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    Selects the width of the lines in pixels (default: 16)

1.13.2.116 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_LINECOLOR: Line Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The color of the central lines drawn in the background window. Default depends on EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BPP (there really is no meaningful default).

1.13.2.117 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BORDERWIDTH: Border Width

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The width of the circular border drawn in the background window. (default: 16).

1.13.2.118 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BORDERCOLOR: Border Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The color of the circular border drawn in the background window. Default depends on EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BPP (there really is no meaningful default).

1.13.2.119 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_CIRCLECOLOR: Circle Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The color of the circular region filled in the background window. Default depends on EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BPP (there really is no meaningful default).

1.13.2.120 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_BPP: Bits Per Pixel

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    Pixels per pixel to use. Valid options include 2, 4, 8, 16, 24, and 32. Default is 16.

1.13.2.121 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES_EXTERNINIT: External Device Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: false
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXLINES
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxlines/Kconfig

    The driver for the graphics device on this platform requires some unusual initialization. This is the for, for example, SPI LCD/OLED devices. If this configuration is selected, then the platform code must provide an LCD initialization function with a prototype like:

    #ifdef NX_LCDDRIVER FAR struct lcd_dev_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #else FAR struct fb_vtable_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #endif

1.13.2.122 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT: NX graphics text example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    Enable the NX graphics text example

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The LCD device to select from the LCD driver for use in the test: Default: 0

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    Pixels per pixel to use. Valid options include 2, 4, 8, 16, 24, and 32. Default is 32.

1.13.2.126 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_BMCACHE: Character cache size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    Size of the character cache.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    Size of the glyph cache.

1.13.2.128 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_DEFAULT_COLORS: Use Default Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

  • Default: 0x0

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_DEFAULT_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The color of the fonts used in the pop-up window. Default depends on config EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_BPP.

1.13.2.133 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_DEFAULT_FONT: Use Default Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_DEFAULT_FONT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    Selects the font used in the background window (see font ID numbers in include/nuttx/nx/nxfonts.h)

1.13.2.135 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_PUFONTID: Pop-up font ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_DEFAULT_FONT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    Selects the font used in the pop-up window (see font ID numbers in include/nuttx/nx/nxfonts.h)

1.13.2.136 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_EXTERNINIT: External Device Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The driver for the graphics device on this platform requires some unusual initialization. This is the case, for example, for SPI LCD/OLED devices. If this configuration is selected, then the platform code must provide an LCD initialization function with a prototype like:

    #ifdef CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER FAR struct lcd_dev_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #else FAR struct fb_vtable_s *up_nxdrvinit(unsigned int devno); #endif

1.13.2.137 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_STACKSIZE: NX Server Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The stacksize to use when creating the NX server. Default 2048

1.13.2.138 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_CLIENTPRIO: Client Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The client priority. Default: 100

1.13.2.139 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_SERVERPRIO: Server Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 120
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The server priority. Default: 120

1.13.2.140 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_LISTENERPRIO: Listener Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 80
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The priority of the event listener thread. Default 100.

1.13.2.141 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT_NOTIFYSIGNO: Notify Signal Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NXTEXT, CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/nxtext/Kconfig

    The signal number to use with nx_eventnotify(). Default: 4

1.13.2.142 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST: OS test example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ostest/Kconfig

    Enable the OS test example

1.13.2.143 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST_LOOPS: OS test loop

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ostest/Kconfig

    Used to control the number of executions of the test. If undefined, the test executes one time. If defined to be zero, the test runs forever.

1.13.2.144 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST_STACKSIZE: OS test stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ostest/Kconfig

    Size of the stack used to create the ostest task. Default is 8192.

1.13.2.145 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST_NBARRIER_THREADS: Number of barrier threads

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ostest/Kconfig

    Specifies the number of threads to create in the barrier test. The default is 8 but a smaller number may be needed on systems without sufficient memory to start so many threads.

1.13.2.146 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST_RR_RANGE: Round-robin test - end of search range

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10000
  • Range: 1 - 32767
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ostest/Kconfig

    During round-robin scheduling test two threads are created. Each of the threads searches for prime numbers in the configurable range, doing that configurable number of times.

    This value specifies the end of search range and together with number of runs allows to configure the length of this test - it should last at least a few tens of seconds. Allowed values [1; 32767], default 10000

1.13.2.147 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST_RR_RUNS: Round-robin test - number of runs

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Range: 1 - 32767
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_OSTEST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/ostest/Kconfig

    During round-robin scheduling test two threads are created. Each of the threads searches for prime numbers in the configurable range, doing that configurable number of times.

    This value specifies the number of times the thread searches the range for prime numbers and together with end of search range allows to configure the length of this test - it should last at least a few tens of seconds. Allowed values [1; 32767], default 10

1.13.2.148 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PASHELLO: Pascal \"Hello, World!\" example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pashello/Kconfig

    Enable the Pascal \"Hello, World!\" example

1.13.2.149 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PIPE: Pipe example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pipe/Kconfig

    Enable the pipe example

1.13.2.150 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL: Poll example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/poll/Kconfig

    Enable the poll example

1.13.2.151 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/poll/Kconfig

1.13.2.152 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/poll/Kconfig

1.13.2.153 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/poll/Kconfig

1.13.2.154 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/poll/Kconfig

1.13.2.155 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM: Pulse width modulation (PWM) example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PWM && CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pwm/Kconfig

    Enable the Pulse width modulation (PWM) example

1.13.2.156 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM_DEVPATH: PWM device path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/pwm0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pwm/Kconfig

    The path to the PWM device. Default: /dev/pwm0

1.13.2.157 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM_FREQUENCY: Default PWM freququency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pwm/Kconfig

    The default PWM frequency. Default: 100 Hz

1.13.2.158 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM_DUTYPCT: Default PWM duty percentage

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pwm/Kconfig

    The default PWM duty as a percentage. Default: 50%

1.13.2.159 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM_DURATION: Default PWM duration

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5

    Dependency: !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM_PULSECOUNT

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pwm/Kconfig

    The default PWM pulse train duration in seconds. Used only if the current pulse count is zero (pulse countis only supported if PWM_PULSECOUNT is defined). Default: 5 seconds

1.13.2.160 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM_PULSECOUNT: Default pulse count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/pwm/Kconfig

    The initial PWM pulse count. This option is only available if PWM_PULSECOUNT is nonzero. Default: 0 (i.e., use the duration, not the count).

1.13.2.161 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POSIXSPAWN: posix_spawn Unit Test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/posix_spawn/Kconfig

    Enable the posix_spawn() unit test

1.13.2.162 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POSIXSPAWN_DEVMINOR: ROMFS Minor Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POSIXSPAWN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/posix_spawn/Kconfig

    The minor device number of the ROMFS block. For example, the N in /dev/ramN. Used for registering the RAM block driver that will hold the ROMFS file system containing the ELF executables to be tested. Default: 0

1.13.2.163 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POSIXSPAWN_DEVPATH: ROMFS Devie Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/ram0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_POSIXSPAWN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/posix_spawn/Kconfig

    The path to the ROMFS block driver device. This must match EXAMPLES_POSIXSPAWN_DEVMINOR. Used for registering the RAM block driver that will hold the ROMFS file system containing the ELF executables to be tested. Default: "/dev/ram0"

1.13.2.164 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_QENCODER: Quadrature encoder example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/qencoder/Kconfig

    Enable the quadrature encoder example

1.13.2.165 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_RELAYS: wget JSON Example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/relays/Kconfig

    Enable the wget JSON example

1.13.2.166 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_RELAYS_NRELAYS: Number of Relays

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_RELAYS, CONFIG_ARCH_RELAYS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/relays/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/rgmp/Kconfig

    Enable the RGMP example
