  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/romfs/Kconfig

    Enable the ROMFS example

1.13.2.169 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SENDMAIL: Sendmail example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/sendmail/Kconfig

    Enable the sendmail example

1.13.2.170 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SERLOOP: Serial loopback example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/serloop/Kconfig

    Enable the serial loopback example

1.13.2.171 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SLCD: Segment LCD test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/slcd/Kconfig

    Enables a simple test of an alphanumer, segment LCD

1.13.2.172 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SLCD_DEVNAME: SLCD device path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/slcd"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SLCD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/slcd/Kconfig

    The full path to the SLCD device to be tested

1.13.2.173 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SLCD_BUFSIZE: I/O buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SLCD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/slcd/Kconfig

    The size of the I/O buffer to use in the test (not a critical setting)

1.13.2.174 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_FLASH_TEST: SMART FLASH block device test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_NUTTX_KERNEL && CONFIG_MTD_SMART && CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/flash_test/Kconfig

    This logic performs a SMART flash block device test. This test performs a sector allocate, read, write, free and garbage collection test on a SMART MTD block device. This test can be built only as an NSH command

    NOTE: This test uses internal OS interfaces and so is not available in the NUTTX kernel build

1.13.2.175 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_TEST: SMART filesystem test tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart_test/Kconfig

    Performs a file-based test on a SMART (or any) filesystem. Validates seek, append and seek-with-write operations. This test can be built only as an NSH command

1.13.2.176 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART: SMART file system example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

    Enable the SMART file system example

1.13.2.177 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT: Architecture-specific initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

    The default is to use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c. But an architecture-specific MTD driver can be used instead by defining EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT. In this case, the initialization logic will call smart_archinitialize() to obtain the MTD driver instance.

1.13.2.178 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_NEBLOCKS: Number of erase blocks (simulated)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

    When EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT is not defined, this test will use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c to simulate FLASH. In this case, this value must be provided to give the nubmer of erase blocks in MTD RAM device.

    The size of the allocated RAM drive will be:

      RAMMTD_ERASESIZE * EXAMPLES_SMART_NEBLOCKS

1.13.2.179 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXNAME: Max name size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Range: 1 - 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

    Determines the maximum size of names used in the filesystem

1.13.2.180 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXFILE: Max file size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

    Determines the maximum size of a file

1.13.2.181 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXIO: Max I/O

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 347
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.13.2.182 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXOPEN: Max open files

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.13.2.183 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MOUNTPT: SMART mountpoint

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt/nxffs"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.13.2.184 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_NLOOPS: Number of test loops

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.13.2.185 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_VERBOSE: Verbose output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.13.2.186 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO: Simple TCP echo server

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

    Simple single threaded, poll based TCP echo server. This example implements the TCP Echo Server from W. Richard Stevens UNIX Network Programming Book.

1.13.2.187 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_PORT: Server Port

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 80
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.188 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_BACKLOG: Listen Backlog

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.189 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_NCONN: Number of Connections

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.190 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_DHCPC: DHCP Client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC, CONFIG_NETUTILS_RESOLV
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.191 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.192 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS && !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_DHCPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.193 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.194 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TCPECHO && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tcpecho/Kconfig

1.13.2.195 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD: Telnet daemon example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

    Enable the Telnet daemon example

1.13.2.196 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_THTTPD: THTTPD web server example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/thttpd/Kconfig

    Enable the THTTPD web server example

1.13.2.197 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_THTTPD_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/thttpd/Kconfig

    May be defined to use a hard-coded, software assigned MAC of 00:0e:de:ad:be:ef

1.13.2.198 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_THTTPD_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/thttpd/Kconfig

1.13.2.199 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_THTTPD_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/thttpd/Kconfig

1.13.2.200 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TIFF: TIFF file generation example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/tiff/Kconfig

    Enable the TIFF file generation example

1.13.2.201 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN: Touchscreen example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/touchscreen/Kconfig

    Enable the touchscreen example

1.13.2.202 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN_MINOR: Touchscreen minor device number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/touchscreen/Kconfig

    The minor device number. Minor=N corresponds to touchscreen device /dev/inputN. Note this value must with EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN_DEVPATH. Default 0.

1.13.2.203 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN_DEVPATH: Touchscreen device path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/input0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/touchscreen/Kconfig

    The path to the touchscreen device. This must be consistent with EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN_MINOR. Default: "/dev/input0"

1.13.2.204 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN_NSAMPLES: Number of samples

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TOUCHSCREEN, CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/touchscreen/Kconfig

    If NSH_BUILTIN_APPS is defined, then the number of touchscreen samples is provided on the command line and this value is ignored. Otherwise, this number of samples is collected and the program terminates. Default: Zero (Samples are collected indefinitely).

1.13.2.205 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_UDP: UDP example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/udp/Kconfig

    Enable the UDP example

1.13.2.206 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER: UDP Discovery Example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/discover/Kconfig

    Enable the netutils/discover utility. This example initializes and starts the UDP discover daemon. This daemon is useful for discovering devices in local networks, especially with DHCP configured devices. It listens for UDP broadcasts which also can include a device class so that groups of devices can be discovered. It is also possible to address all classes with a kind of broadcast discover.

1.13.2.207 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER_DHCPC: DHCP Client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC, CONFIG_NETUTILS_RESOLV
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/discover/Kconfig

1.13.2.208 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/discover/Kconfig

1.13.2.209 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS && !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER_DHCPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/discover/Kconfig

1.13.2.210 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/discover/Kconfig

1.13.2.211 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DISCOVER && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/discover/Kconfig

1.13.2.212 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_UIP: uIP web server example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/uip/Kconfig

    Enable the uIP web server example

1.13.2.213 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBSERIAL: USB serial test example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbserial/Kconfig

    Enable the USB serial test example

1.13.2.214 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC: USB mass storage class example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    Enable the USB mass storage class example

1.13.2.215 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_NLUNS: Number of LUNs

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    Defines the number of logical units (LUNs) exported by the USB storage driver. Each LUN corresponds to one exported block driver (or partition of a block driver). May be 1, 2, or 3. Default is 1.

1.13.2.216 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_DEVMINOR1: LUN1 Minor Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    The minor device number of the block driver for the first LUN. For example, N in /dev/mmcsdN. Used for registering the block driver. Default is zero.

1.13.2.217 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_DEVPATH1: LUN1 Device Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/mmcsd0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    The full path to the registered block driver. Default is "/dev/mmcsd0"

1.13.2.218 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_DEVMINOR2: LUN2 Minor Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    The minor device number of the block driver for the second LUN. For example, N in /dev/mmcsdN. Used for registering the block driver. Ignored if EXAMPLES_USBMSC_NLUNS < 2. Default is one.

1.13.2.219 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_DEVPATH2: LUN2 Device Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/mmcsd1"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    The full path to the registered block driver. Ignored if EXAMPLES_USBMSC_NLUNS < 2. Default is "/dev/mmcsd1"

1.13.2.220 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_DEVMINOR3: LUN3 Minor Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    The minor device number of the block driver for the third LUN. For example, N in /dev/mmcsdN. Used for registering the block driver. Ignored if EXAMPLES_USBMSC_NLUNS < 2. Default is two.

1.13.2.221 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_DEVPATH3: LUN3 Device Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/mmcsd2"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    The full path to the registered block driver. Ignored if EXAMPLES_USBMSC_NLUNS < 2. Default is "/dev/mmcsd2"

1.13.2.222 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_DEBUGMM: USB MSC MM Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    Enables some debug tests to check for memory usage and memory leaks.

1.13.2.223 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_TRACEINIT: USB Trace Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    If USBDEV_TRACE is enabled (or DEBUG and DEBUG_USB), then the example code will also manage the USB trace output. The amount of trace output can be controlled this configuration value: This setting will show USB initialization events

1.13.2.224 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_TRACECLASS: USB Trace Class

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    If USBDEV_TRACE is enabled (or DEBUG and DEBUG_USB), then the example code will also manage the USB trace output. The amount of trace output can be controlled this configuration value: This setting will show USB class driver events

1.13.2.225 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_TRACETRANSFERS: USB Trace Transfers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    If USBDEV_TRACE is enabled (or DEBUG and DEBUG_USB), then the example code will also manage the USB trace output. The amount of trace output can be controlled this configuration value: This setting will show USB data transfer events

1.13.2.226 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_TRACECONTROLLER: USB Trace Device Controller Events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    If USBDEV_TRACE is enabled (or DEBUG and DEBUG_USB), then the example code will also manage the USB trace output. The amount of trace output can be controlled this configuration value: This setting will show USB device controller events

1.13.2.227 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC_TRACEINTERRUPTS: USB Trace Device Controller Interrupt Events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbstorage/Kconfig

    If USBDEV_TRACE is enabled (or DEBUG and DEBUG_USB), then the example code will also manage the USB trace output. The amount of trace output can be controlled this configuration value: This setting will show USB device controller interrupt-related events.

1.13.2.228 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_USBTERM: USB serial terminal example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/usbterm/Kconfig

    Enable the USB serial terminal example

1.13.2.229 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG: Watchdog Timer example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/watchdog/Kconfig

    Enable the watchdog timer example

1.13.2.230 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG_DEVPATH: Watchdog device path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/watchdog0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/watchdog/Kconfig

    The path to the watchdog device. Default: /dev/watchdog0

1.13.2.231 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG_PINGTIME: Watchdog ping time

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/watchdog/Kconfig

    Time in milliseconds that the example will ping the watchdog before letting the watchdog expire. Default: 5000 milliseconds.

1.13.2.232 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG_PINGDELAY: Watchdog ping delay

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/watchdog/Kconfig

    Time delay between pings in milliseconds. Default: 500 milliseconds.

1.13.2.233 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT: Watchdog timeout

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WATCHDOG
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/watchdog/Kconfig

    The watchdog timeout value in milliseconds before the watchdog timer expires. Default: 2000 milliseconds.

1.13.2.234 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET: wget example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_TCP && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wget/Kconfig

    Enable the wget example

1.13.2.235 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET_URL: File URL

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wget/Kconfig

    The URL of the file to get

1.13.2.236 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wget/Kconfig

1.13.2.237 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wget/Kconfig

1.13.2.238 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wget/Kconfig

1.13.2.239 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wget/Kconfig

1.13.2.240 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGETJSON: wget JSON Example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wgetjson/Kconfig

    Enable the wget JSON example

1.13.2.241 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGETJSON_MAXSIZE: Max. JSON Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGETJSON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wgetjson/Kconfig

1.13.2.242 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGETJSON_URL: wget URL

  • Type: String
  • Default: "http://10.0.0.1/wgetjson/json_cmd.php"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGETJSON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wgetjson/Kconfig

1.13.2.243 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGETPOST_URL: wget_post URL

  • Type: String
  • Default: "http://10.0.0.1/wgetjson/post_cmd.php"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WGETJSON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/wgetjson/Kconfig

1.13.2.244 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC: XML RPC example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_XMLRPC
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_TCP && !CONFIG_DISABLE_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

    An example for the netutils/xmlrpc library. This example implements a lightweight HTTP server and uses the xmlrpc lib for parsing xml remote procedure calls.

1.13.2.245 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC_BUFFERSIZE: HTTP buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

1.13.2.246 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC_DHCPC: DHCP Client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC, CONFIG_NETUTILS_RESOLV
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

1.13.2.247 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

1.13.2.248 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS && !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC_DHCPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

1.13.2.249 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

1.13.2.250 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_XMLRPC && !CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

1.13.3 Menu: Graphics Support

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/Kconfig

1.13.3.1 CONFIG_TIFF: TIFF file generation library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/graphics/Kconfig

    Enable support for the TIFF file generation program.

1.13.3.2 Menu: TIFF Screenshot Utility

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TIFF
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/graphics/Kconfig

1.13.3.2.1 CONFIG_GRAPHICS_SCREENSHOT: TIFF screenshot utility

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TIFF, CONFIG_TIFF && CONFIG_NX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/graphics/screenshot/Kconfig

    Generate a NX screenshot utility based on the TIFF library.

1.13.3.2.2 CONFIG_SCREENSHOT_WIDTH: Screenshot width (in pixels)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 320
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TIFF, CONFIG_GRAPHICS_SCREENSHOT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/graphics/screenshot/Kconfig

    The width of the screenshot in pixels/columns.

1.13.3.2.3 CONFIG_SCREENSHOT_HEIGHT: Screenshot height (in lines)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 240
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TIFF, CONFIG_GRAPHICS_SCREENSHOT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/graphics/screenshot/Kconfig

    The height of the screenshot in pixels/rows.

1.13.3.2.4 CONFIG_SCREENSHOT_FORMAT: Screenshot color format

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 9
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TIFF, CONFIG_GRAPHICS_SCREENSHOT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/graphics/screenshot/Kconfig

    See inlcude/nuttx/fb.h for a list of color formats. The default value of 9 corresponds to FB_FMT_RGB16_565

1.13.4 Menu: Interpreters

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/Kconfig

1.13.4.1 CONFIG_INTERPRETERS_FICL: Ficl Forth interpreter

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/interpreters/ficl/Kconfig

    Enable support for the Ficl interpreter interpreter. See README.txt file in the apps/interpreters/ficl directory. Use of this configuration assumes that you have performed the required installation of the Ficl run-time code.

1.13.4.2 CONFIG_INTERPRETERS_PCODE: Pascal p-code interpreter

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/interpreters/Kconfig

    Enable support for the Pascal p-code interpreter. See README file at misc/pascal and also the README.txt file in the apps/interpreter directory. Use of this configuration implies that you have performed the required installation of the Pascal run-time code.

1.13.5 Menu: Network Utilities

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/Kconfig

1.13.5.1 CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS: CODEC Library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables the netutils/code library: Base64 coding, URL coding, MD5.

1.13.5.2 CONFIG_CODECS_BASE64: Base 64 Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: base64_encode(), base64_decode(), base64w_encode(), and base64w_decode(),

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.13.5.3 CONFIG_CODECS_HASH_MD5: MD5 Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: MD5Init(), MD5Update(), MD5Final(), MD5Transform(), md5_sum() and md5_hash()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.13.5.4 CONFIG_CODECS_URLCODE: URL Decode Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: urlencode() and urldecode()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.13.5.5 CONFIG_CODECS_URLCODE_NEWMEMORY: URL Allocating Decode Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: url_encode() and url_decode()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.13.5.6 CONFIG_CODECS_AVR_URLCODE: URL Raw Decode Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: urlrawdecode() and urlrawencode()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.13.5.7 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC: DHCP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/dhcpc/Kconfig

    Enable support for the DHCP client.

1.13.5.8 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD: DHCP server

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/dhcpd/Kconfig

    Enable support for the DHCP server.

1.13.5.9 CONFIG_NETUTILS_FTPC: FTP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/ftpc/Kconfig

    Enable support for the FTP client.

1.13.5.10 CONFIG_NETUTILS_FTPD: FTP server

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/ftpd/Kconfig

    Enable support for the FTP server.

1.13.5.11 CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON: cJSON library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/json/Kconfig

    Enables the cJSON library. cJSON is an ultra-lightweight, portable, single-file, simple-as-can-be ANSI-C compliant JSON parser, under MIT license. Embeddable Lightweight XML-RPC Server discussed at http://www.drdobbs.com/web-development/an-embeddable-lightweight-xml-rpc-server/184405364. This code was taken from http://sourceforge.net/projects/cjson/ and adapted for NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.13.5.12 CONFIG_NETUTILS_RESOLV: Name resolution

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/resolv/Kconfig

    Enable support for the name resolution.

1.13.5.13 CONFIG_NET_RESOLV_ENTRIES: Number of resolver entries

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_RESOLV
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/resolv/Kconfig

    Number of resolver entries. Default: 8

1.13.5.14 CONFIG_NET_RESOLV_MAXRESPONSE: Max response size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 96
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_RESOLV
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/resolv/Kconfig

    This setting determines the maximum size of response message that can be received by the DNS resolver. The default is 96 but may need to be larger on enterprise networks (perhaps 176).

1.13.5.15 CONFIG_NETUTILS_SMTP: SMTP

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/smtp/Kconfig

    Enable support for SMTP.

1.13.5.16 CONFIG_NETUTILS_TELNETD: Telet daemon

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/telnetd/Kconfig

    Enable support for the Telnet daemon.

1.13.5.17 CONFIG_NETUTILS_TFTPC: TFTP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/tftpc/Kconfig

    Enable support for the TFTP client.

1.13.5.18 CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD: THTTPD webserver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Enable support for the THTTPD webservert.

1.13.5.19 CONFIG_THTTPD_PORT: THTTPD port number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 80
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    THTTPD Server port number. Default: 80

1.13.5.20 CONFIG_THTTPD_IPADDR: THTTPD IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x10000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Server IP address (no host name). Default: 0x10000002

    This is a 32-bit integer value in host order. So, as an example, the default value of 0x10000002 would correspond to 10.0.0.2.

1.13.5.21 CONFIG_THTTPD_SERVER_ADDRESS: Reported server URL

  • Type: String
  • Default: "http://www.nuttx.org"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    SERVER_ADDRESS: response, Default: "http://www.nuttx.org"

1.13.5.22 CONFIG_THTTPD_SERVER_SOFTWARE: Reporter server software string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "thttpd/2.25b 29dec2003-NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    SERVER_SOFTWARE: response, Default: "thttpd/2.25b 29dec2003-NuttX"

1.13.5.23 CONFIG_THTTPD_PATH: Path to the server content

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt/www"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Server working directory. Default: "/mnt/www"

1.13.5.24 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGI_PATH: Path to CGI content

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt/www/cgi-bin"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Path to CGI executables. Default: "/mnt/www/cgi-bin"

1.13.5.25 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGI_PATTERN: CGI match pattern

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt/www/cgi-bin/*"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Only CGI programs matching this pattern will be executed. In fact, if this value is not defined then no CGI logic will be built. Default: "/mnt/www/cgi-bin/*"

1.13.5.26 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGI_PRIORITY: CGI child priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Provides the priority of CGI child tasks. Default: 50

1.13.5.27 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGI_STACKSIZE: CGI child stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Provides the default stack size of CGI child task (will be overridden by the stack size in the NXFLAT header)

1.13.5.28 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGI_BYTECOUNT: Byte output limit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 200000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Byte output limit for CGI tasks. Default: 200000

1.13.5.29 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGI_TIMELIMIT: CGI time limit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    How many seconds to allow CGI programs to run before killing them. Default: 0 (no time limit)

1.13.5.30 CONFIG_THTTPD_CHARSET: Default character set

  • Type: String
  • Default: "iso-8859-1"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    The default character set name to use with text MIME types. Default: "iso-8859-1"

1.13.5.31 CONFIG_THTTPD_IOBUFFERSIZE: Initial I/O buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Initial I/O buffer size. Default: 256

1.13.5.32 CONFIG_THTTPD_MINSTRSIZE: Minimum string size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Minimum string size. Default: 64

1.13.5.33 CONFIG_THTTPD_REALLOCINCR: String reallocation increment

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    String reallocation increment. Default: 64

1.13.5.34 CONFIG_THTTPD_MAXREALLOC: Maximum string reallocation size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Maximum string reallocation size. Default: 4096

1.13.5.35 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGIINBUFFERSIZ: CGI interpose input buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    CGI interpose input buffer size. Default: 512

1.13.5.36 CONFIG_THTTPD_CGIOUTBUFFERSIZE: CGI interpose output buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    CGI interpose output buffer size. Default: 512

1.13.5.37 CONFIG_THTTPD_INDEX_NAMES: Index file name list

  • Type: String
  • Default: "\"index.html\", \"index.htm\", \"index.cgi\""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    A list of index filenames to check. The files are searched for in this order. Default: "\"index.html\", \"index.htm\", \"index.cgi\""

1.13.5.38 CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_AUTH_FILE: Use authentication file

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Select to define an authentication file that thttpd will check in the local directory before every fetch. If the file exists then authentication is done, otherwise the fetch proceeds as usual. If you leave this undefined then thttpd will not implement authentication at all and will not check for auth files, which saves a bit of CPU time.

1.13.5.39 CONFIG_AUTH_FILE: Authorization file

  • Type: String
  • Default: ".htpasswd"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD, CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_AUTH_FILE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    The file to use for authentication. thttpd checks for this file in the local directory before every fetch. If the file exists then authentication is done, otherwise the fetch proceeds as usual. A typical value is ".htpasswd"

1.13.5.40 CONFIG_THTTPD_LISTEN_BACKLOG: Listen backlog

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    The listen() backlog queue length. Default: 8

1.13.5.41 CONFIG_THTTPD_LINGER_MSEC: Linger time (msec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    How many milliseconds to leave a connection open while doing a lingering close. Default: 500

1.13.5.42 CONFIG_THTTPD_OCCASIONAL_MSEC: Occasional clean-up time (msec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 120
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    How often to run the occasional cleanup job in milliseconds. Default: 120 (2 minutes)

1.13.5.43 CONFIG_THTTPD_MEMDEBUG: Enable memory debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD, CONFIG_DEBUG && CONFIG_DEBUG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Enable THTTPD memory usage debug output. Default: n

1.13.5.44 CONFIG_THTTPD_IDLE_READ_LIMIT_SEC: Idle read time limit (sec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 300
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    How many seconds to allow for reading the initial request on a new connection. Default: 300

1.13.5.45 CONFIG_THTTPD_IDLE_SEND_LIMIT_SEC: Idle send time limit (sec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 300
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    How many seconds before an idle connection gets closed. Default: 300

1.13.5.46 Choice: Tilde Mapping

  • Default: THTTPD_TILDE_MAP_NONE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    • Tilde mapping. Many URLs use ~username to indicate a user's home directory. thttpd provides two options for mapping this construct to an actual filename.

    1) Map ~username to <prefix>/username. This is the recommended choice. Each user gets a subdirectory in the main web tree, and the tilde construct points there.

    The prefix could be something like "users", or it could be empty.

    2) Map ~username to <user's homedir>/<postfix>. The postfix would be the name of a subdirectory off of the user's actual home dir, something like "public_html".

    3) Niether. You can also leave both options undefined, and thttpd will not do anything special about tildes. Enabling both options is an error.

    Typical values, if they're defined, are "users" for THTTPD_TILDE_MAP1 and "public_html" for THTTPD_TILDE_MAP2.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_TILDE_MAP1: Tilde mapping 1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

      Tilde mapping. Many URLs use ~username to indicate a user's home directory. thttpd provides two options for mapping this construct to an actual filename. Choose this option for the first mapping:

      1) Map ~username to <prefix>/username. This is the recommended choice. Each user gets a subdirectory in the main web tree, and the tilde construct points there.

      The prefix could be something like "users", or it could be empty.

    CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_TILDE_MAP2: Tilde mapping 2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

      Tilde mapping. Many URLs use ~username to indicate a user's home directory. thttpd provides two options for mapping this construct to an actual filename. Choose this option for the second mapping:

      2) Map ~username to <user's homedir>/<postfix>. The postfix would be the name of a subdirectory off of the user's actual home dir, something like "public_html".

      The typical value THTTPD_TILDE_MAP2 is "public_html".

    CONFIG_THTTPD_TILDE_MAP_NONE: No tilde mapping

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

      Tilde mapping. Many URLs use ~username to indicate a user's home directory. thttpd provides two options for mapping this construct to an actual filename. Choose this option to omit tilde mapping: thttpd will not do anything special about tildes.

1.13.5.47 CONFIG_THTTPD_TILDE_MAP1: Tilde mapping 1

  • Type: String
  • Default: "user"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD, CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_TILDE_MAP1
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Tilde mapping. Many URLs use ~username to indicate a user's home directory. thttpd provides two options for mapping this construct to an actual filename. Choose this option defines the <prefix> string for the first mapping:

    1) Map ~username to <prefix>/username. This is the recommended choice. Each user gets a subdirectory in the main web tree, and the tilde construct points there.

    The prefix could be something like "users", or it could be empty.

1.13.5.48 CONFIG_THTTPD_TILDE_MAP2: Tilde mapping 2

  • Type: String
  • Default: "public_html"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD, CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_TILDE_MAP2
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Tilde mapping. Many URLs use ~username to indicate a user's home directory. thttpd provides two options for mapping this construct to an actual filename. Choose this option defines the <postfix> string for the second mapping:

    2) Map ~username to <user's homedir>/<postfix>. The postfix would be the name of a subdirectory off of the user's actual home dir, something like "public_html".

    The typical value THTTPD_TILDE_MAP2 is "public_html".

1.13.5.49 CONFIG_THTTPD_GENERATE_INDICES: Generate name indices

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

1.13.5.50 CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_URLPATTERN: Use URL pattern

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    Select to define a URL pattern that will be used to match and verify referrers.

1.13.5.51 CONFIG_THTTPD_URLPATTERN: URL pattern

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_THTTPD, CONFIG_THTTPD_USE_URLPATTERN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/thttpd/Kconfig

    This string defines the UARL pattern that will be used to match and verify referrers.

1.13.5.52 CONFIG_NETUTILS_UIPLIB: Network support library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/uiplib/Kconfig

    Enable support for the network support library.

1.13.5.53 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT: uIP web client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webclient/Kconfig

    Enable support for the uIP web client.

1.13.5.54 CONFIG_NSH_WGET_USERAGENT: wget Usert Agent

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX/6.xx.x (; http://www.nuttx.org/)"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webclient/Kconfig

1.13.5.55 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER: uIP web server

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    Enable support for the uIP web server. This tiny web server was from uIP 1.0, but has undergone many changes. It is, however, still referred to as the "uIP" web server.

1.13.5.56 CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_SINGLECONNECT: Single Connection

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_DISABLE_PTHREAD

    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_DISABLE_PTHREAD

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    By default, the uIP web server will create a new, independent thread for each connection. This can, however, use a lot of stack space if there are many connections and that can be a problem is RAM is limited. If this option is selected, then a single thread will service all HTTP requests and, in this case, only a single connection at a time is supported at a time.

1.13.5.57 CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_SCRIPT_DISABLE: Disable %! scripting

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_SENDFILE

    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_SENDFILE

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    This option, if selected, will elide the %! scripting

1.13.5.58 CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_CGIPATH: URL/CGI function mapping

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    This option enables mappings from URLs to call CGI functions. The effect is that the existing httpd_cgi_register() interface can be used thus:

    const static struct httpd_cgi_call a[] = { { NULL, "/abc", cgi_abc }, { NULL, "/xyz", cgi_xyz } };

    for (i = 0; i < sizeof a / sizeof *a; i++) { httpd_cgi_register(&a[i]); }

    Where (under NETUTILS_HTTPD_CGIPATH) the "/xyz" is a URL path, rather than a %! xyz style call in the existing manner.

    This is useful when NETUTILS_HTTPD_SCRIPT_DISABLE is defined.

    In other words, this provides a way to get your CGI functions called without needing the scripting language. I'm using this to provide a REST style interface over HTTP, where my CGI handlers just return a HTTP status code with a content length of 0.

1.13.5.59 CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_ERRPATH: Error Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    Path used in error return packets.

1.13.5.60 CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_SERVERHEADER_DISABLE: Disabled the SERVER header

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    This option, if selected, will elide the Server\: header

1.13.5.61 CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_TIMEOUT: Receive Timeout (sec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER, CONFIG_NET_SOCKOPTS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    Receive timeout setting (in seconds). A timeout value of zero disables the timeout. An HTTP 408 error is generated if the timeout expires. This option depends on support for socket options (sockopts).

1.13.5.62 Choice: File Transfer Method

  • Default: NETUTILS_HTTPD_CLASSIC
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_CLASSIC: Pre-processed files

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

      Traditionally, the uIP-based webserver only sends "files" that have been prepared as a data structure using nutts/tools/mkfsdata.pl

    CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_MMAP: File mmap-ing

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

      Traditionally, the uIP-based webserver only sends "files" that have been prepared as a data structure using nutts/tools/mkfsdata.pl However, extensions have been contributed. If this option is selected, then files can be accessed from the NuttX file system as well. This selection will map the files into memory (using mmap) so that the logic is still basically compatible with the classic approach. NOTE, however, that since files are copied into memory, this limits solution to small files that will fit into available RAM.

    CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_MMAP: sendfile()

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_SCRIPT_DISABLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

      Traditionally, the uIP-based webserver only sends "files" that have been prepared as a data structure using nutts/tools/mkfsdata.pl However, extensions have been contributed. If this option is selected, then files can be accessed from the NuttX file system as well. This selection will use the NuttX sendfile() interface to send files. NOTE: If this option is selected, then scripting must be disabled since it depends on the classic, in-memory representation.

1.13.5.63 CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_KEEPALIVE_DISABLE: Keepalive Disable

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: !CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_TIMEOUT

    • Default: n

      Dependency: CONFIG_NETUTILS_HTTPD_TIMEOUT

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/webserver/Kconfig

    Disabled HTTP keep-alive for HTTP clients. Keep-alive permits a client to make multiple requests over the same connection, rather than closing and opening a new socket for each request.

    This depends on the content-length being known, and is automatically disabled for situations where that header isn't produced (i.e. scripting, CGI). Keep-alive is also disabled for certain error responses.

    Keep-alive should normally be disabled if timeouts are enabled, otherwise a rogue HTTP client could block the httpd indefinitely.

1.13.5.64 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER: Network Discovery Utility

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_UIPLIB
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/discover/Kconfig

    Tool for discovering devices on the local network per UDP broadcast.

1.13.5.65 CONFIG_DISCOVER_STACK_SIZE: Discover Daemon Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/discover/Kconfig

1.13.5.66 CONFIG_DISCOVER_PRIORITY: Discover Daemon Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/discover/Kconfig

1.13.5.67 CONFIG_DISCOVER_PORT: Discover Daemon Port Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 96
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/discover/Kconfig

1.13.5.68 CONFIG_DISCOVER_INTERFACE: Network Interface Name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "eth0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/discover/Kconfig

1.13.5.69 CONFIG_DISCOVER_DEVICE_CLASS: Network Discovery Class

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/discover/Kconfig

1.13.5.70 CONFIG_DISCOVER_DESCR: Discoverer Description

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_DISCOVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/discover/Kconfig

1.13.5.71 CONFIG_NETUTILS_XMLRPC: XML RPC library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_UIPLIB
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/xmlrpc/Kconfig

    Enables the Embeddable Lightweight XML-RPC Server discussed at http://www.drdobbs.com/web-development/an-embeddable-lightweight-xml-rpc-server/184405364

1.13.5.72 CONFIG_XMLRPC_STRINGSIZE: Maximum string length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_XMLRPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/netutils/xmlrpc/Kconfig

    Maximum string length for method names and XML RPC string values.

1.13.6 Menu: FreeModBus

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/Kconfig

1.13.6.1 CONFIG_MODBUS: Modbus support via FreeModBus

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.6.2 CONFIG_MB_ASCII_ENABLED: Modbus ASCII support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.6.3 CONFIG_MB_RTU_ENABLED: Modbus RTU support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.6.4 CONFIG_MB_TCP_ENABLED: Modbus TCP support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

1.13.6.5 CONFIG_MB_ASCII_TIMEOUT_SEC: Character timeout

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MB_ASCII_ENABLED
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    Character timeout value for Modbus ASCII

    The character timeout value is not fixed for Modbus ASCII and is therefore a configuration option. It should be set to the maximum expected delay time of the network.

1.13.6.6 CONFIG_MB_ASCII_TIMEOUT_WAIT_BEFORE_SEND_MS: Timeout to wait before sending

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MB_ASCII_ENABLED
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    Timeout to wait in ASCII prior to enabling transmitter

    If defined the function calls vMBPortSerialDelay with the argument MB_ASCII_TIMEOUT_WAIT_BEFORE_SEND_MS to allow for a delay before the serial transmitter is enabled. This is required because some targets are so fast that there is no time between receiving and transmitting the frame. If the master is to slow with enabling its receiver then he will not receive the response correctly.

1.13.6.7 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_HANDLERS_MAX: Maximum number of Modbus functions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    Maximum number of Modbus functions codes the protocol stack should support.

    The maximum number of supported Modbus functions must be greater than the sum of all enabled functions in this file and custom function handlers. If set to small adding more functions will fail.

1.13.6.8 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_OTHER_REP_SLAVEID_BUF: Size of Slave ID report buffer

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MB_FUNC_OTHER_REP_SLAVEID_ENABLED
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    Number of bytes which should be allocated for the Report Slave ID command.

    This number limits the maximum size of the additional segment in the report slave id function. See eMBSetSlaveID() for more information on how to set this value. It is only used if MB_FUNC_OTHER_REP_SLAVEID_ENABLED is set to 1.

1.13.6.9 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_OTHER_REP_SLAVEID_ENABLED: Report Slave ID function

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Report Slave ID function should be enabled.

1.13.6.10 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_READ_INPUT_ENABLED: Read Input Registers function

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Read Input Registers function should be enabled.

1.13.6.11 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_READ_HOLDING_ENABLED: Read Holding Registers function

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Read Holding Registers function should be enabled.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Write Single Register function should be enabled.

1.13.6.13 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_WRITE_MULTIPLE_HOLDING_ENABLED: Write Multiple registers function

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Write Multiple registers function should be enabled.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Read Coils function should be enabled.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Write Coils function should be enabled.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Write Multiple Coils function should be enabled.

1.13.6.17 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_READ_DISCRETE_INPUTS_ENABLED: Read Discrete Inputs function

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Read Discrete Inputs function should be enabled.

1.13.6.18 CONFIG_MB_FUNC_READWRITE_HOLDING_ENABLED: Read/Write Multiple Registers function

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MODBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/modbus/Kconfig

    If the Read/Write Multiple Registers function should be enabled.

1.13.7 Menu: NSH Library

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/Kconfig

1.13.7.1 CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY: NSH Library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SYSTEM_READLINE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Build the NSH support library. This is used, for example, by examples/nsh in order to implement the full NuttShell (NSH).

1.13.7.2 CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS: Enable built-in applications

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_BUILTIN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Support external registered, "built-in" applications that can be executed from the NSH command line (see apps/README.txt for more information). This options requires support for builtin applications (BUILTIN).

1.13.7.3 CONFIG_NSH_FILE_APPS: Enable execution of program files

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_LIBC_EXECFUNCS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Support execution of program files residing within a file system. This options requires support for the posix_spawn() interface (LIBC_EXECFUNCS).

1.13.7.4 Menu: Disable Individual commands

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
