1.13.7.5 Menu: Configure Command Options

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

1.13.7.5.1 CONFIG_NSH_CMDOPT_DF_H: df: Enable [-h] man-readable format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

1.13.7.5.2 CONFIG_NSH_CODECS_BUFSIZE: File buffer size used by CODEC commands

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

1.13.7.6 CONFIG_NSH_FILEIOSIZE: NSH I/O buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Size of a static I/O buffer used for file access (ignored if there is no filesystem). Default is 1024.

1.13.7.7 CONFIG_NSH_STRERROR: Use strerror()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    strerror(errno) makes more readable output but strerror() is very large and will not be used unless this setting is 'y' This setting depends upon the strerror() having been enabled with LIBC_STRERROR.

1.13.7.8 CONFIG_NSH_LINELEN: Max command line length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 80
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    The maximum length of one command line and of one output line. Default: 80

1.13.7.9 CONFIG_NSH_MAXARGUMENTS: Maximum number of command arguments

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    The maximum number of NSH command arguments. Default: 6

1.13.7.10 CONFIG_NSH_NESTDEPTH: Maximum command nesting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    The maximum number of nested if-then[-else]-fi sequences that are permissable. Default: 3

1.13.7.11 CONFIG_NSH_DISABLESCRIPT: Disable script support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    This can be set to 'y' to suppress support for scripting. This setting disables the 'sh', 'test', and '[' commands and the if-then[-else]-fi construct. This would only be set on systems where a minimal footprint is a necessity and scripting is not.

1.13.7.12 CONFIG_NSH_DISABLEBG: Disable background commands

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    This can be set to 'y' to suppress support for background commands. This setting disables the 'nice' command prefix and the '&' command suffix. This would only be set on systems where a minimal footprint is a necessity and background command execution is not.

1.13.7.13 CONFIG_NSH_MMCSDMINOR: MMC/SD minor device number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If the architecture supports an MMC/SD slot and if the NSH architecture specific logic is present, this option will provide the MMC/SD minor number, i.e., the MMC/SD block driver will be registered as /dev/mmcsdN where N is the minor number. Default is zero.

1.13.7.14 CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC: Support ROMFS start-up script

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_FS_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Mount a ROMFS filesystem at /etc and provide a startup script at /etc/init.d/rcS. The default startup script will mount a FAT FS RAMDISK at /tmp but the logic is easily extensible.

1.13.7.15 CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSRC: Support ROMFS login script

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    The ROMFS start-up script will be executed excactly once. For simple, persistence consoles (like a serial console). But with other other kinds of consoles, there may be multiple, transient sessions (such as Telnet and USB consoles). In these cases, you may need another script that is executed at the beginning of each session. Selecting this option enables support for such a login script

1.13.7.16 CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSMOUNTPT: ROMFS mount point

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/etc"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    The default mountpoint for the ROMFS volume is /etc, but that can be changed with this setting. This must be a absolute path beginning with '/'.

1.13.7.17 CONFIG_NSH_INITSCRIPT: Relative path to startup script

  • Type: String
  • Default: "init.d/rcS"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    This is the relative path to the startup script within the mountpoint. The default is init.d/rcS. This is a relative path and must not start with '/'.

1.13.7.18 CONFIG_NSH_RCSCRIPT: Relative path to login script

  • Type: String
  • Default: ".nshrc"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC, CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSRC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    This is the relative path to the login script within the mountpoint. The default is .nshrc. This is a relative path and must not start with '/'.

1.13.7.19 CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSDEVNO: ROMFS block device minor number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    This is the minor number of the ROMFS block device. The default is '0' corresponding to /dev/ram0.

1.13.7.20 CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSSECTSIZE: ROMFS sector size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    This is the sector size to use with the ROMFS volume. Since the default volume is very small, this defaults to 64 but should be increased if the ROMFS volume were to be become large. Any value selected must be a power of 2.

1.13.7.21 CONFIG_NSH_ARCHROMFS: Architecture-specific ROMFS header

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC, CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Enable this option to provide an architecture-specific ROMFS header at <arch/board/nsh_romfsimg.h>. Note that this header will be copied from nuttx/configs/<boardname>/include and should be stored at this location.

1.13.7.22 CONFIG_NSH_FATDEVNO: FAT block device minor number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC, CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    When the default rcS file used when NSH_ROMFSETC is selected, it will mount a FAT FS under /tmp. This is the minor number of the FAT FS block device. The default is '1' corresponding to /dev/ram1.

1.13.7.23 CONFIG_NSH_FATSECTSIZE: FAT sector size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC, CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    When the default rcS file used when NSH_ROMFSETC is selected, it will mount a FAT FS under /tmp. This is the sector size use with the FAT FS. Default is 512.

1.13.7.24 CONFIG_NSH_FATNSECTORS: FAT number of sectors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC, CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    When the default rcS file used when NSH_ROMFSETC is selected, it will mount a FAT FS under /tmp. This is the number of sectors to use with the FAT FS. Defualt is 1024. The amount of memory used by the FAT FS will be NSH_FATSECTSIZE * NSH_FATNSECTORS bytes.

1.13.7.25 CONFIG_NSH_FATMOUNTPT: FAT mount point

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/tmp"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_ROMFSETC, CONFIG_FS_FAT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    When the default rcS file used when NSH_ROMFSETC is selected, it will mount a FAT FS under /tmp. This is the location where the FAT FS will be mounted. Default is "/tmp".

1.13.7.26 CONFIG_NSH_CONSOLE: Use console

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If NSH_CONSOLE is set to 'y', then a character driver console front-end is selected (/dev/console).

    Normally, the serial console device is a UART and RS-232 interface. However, if USBDEV is defined, then a USB serial device may, instead, be used if the one of the following are defined:

    PL2303 and PL2303_CONSOLE - Set up the Prolifics PL2303 emulation as a console device at /dev/console.

    CDCACM and CDCACM_CONSOLE - Set up the CDC/ACM serial device as a console device at dev/console.

    NSH_USBCONSOLE and NSH_USBCONDEV - Sets up some other USB serial device as the NSH console (not necessarily dev/console).

1.13.7.27 CONFIG_NSH_USBCONSOLE: Use a USB console

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_CONSOLE && CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If defined, then the an arbitrary USB device may be used to as the NSH console. In this case, NSH_USBCONDEV must be defined to indicate which USB device to use as the console.

1.13.7.28 CONFIG_NSH_USBCONDEV: USB console device

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/ttyACM0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_USBCONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If NSH_USBCONSOLE is set to 'y', then NSH_USBCONDEV must also be set to select the USB device used to support the NSH console. This should be set to the quoted name of a readable/write-able USB driver such as: NSH_USBCONDEV="/dev/ttyACM0".

1.13.7.29 CONFIG_USBDEV_MINOR: USB console device minor number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_USBCONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If there are more than one USB devices, then a USB device minor number may also need to be provided. Default: 0

1.13.7.30 CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACE: Enable Builtin USB Trace Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_USBDEV && (CONFIG_DEBUG || CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE)
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Enable builtin USB trace support in NSH. If selected, buffered USB trace data will be presented each time a command is provided to NSH. The USB trace data will be sent to the console unless DEBUG set or unless you are using a USB console. In those cases, the trace data will go to the SYSLOG device.

    If not enabled, the USB trace support can be provided by external logic such as apps/system/usbmonitor.

1.13.7.31 CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACEINIT: Show initialization events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Show initialization events

1.13.7.32 CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACECLASS: Show class driver events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Show class driver events

1.13.7.33 CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACETRANSFERS: Show data transfer events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Show data transfer events

1.13.7.34 CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACECONTROLLER: Show controller events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Show controller events

1.13.7.35 CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACEINTERRUPTS: Show interrupt-related events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Show interrupt-related events

1.13.7.36 CONFIG_NSH_CONDEV: Default console device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: "/dev/console"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NSH_CONSOLE && !CONFIG_NSH_USBCONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If NSH_CONSOLE is set to 'y', then NSH_CONDEV may also be set to select the serial device used to support the NSH console. This should be set to the quoted name of a readable/write-able character driver such as: NSH_CONDEV="/dev/ttyS1". This is useful, for example, to separate the NSH command line from the system console when the system console is used to provide debug output. Default: stdin and stdout (probably "/dev/console")

    NOTE: When any other device other than /dev/console is used for a user interface, (1) linefeeds (\n) will not be expanded to carriage return / linefeeds (\r\n). You will need to set your terminal program to account for this. And (2) input is not automatically echoed so you will have to turn local echo on.

1.13.7.37 CONFIG_NSH_ARCHINIT: Have architecture-specific initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Set if your board provides architecture specific initialization via the board-specific function nsh_archinitialize(). This function will be called early in NSH initialization to allow board logic to do such things as configure MMC/SD slots.

1.13.7.38 CONFIG_NSH_TELNET: Use Telnet console

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY, CONFIG_NET && CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If NSH_TELNET is set to 'y', then a TELENET server front-end is selected. When this option is provided, you may log into NuttX remotely using telnet in order to access NSH.

1.13.7.39 CONFIG_NSH_TELNETD_PORT: Telnet port number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 23
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    The telnet daemon will listen on this TCP port number for connections. Default: 23

1.13.7.40 CONFIG_NSH_TELNETD_DAEMONPRIO: Telnet daemon priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Priority of the Telnet daemon. Default: 100

1.13.7.41 CONFIG_NSH_TELNETD_DAEMONSTACKSIZE: Telnet daemon stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Stack size allocated for the Telnet daemon. Default: 2048

1.13.7.42 CONFIG_NSH_TELNETD_CLIENTPRIO: Telnet client priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Priority of the Telnet client. Default: 100

1.13.7.43 CONFIG_NSH_TELNETD_CLIENTSTACKSIZE: Telnet client stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Stack size allocated for the Telnet client. Default: 2048

1.13.7.44 CONFIG_NSH_IOBUFFER_SIZE: Telnet I/O buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Determines the size of the I/O buffer to use for sending/ receiving TELNET commands/reponses. Default: 512

1.13.7.45 CONFIG_NSH_TELNET_LOGIN: Telnet Login

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If defined, then the Telnet user will be required to provide a username and password to start the NSH shell.

1.13.7.46 CONFIG_NSH_TELNET_USERNAME: Login Username

  • Type: String
  • Default: "admin"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET, CONFIG_NSH_TELNET_LOGIN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Login user name. Default: "admin"

1.13.7.47 CONFIG_NSH_TELNET_PASSWORD: Login Password

  • Type: String
  • Default: "nuttx"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET, CONFIG_NSH_TELNET_LOGIN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Login password: Default: "nuttx"

1.13.7.48 CONFIG_NSH_TELNET_FAILCOUNT: Login Retry Count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_TELNET, CONFIG_NSH_TELNET_LOGIN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Number of login retry attempts.

1.13.7.49 CONFIG_NSH_DHCPC: Use DHCP to get IP address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_NET && CONFIG_NET_UDP && CONFIG_NET_BROADCAST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Obtain the IP address via DHCP.

    Per RFC2131 (p. 9), the DHCP client must be prepared to receive DHCP messages of up to 576 bytes (excluding Ethernet, IP, or UDP headers and FCS).

1.13.7.50 CONFIG_NSH_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xa0000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_NET && !CONFIG_NSH_DHCPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    If NSH_DHCPC is NOT set, then the static IP address must be provided. This is a 32-bit integer value in host order. So, as an example, 0x10000002 would be 10.0.0.2.

1.13.7.51 CONFIG_NSH_DRIPADDR: Router IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xa0000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_NET && !CONFIG_NSH_DHCPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Default router IP address (aka, Gateway). This is a 32-bit integer value in host order. So, as an example, 0x10000001 would be 10.0.0.1.

1.13.7.52 CONFIG_NSH_NETMASK: Network mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_NET && !CONFIG_NSH_DHCPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Network mask. This is a 32-bit integer value in host order. So, as an example, 0xffffff00 would be 255.255.255.0.

1.13.7.53 CONFIG_NSH_DNS: Use DNS

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_NET && CONFIG_NET_UDP && CONFIG_NET_BROADCAST
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Configure to use a DNS.

1.13.7.54 CONFIG_NSH_DNSIPADDR: DNS IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xa0000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_DNS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Configure the DNS address. This is a 32-bit integer value in host order. So, as an example, 0xa0000001 would be 10.0.0.1.

1.13.7.55 CONFIG_NSH_NOMAC: Hardware has no MAC address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    Set if your ethernet hardware has no built-in MAC address. If set, a bogus MAC will be assigned.

1.13.7.56 CONFIG_NSH_MAX_ROUNDTRIP: Max Ping Round-Trip (DSEC)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NSH_LIBRARY && CONFIG_NET && !CONFIG_NSH_DISABLE_PING
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/nshlib/Kconfig

    This is the maximum round trip for a response to a ICMP ECHO request. It is in units of deciseconds. The default is 20 (2 seconds).

1.13.8 Menu: NxWidgets/NxWM

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/Kconfig

1.13.8.1 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS: Enable NxWidgets

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NX && CONFIG_HAVE_CXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Enable support for NxWidgets

1.13.8.2 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_FLICKERFREE: Enable Flicker Reduction Logic

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER

    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_NX_LCDDRIVER

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Because of their performance an in the manner in which they are updated, LCDs may be prone to "flicker" in the displays when Widgets are updated. Often more complex (and slower) options are availble to reduce the flicker. Enabling this option will enabled those lower-performance flicker-reductions measures where-ever thay may be available.

1.13.8.3 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEVNO: LCD Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    LCD device number (in case there are more than one LCDs connected). Default: 0

1.13.8.4 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_VPLANE: Plane Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Only a single video plane is supported. Default: 0

1.13.8.5 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_SERVERPRIO: NX Server priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 110
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Priority of the NX server. This applies only if NX is configured in multi-user mode (NX_MULTIUSER=y). Default: 110.

    NOTE: Of the three priority definitions here, NXWIDGETS_SERVERPRIO should have the highest priority to avoid data overrun race conditions. Such errors would most likely appear as duplicated rows of data on the display.

1.13.8.6 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_SERVERSTACK: NX Server Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    NX server thread stack size (in multi-user mode). Default 2048

1.13.8.7 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CLIENTPRIO: NX Client Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The thread that calls CNxServer::connect() will be re-prioritized to this priority. This applies only if NX is configured in multi-user mode (NX_MULTIUSER=y). Default: 100

1.13.8.8 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_LISTENERPRIO: NX Listener Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Priority of the NX event listener thread. This applies only if NX is configured in multi-user mode (NX_MULTIUSER=y). Default: 100

1.13.8.9 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_LISTENERSTACK: NX Listener Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    NX listener thread stack size (in multi-user mode). Default 2048

1.13.8.10 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_EXTERNINIT: Extern LCD Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Define to support external display initialization.

1.13.8.11 CONFIG_NXWIDGET_EVENTWAIT: Event Waiting

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Build in support for external window event, modal loop management logic. This includes methods to wait for windows events to occur so that looping logic can sleep until something interesting happens with the window.

1.13.8.12 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_BPP: BPP

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Supported bits-per-pixel {8, 16, 24, 32}. Default: The smallest BPP configuration supported by NX.

1.13.8.13 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_SIZEOFCHAR: Size of a character (1 or 2 bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Range: 1 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Size of character {1 or 2 bytes}. Default Determined by NXWIDGETS_SIZEOFCHAR

1.13.8.14 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_SYSTEM_CUSTOM_FONTID: Use a Custom Default Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Set to override the system default font id (NXFONT_DEFAULT).

1.13.8.15 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_FONTID: Default Font ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_SYSTEM_CUSTOM_FONTID
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Use this default NxWidgets font ID instead of the system font ID (NXFONT_DEFAULT). Default: 0

1.13.8.16 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_TNXARRAY_INITIALSIZE: Initial Size of Dynamic Arrays

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Default dynamic array size (in entries). Default: 16

1.13.8.17 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_TNXARRAY_SIZEINCREMENT: Dyanamic Array Reallocation Size Increment

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Default dynamic array realloctino increment (in entries). Default: 8

1.13.8.18 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS: Custom Default Fill Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom default colors for the widget background. If defined, the hexadecimal values for all filled colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n

1.13.8.19 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_BACKGROUNDCOLOR: Default Normal Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Normal background color. Default: RGB(148,189,215)

1.13.8.20 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_SELECTEDBACKGROUNDCOLOR: Default Selected Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Default selected background color. Default: RGB(206,227,241)

1.13.8.21 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_HIGHLIGHTCOLOR: Default Highlight Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Highlight color. Currently this color is only used in clist boxes, progress bars, and slider grips. Default: RGB(192,192,192)

1.13.8.22 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_EDGECOLORS: Custom Default Edge Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom default colors for the widget edges. If defined, then hexadecimal values for all edge colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n.

1.13.8.23 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_SHINEEDGECOLOR: Default Shiny Edge Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_EDGECOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Shiny side boarder color. Default: RGB(248,248,248)

1.13.8.24 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_SHADOWEDGECOLOR: Default Shadow Edge Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_EDGECOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Shadowed side border color. Default: RGB(35,58,73)

1.13.8.25 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS: Custom Default Text colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom colors for the widget text. If defined, then hexadecimal values for all text colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n.

1.13.8.26 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_DISABLEDTEXTCOLOR: Default Disabled Text Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Text color on a disabled widget: Default: RGB(192,192,192)

1.13.8.27 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_ENABLEDTEXTCOLOR: Default Enabled Text Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Text color on a enabled widget. Default: RGB(248,248,248)

1.13.8.28 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_SELECTEDTEXTCOLOR: Default Selected Text Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Text color on a selected widget. Default: RGB(0,0,0)

1.13.8.29 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DEFAULT_FONTCOLOR: Default Default Font Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS, CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Default font color. Default: RGB(255,255,255)

1.13.8.30 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_TRANSPARENT_COLOR: Transparent Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Transparent color. Default: RGB(0,0,0)

1.13.8.31 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_FIRST_REPEAT_TIME: First Repeat Time

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Time taken before a key starts repeating (in milliseconds). Default: 500

1.13.8.32 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CONTINUE_REPEAT_TIME: Continue Repeat Time

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Time taken before a repeating key repeats again (in milliseconds). Default: 200

1.13.8.33 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_DOUBLECLICK_TIME: Double Click Time

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 350
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Left button release-press time for double click (in milliseconds). Default: 350

1.13.8.34 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_KBDBUFFER_SIZE: Keybard Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Size of incoming character buffer, i.e., the maximum number of characters that can be entered between NX polling cycles without losing data.

1.13.8.35 CONFIG_NXWIDGETS_CURSORCONTROL_SIZE: Cursor Control Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Size of incoming cursor control buffer, i.e., the maximum number of cursor controls that can between entered by NX polling cycles without losing data. Default: 4

1.13.8.36 CONFIG_NXWIDGET_MEMMONITOR: Memory Usage Monitor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Enable memory usage monitor instrumentation. This feature is only used by the NxWidget/NxWM unit tests.

1.13.8.37 CONFIG_NXWM: Enable NxWM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWIDGETS && CONFIG_NX_MULTIUSER
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Enable support for the NuttX Tiny Window Manager (NxWM)

1.13.8.38 CONFIG_NXWM_SYSTEM_CUSTOM_FONTID: Use Custom Default Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Set to override the system default font id (NXFONT_DEFAULT).

1.13.8.39 CONFIG_NXWM_DEFAULT_FONTID: Font ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_SYSTEM_CUSTOM_FONTID
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Use this NxWM default font ID instead of the system font ID (NXFONT_DEFAULT). Default: 0

1.13.8.40 CONFIG_NXWM_UNITTEST: NxWM Unit Test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Enable Hooks for the NxWM Unit Test

1.13.8.41 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS: Custom Default Fill Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom default colors for the widget background. If defined, the hexadecimal values for all filled colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n

1.13.8.42 CONFIG_NXWM_DEFAULT_BACKGROUNDCOLOR: Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Normal background color. Default: RGB(148,189,215)

1.13.8.43 CONFIG_NXWM_DEFAULT_SELECTEDBACKGROUNDCOLOR: Normal Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_FILLCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select background color. Default: RGB(206,227,241)

1.13.8.44 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_EDGECOLORS: Custom Default Edge Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom default colors for the widget edges. If defined, then hexadecimal values for all edge colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n.

1.13.8.45 CONFIG_NXWM_DEFAULT_SHINEEDGECOLOR: Shiny Edge Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_EDGECOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Color of the bright edge of a border. Default: RGB(255,255,255)

1.13.8.46 CONFIG_NXWM_DEFAULT_SHADOWEDGECOLOR: Shadow Edge Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_EDGECOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Color of the shadowed edge of a border. Default: RGB(0,0,0)

1.13.8.47 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS: Custom Default Text colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom colors for the widget text. If defined, then hexadecimal values for all text colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n.

1.13.8.48 CONFIG_NXWM_DEFAULT_FONTCOLOR: Default Font Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Default fong color. Default: RGB(0,0,0)

1.13.8.49 CONFIG_NXWM_TRANSPARENT_COLOR: Transparent Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_TEXTCOLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The "transparent" color. Default: RGB(0,0,0)

1.13.8.50 CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_VSPACING: Vertical Spacing

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Vertical spacing. Default: 2 pixels

1.13.8.51 CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_HSPACING: Horizontal Spacing

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Horizontal spacing. Default: 2 rows

1.13.8.52 Choice: Taskbar Location

  • Default: NXWM_TASKBAR_TOP
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_TOP: Top

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

      Task bar is at the top of the display

    CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_BOTTOM: Bottom

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

      Task bar is at the bottom of the display

    CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_LEFT: Left

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

      Task bar is on the left side of the display

    CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_RIGHT: Right

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
    • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

      Task bar is on the right side of the display

1.13.8.53 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_TASKBAR_WIDTH: Use Custom Taskbar width

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Set to override the default taskbar thickness (either vertical or horizontal). The default depends on the selected horizontal or vertical spacing. Default: 25 + 2*spacing

1.13.8.54 CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_WIDTH: Taskbar Width

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 29
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_TASKBAR_WIDTH
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Task bar thickness (either vertical or horizontal). Default: 25 + 2*2

1.13.8.55 CONFIG_NXWM_DISABLE_MINIMIZE: Disable Minimize Button

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    If the "desktop" is empty, users have no need to minimize any windows. If the buttons are small, it's easy to hit minimize button accidentally when trying to close an application.

1.13.8.56 CONFIG_NXWM_TASKBAR_NO_BORDER: Suppress Taskbar border

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Suppress drawing a the border around the taskbar.

1.13.8.57 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_TOOLBAR_HEIGHT: Use Custom Toolbar Height

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Set to override the default tooldar height The default depends on the selected horizontal or vertical spacing. Default: 21 + 2*spacing

1.13.8.58 CONFIG_NXWM_TOOLBAR_HEIGHT: Toolbar Height

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 25
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_TOOLBAR_HEIGHT
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The height of the tool bar in each application window. At present, all icons are 21 pixels in height and, hence, require a task bar of at least that size. Default: 21 + 2*2

1.13.8.59 CONFIG_NXWM_DISABLE_BACKGROUND_IMAGE: Disable Background Image

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_NXWM_DISABLE_MINIMIZE

    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_NXWM_DISABLE_MINIMIZE

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Disable support for the "Desktop" background image.

1.13.8.60 CONFIG_NXWM_BACKGROUND_IMAGE: Background Image

  • Type: String
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, !CONFIG_NXWM_DISABLE_BACKGROUND_IMAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The name of the image to use in the background window. Default: NXWidgets::g_nuttxBitmap

1.13.8.61 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_APPWINDOW_ICONS: Custom Start/Stop Application Window Icons

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select to override the default Application Window Stop and Minimize Icons.

1.13.8.62 CONFIG_NXWM_STOP_BITMAP: Stop Icon

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NxWM::g_stopBitmap"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_APPWINDOW_ICONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The glyph to use as the Stop icon. Default: NxWM::g_stopBitmap

1.13.8.63 CONFIG_NXWM_MINIMIZE_BITMAP: Minimize Icon

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NxWM::g_minimizeBitmap"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_APPWINDOW_ICONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The glyph to use as the Minimize icon. Default: NxWM::g_minimizeBitmap

1.13.8.64 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_VSPACING: Vertical Spacing

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Vertical spacing. Default: 4 pixels

1.13.8.65 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_HSPACING: Horizontal Spacing

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Horizontal spacing. Default: 4 rows

1.13.8.66 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_STARTWINDOW_ICON: Custom Start Window Icon

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select to override the default Start Window Icon: NxWM::g_playBitmap

1.13.8.67 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_ICON: StartWindow Icon

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NxWM::g_playBitmap"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_STARTWINDOW_ICON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The glyph to use as the start window icon. Default: NxWM::g_playBitmap

1.13.8.68 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_MQNAME: Message Queue Name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/nxwm"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The well known name of the message queue. Used to communicated from CWindowMessenger to the start window thread. Default: "/dev/nxwm"

1.13.8.69 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_MXMSGS: Max Messages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The maximum number of messages to queue before blocking. Defualt 32

1.13.8.70 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_MXMPRIO: Message Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 42
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The message priority. Default: 42.

1.13.8.71 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_PRIO: StartWindow Task Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Priority of the StartWindow task. Default: 100.

    NOTE: This priority should be less than NXWIDGETS_SERVERPRIO or else there may be data overrun errors. Such errors would most likely appear as duplicated rows of data on the display.

1.13.8.72 CONFIG_NXWM_STARTWINDOW_STACKSIZE: StartWindow Task Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The stack size to use when starting the StartWindow task. Default: 2048 bytes.

1.13.8.73 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_PRIO: NxConsole Task Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Priority of the NxConsole task. Default: 100.

    NOTE: This priority should be less than NXWIDGETS_SERVERPRIO or else there may be data overrun errors. Such errors would most likely appear as duplicated rows of data on the display.

1.13.8.74 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_STACKSIZE: NxConsole Task Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The stack size to use when starting the NxConsole task. Default: 2048 bytes.

1.13.8.75 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_CUSTOM_COLORS: Custom NxConsole Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom default colors for the NxConsole window. If defined, the hexadecimal values for all NxConsole colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n

1.13.8.76 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_WCOLOR: NxConsole Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_CUSTOM_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The color of the NxConsole window background. Default: RGB(192,192,192)

1.13.8.77 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_FONTCOLOR: NxConsole Font Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_CUSTOM_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The color of the fonts to use in the NxConsole window. Default: RGB(0,0,0)

1.13.8.78 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_CUSTOM_FONTID: Use Custom Default Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Set to override the system default font id (NXWM_DEFAULT_FONTID).

1.13.8.79 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_FONTID: NxConsole Font ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_CUSTOM_FONTID
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Use this default font ID in the NxConsole window instead of the NxWM font ID (NXWM_DEFAULT_FONTID). Default: 0

1.13.8.80 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_NXCONSOLE_ICON: Custom NxConsole Icon

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select to override the default NxConsole Window Icon: NxWM::g_cmdBitmap

1.13.8.81 CONFIG_NXWM_NXCONSOLE_ICON: NxConsole Icon

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NxWM::g_cmdBitmap"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_NXCONSOLE_ICON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The glyph to use as the NxConsole icon. Default: NxWM::g_cmdBitmap

1.13.8.82 CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN: Touchscreen Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_INPUT

    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_INPUT

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Define to build in touchscreen support.

1.13.8.83 CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN_DEVNO: Touchscreen Device Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Touchscreen device minor number, i.e., the N in /dev/inputN. Default: 0

1.13.8.84 CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN_DEVPATH: Touchscreen Device Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/input0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The full path to the touchscreen device. Default: "/dev/input0"

1.13.8.85 CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN_SIGNO: Touchscreen Signal Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The realtime signal used to wake up the touchscreen listener thread. Default: 5

1.13.8.86 CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN_LISTENERPRIO: Touchscreen Listener Task Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Priority of the touchscreen listener thread. Default: 100

1.13.8.87 CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN_LISTENERSTACK: Touchscreen Listener Task Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_TOUCHSCREEN
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Touchscreen listener thread stack size. Default 1024

1.13.8.88 CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD: Keyboard Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Define to build in touchscreen support.

1.13.8.89 CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD_DEVPATH: Keyboard Device Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/console"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The full path to the touchscreen device. Default: "/dev/console"

1.13.8.90 CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD_SIGNO: Keyboard Task Signal Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The realtime signal used to wake up the touchscreen listener thread. Default: 6

1.13.8.91 CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD_BUFSIZE: Keyboard Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The size of the keyboard read data buffer. Default: 16

1.13.8.92 CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD_LISTENERPRIO: Keyboard Listener Task Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Priority of the touchscreen listener thread. Default: 100

1.13.8.93 CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD_LISTENERSTACK: Keyboard Listener Task Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_KEYBOARD
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Keyboard listener thread stack size. Default: 1024

1.13.8.94 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_CUSTOM_COLORS: Custom Calibration Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom default colors for the calibration window. If defined, the hexadecimal values for all calibration window colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n

1.13.8.95 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_BACKGROUNDCOLOR: Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_CUSTOM_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The background color of the touchscreen calibration display. Default: Same as NXWM_DEFAULT_BACKGROUNDCOLOR.

1.13.8.96 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_LINECOLOR: Line Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_CUSTOM_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The color of the lines used in the touchscreen calibration display. Default: RGB(0, 0, 128) (dark blue)

1.13.8.97 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_CIRCLECOLOR: Normal Circle Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_CUSTOM_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The color of the circle in the touchscreen calibration display. Default: RGB(255, 255, 255) (white)

1.13.8.98 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_TOUCHEDCOLOR: Touched Circle Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_CUSTOM_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The color of the circle in the touchscreen calibration display after the touch is recorder. Default: RGB(255, 255, 96) (very light yellow)

1.13.8.99 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_CALIBRATION_ICON: Custom Calibration Icon

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select to override the default Calibration Window Icon: NxWM::g_calibrationBitmap

1.13.8.100 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_ICON: Callibration Icon

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NxWM::g_calibrationBitmap"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_CALIBRATION_ICON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The ICON to use for the touchscreen calibration application. Default: NxWM::g_calibrationBitmap

1.13.8.101 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_SIGNO: Calibration Signal Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The realtime signal used to wake up the touchscreen calibration thread. Default: 5

1.13.8.102 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_LISTENERPRIO: Calibration Task Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Priority of the calibration listener thread. Default: 100

1.13.8.103 CONFIG_NXWM_CALIBRATION_LISTENERSTACK: Calibration Task Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Calibration listener thread stack size. Default 2048

1.13.8.104 CONFIG_NXWM_HEXCALCULATOR_CUSTOM_COLORS: Custom Hex Calculator Colors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select custom default colors for the Hex Calcualtor window. If defined, the hexadecimal values for all hex calculator colors must be provided (there are no default colors because the hexadecimal representation of the default colors depend on the pixel depth). Default: n

1.13.8.105 CONFIG_NXWM_HEXCALCULATOR_BACKGROUNDCOLOR: Calculator Background Color

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_HEXCALCULATOR_CUSTOM_COLORS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The background color of the calculator display. Default: Same as NXWM_DEFAULT_BACKGROUNDCOLOR

1.13.8.106 CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_HEXCALCULATOR_ICON: Custom Hex Calculator Icon

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Select to override the default Hex Calculator Window Icon: NxWM::g_calculatorBitmap

1.13.8.107 CONFIG_NXWM_HEXCALCULATOR_ICON: Calculator Icon

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NxWM::g_calculatorBitmap"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_CUSTOM_HEXCALCULATOR_ICON
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    The ICON to use for the hex calculator application. Default: "NxWM::g_calculatorBitmap"

1.13.8.108 CONFIG_NXWM_HEXCALCULATOR_CUSTOM_FONTID: Use Custom Default Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Set to override the system default font id (NXWM_DEFAULT_FONTID).

1.13.8.109 CONFIG_NXWM_HEXCALCULATOR_FONTID: Calculator Font ID

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM, CONFIG_NXWM_HEXCALCULATOR_CUSTOM_FONTID
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Use this default font ID in the calculator window instead of the NxWM font ID (NXWM_DEFAULT_FONTID). Default: 0

1.13.8.110 CONFIG_NXWM_MEDIAPLAYER: Enable Media Player

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NXWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/NxWidgets/Kconfig

    Enable support for the MP3 Media Player. This features requires a board that includes an MP3 Codec chip, such as the Mikromedia boards available from MikroElektronica, along with a NuttX port with a device driver for the MP3 codec.

    NOTE: This application is currently under development and just a shell of an app which will be developed soon.

1.13.9 Menu: System NSH Add-Ons

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/Kconfig

1.13.9.1 Menu: Custom Free Memory Command

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.1.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_FREE: NSH free command replacement

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/free/Kconfig

    Enable support for the NSH free replacement command.

1.13.9.2 Menu: I2C tool

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.2.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL: I2C tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Enable support for the I2C tool.

1.13.9.2.2 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MINBUS: Minimum bus number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Smallest bus index supported by the hardware (default 0).

1.13.9.2.3 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MAXBUS: Maximum bus number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Largest bus index supported by the hardware (default 3)

1.13.9.2.4 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MINADDR: Minimum I2C address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x03
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Minium 7-bit device address (default: 0x03)

1.13.9.2.5 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MAXADDR: Maximum I2C address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x77
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Largest 7-bit device address (default: 0x77)

1.13.9.2.6 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MAXREGADDR: Maximum I2C register address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Largest I2C register address (default: 0xff)

1.13.9.2.7 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_DEFFREQ: Default I2C frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Default I2C frequency (default: 4000000)

1.13.9.3 Menu: FLASH Program Installation

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.3.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_INSTALL: FLASH installation tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/install/Kconfig

    Enable support for the FLASH installation tool.

1.13.9.4 Menu: FLASH Erase-all Command

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.4.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_FLASH_ERASEALL: FLASH eraseall tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD && CONFIG_NSH_BUILTIN_APPS && !CONFIG_NUTTX_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/flash_eraseall/Kconfig

    Enable support for the FLASH eraseall tool.

1.13.9.5 Menu: RAM test

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.5.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_RAMTEST: RAM Test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/ramtest/Kconfig

    Enable a simple RAM test.

1.13.9.6 Menu: readline()

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.6.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_READLINE: readline() support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/readline/Kconfig

    Enable support for the readline() function.

1.13.9.6.2 CONFIG_READLINE_ECHO: Echo character input

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_READLINE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/readline/Kconfig

    Echo received character input back via stdout. This is normal behavior and should be selected unless the source of stdin input already has local echo support or you need to suppress the back-channel responses for any other reason.

1.13.9.7 Menu: Power Off

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.7.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_POWEROFF: Power-Off command

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/poweroff/Kconfig

    Enable support for the NSH poweroff command. NOTE: This option provides the NSH power-off command only. It requires board-specific support to actually implement the power-off.

1.13.9.8 Menu: RAMTRON

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.8.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_RAMTRON: RAMTRON command

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/ramtron/Kconfig

    Enable support for the NSH RAMTRON command.

1.13.9.9 Menu: SD Card

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.9.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_SDCARD: NSH sdcard command

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/sdcard/Kconfig

    Enable support for the NSH sdcard command.

1.13.9.10 Menu: Sysinfo

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.10.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_SYSINFO: NSH sysinfo command

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/sysinfo/Kconfig

    Enable support for the NSH sysinfo command.

1.13.9.11 Menu: USB Monitor

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.11.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR: USB Monitor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV && CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE && CONFIG_SYSLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    If USB device tracing is enabled (USBDEV_TRACE), then this option will select the USB monitor. The USB monitor is a daemon that will periodically collect the buffered USB trace data and dump it to the SYSLOG device.

1.13.9.11.2 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_STACKSIZE: USB Monitor daemon stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    The stack size to use the the USB monitor daemon. Default: 2048

1.13.9.11.3 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_PRIORITY: USB Monitor daemon priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    The priority to use the the USB monitor daemon. Default: 50

1.13.9.11.4 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_INTERVAL: USB Monitor dump frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    The rate in seconds that the USB monitor will wait before dumping the next set of buffered USB trace data. Default: 2 seconds.

1.13.9.11.5 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_TRACEINIT: Show initialization events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    Show initialization events

1.13.9.11.6 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_TRACECLASS: Show class driver events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    Show class driver events

1.13.9.11.7 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_TRACETRANSFERS: Show data transfer events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    Show data transfer events

1.13.9.11.8 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_TRACECONTROLLER: Show controller events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    Show controller events

1.13.9.11.9 CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR_TRACEINTERRUPTS: Show interrupt-related events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_USBMONITOR
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/usbmonitor/Kconfig

    Show interrupt-related events

1.13.9.12 Menu: Zmodem Commands

  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/Kconfig

1.13.9.12.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM: Zmodem commands

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    This selection enables the 'sz' and 'rz' NSH commands.

    NOTE: Hardware flow control is required on the selected device in order to throttle the rates of data transfer to fit within the allocated buffers. This cannot be checked here in the configuration because the device that you use may be selected at runtime.

1.13.9.12.2 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_DEVNAME: Default Zmodem device

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/console"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    The default device used by the Zmodem commands if the -d option is not provided on the sz or rz command line. Default: "/dev/console".

    NOTE: This device *MUST* support Hardware flow control in order to throttle the rates of data transfer to fit within the allocated buffers.

1.13.9.12.3 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_RCVBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    The size of one buffer used to read data from the remote peer. The total buffering capability is SYSTEM_ZMODEM_RCVBUFSIZE plus the size of the RX buffer in the device driver. If you are using a serial driver with, say, USART0. That that buffering capability includes USART0_RXBUFFERSIZE. This total buffering capability must be significantly larger than SYSTEM_ZMODEM_PKTBUFSIZE (larger due streaming race conditions, data expansion due to escaping, and possible protocol overhead).

1.13.9.12.4 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_PKTBUFSIZE: Maximum packet size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Data may be received in gulps of varying size and alignment. Received packets data is properly unescaped, aligned and packed into a packet buffer of this size.

1.13.9.12.5 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_SNDBUFSIZE: Send buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    The size of one transmit buffer used for composing messages sent to the remote peer.

1.13.9.12.6 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_MOUNTPOINT: Zmodem sandbox

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/tmp"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Absolute pathes in received file names are not accepted. This configuration value must be set to provide the path to the file storage directory (such as a mountpoint directory).

    Names of file send by the sz commond, on the other hand, must be absolute paths beginning with '/'.

1.13.9.12.7 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_RCVSAMPLE: Reverse channel

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Local sender can sample reverse channel while sending. This means in particular, that Zmodem can detect if data is received from the remote receiver while streaming a file to the remote receiver. Support for such asychronous incoming data notification is needed to support interruption of the file transfer by the remote receiver.

    This capapability is not yet supported. There are only incomplete hooks in the code now! Enable only if you want to see the warning.

1.13.9.12.8 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_SENDATTN: Attn interrupt

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Local sender retains an attention string that will be sent to the remote receiver

    This capapability is not yet supported. There are only incomplete hooks in the code now! Enable only if you want to see the warning.

1.13.9.12.9 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_ALWAYSSINT: Send ZSINIT

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Always send ZSINIT header

1.13.9.12.10 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_TIMESTAMPS: File timestamps

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM, CONFIG_RTC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    File timestamps may be supported

1.13.9.12.11 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_SENDATTN: Send Attn string

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Send attention string not yet supported

1.13.9.12.12 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_SENDBRAK: Can break

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Can not yet send BREAK

1.13.9.12.13 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_RESPTIME: Response time

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Response time for remote peer to respond to requests.

1.13.9.12.14 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_CONNTIME: Rz startup time

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 30
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    When rz starts, it must wait a for the remote end to start the file transfer. This may take longer than the normal response time. This value may be set to tune that longer timeout value.

1.13.9.12.15 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_SERIALNO: Serial number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Receiver serial number

1.13.9.12.16 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_MAXERRORS: Max error

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Max receive errors before canceling the transfer.

1.13.9.12.17 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_WRITESIZE: Write size limit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Some MMC/SD drivers may fail if large transfers are attempted. As a bug workaround, you can set the maximum write size with this configuration. The default value of 0 means no write limit.

1.13.9.12.18 CONFIG_DEBUG_ZMODEM: Zmodem debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Enable Zmodem debug output. This debug is unrelated to the internal NuttX debug option; it does not use the SYSLOG channel but, instead, outputs debug information on stderr. Obviously, enabling this option will likely cause you all kinds of problems if you intend to use /dev/console to transfer files!

1.13.9.12.19 CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM_DUMPBUFFER: Dump buffers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_ZMODEM, CONFIG_DEBUG_ZMODEM
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps-6.29/system/zmodem/Kconfig

    Dump the contents of all incoming and outgoing buffers that are exchanged with the remote peer.

Appendix A: Hidden Configuration Variables

This appendix holds internal configurations variables that are not visible to the user. These settings are presented out-of-context because they cannot be directly controlled by the user. Many of these settings are selected automatically and indirectly when other, visible configuration variables are selected. One purpose of these hidden configuration variables is to control menuing in the kconfig-frontends configuration tool. Many configuration variables with a form like CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_feature, for example, are used only to indicate that the selected archicture supports feature and so addition selection associated with feature will become accessible to the user.

    CONFIG_APPSDIR

    • Type: String
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_NUTTX_NEWCONFIG

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: y
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH

    • Type: String
    • Default Values:
      • Default: "8051"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_8051

      • Default: "arm"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM

      • Default: "avr"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_AVR

      • Default: "hc"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_HC

      • Default: "mips"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS

      • Default: "rgmp"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_RGMP

      • Default: "sh"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_SH

      • Default: "sim"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_SIM

      • Default: "x86"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_X86

      • Default: "z16"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_Z16

      • Default: "z80"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_Z80

    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_ARM926EJS

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_ARM920T

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMVECTORS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY

    • Type: String
    • Default Values:
      • Default: "arm"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM7TDMI || CONFIG_ARCH_ARM926EJS || CONFIG_ARCH_ARM920T

      • Default: "armv6-m"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM0

      • Default: "armv7-a"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXA5

      • Default: "armv7-m"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    • Type: String
    • Default Values:
      • Default: "c5471"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_C5471

      • Default: "calypso"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CALYPSO

      • Default: "dm320"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_DM320

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMX

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC214X

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC2378

      • Default: "lpc31xx"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC31XX

      • Default: "lpc43xx"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LPC43XX

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_NUC1XX

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_SAMA5

      • Default: "sam34"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_SAM34

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STR71X

    • Type: Boolean

      Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX534F064H || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX534F064L || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX564F064H || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX564F064L || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX564F128H || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX564F128L || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX575F256H || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX575F256L || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX575F512H || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX575F512L

    • Type: Integer
    • Default: 28
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_MIPS, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_PIC32MX , CONFIG_PIC32MX_ETHERNET
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/mips/src/pic32mx/Kconfig

      Ethernet interrupt priority. The is default is the higest priority.
